About the Summit

Artificial Intelligence (AI) stands at the threshold of fundamentally reshaping human civilization, pushing the boundaries of what we can achieve. This technological revolution opens unprecedented opportunities for advancements across every domain of human endeavor, while profoundly challenging the very foundations of society in an increasingly complex and evolving geopolitical order. For developing countries, AI offers an unprecedented opportunity to leapfrog traditional developmental pathways. The multi-modal and multi-lingual capabilities of AI create new possibilities through which access to benefits can be made available at scale. As a result, AI is seen not merely as a technological advancement but as a strategic tool to enable inclusive growth and expand access to opportunities that have historically been out of reach for large segments of the population.

Recognizing this transformative potential, the past four years have witnessed a remarkable surge in multilateral initiatives dedicated to harnessing AI's potential responsibly and equitably. From the G20 AI Principles to the UN and Global Partnership on AI (GPAI) Resolutions on AI, the African Declaration on AI, and most recently, the Hamburg Declaration on Responsible AI, these efforts reflect unprecedented international recognition that AI's transformative impact transcends borders and requires coordinated global action.

Despite these high-level commitments, a fundamental gap persists between global aspirations and the reality on the ground. The Global AI Divide continues to widen, with AI resources and capabilities concentrated among select nations and corporations. This concentration fundamentally limits the development of social, cultural, and linguistically contextual AI solutions, constraining AI's potential to accelerate progress toward our collective development goals, especially for the Global South.

Simultaneously, AI's rapid proliferation across society is creating new challenges that demand urgent attention: disrupting traditional employment patterns, exacerbating existing biases, and driving exponential increases in energy consumption. These developments underscore the urgent need to move beyond aspirational frameworks toward concrete, measurable impact that addresses both AI's promise and its perils.

The Mantra: A Time for Impact

The India–AI Impact Summit 2026, announced by Hon’ble Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the France AI Action Summit and scheduled for February 19–20 in New Delhi, will be the first-ever global AI summit hosted in the Global South.

Building on the momentum of leading international forums such as the UK AI Safety Summit, the AI Seoul Summit, the France AI Action Summit, and the Global AI Summit on Africa, this high-level convening marks a critical inflection point. It will strengthen existing multilateral initiatives while advancing new priorities, deliverables, and cooperative frameworks—moving from high-level political statements to demonstrable impact and tangible progress in global AI cooperation.

The Summit charts a path towards a future where the transformative power of AI serves humanity, drives inclusive growth, fosters social development, and promotes people-centric innovations that protect our planet. It also seeks to amplify the voice of the Global South, ensuring that technological advancements and opportunities are shared broadly, not concentrated in a few regions.

At the same time, AI’s rapid proliferation across society poses urgent challenges—disrupting traditional employment patterns, exacerbating biases, and accelerating energy consumption. These developments highlight the pressing need to go beyond aspirational frameworks and deliver measurable, concrete impact that addresses both the promise and the perils of AI.

The Three Sutras

The India - AI Impact Summit will be anchored on three foundational pillars, known as 'Sutras'—a Sanskrit term meaning guiding principles or essential threads that weave together wisdom and action. These three Sutras define how AI can be harnessed through multilateral cooperation for collective benefit

People

The People Sutra envisions AI as a force for human progress—respecting cultural diversity, preserving dignity, and ensuring inclusion in its design and deployment. It affirms that technology must remain human-centred, advance people-first development while upholding safety, trust, and shared benefit.

Planet

The Planet Sutra calls for AI that advances innovation responsibly—reducing its resource footprint while accelerating climate resilience and environmental protection. It upholds that technological progress must align with planetary stewardship, ensuring AI strengthens rather than undermines global sustainability.

Progress

The Progress Sutra envisages AI as an engine for inclusive growth—aligning its benefits with global development priorities and equitable access to opportunity. It emphasizes democratizing key AI resources and applying AI to accelerate socio-economic progress across sectors such as health, education, governance, and agriculture.

The Seven Chakras

Building upon the three foundational Sutras, the deliberations at the AI Impact Summit will be organized around seven interconnected Chakras, areas of multilateral cooperation designed to channel collective energy toward holistic societal transformation. These Seven Chakras represent focused domains of international collaboration that translate the broader principles of People, Planet, and Progress into concrete areas of action:

Human Capital

Inclusion for Social Empowerment

Safe and Trusted AI

Resilience, Innovation, and Efficiency

Science

Democratizing AI Resources

AI for Economic Growth and Social Good

Each Chakra represents a distinct yet interconnected sphere of multilateral engagement through which the transformative potential of AI can be harnessed to deliver tangible benefits aligned with the three Sutras. Together, they offer a comprehensive framework that enables countries, international organizations, and stakeholders to coordinate AI deployment strategies that enable the maximization of collective benefits while still addressing shared challenges.

Safe & Trusted AI

As AI reshapes economies and societies, concerns around safety, transparency, and trust call for robust, technology-enabled safeguards that can match the sophistication and scale of modern AI systems. The Safe & Trusted AI Chakra seeks to close this governance gap by empowering all nations to participate meaningfully in AI oversight while supporting continued innovation and technological advancement.

Human Capital

AI is transforming the global employment landscape, creating new opportunities while disrupting traditional jobs and skills. Fragmented responses, absence of global AI literacy standards, and insufficient investment in workforce transition threaten to deepen the "AI divide." The Human Capital Chakra addresses these challenges by advancing equitable skilling, inclusive workforce transition, and broad sharing of AI-driven productivity gains.

Science

AI is reshaping how science is done, from genomics and drug discovery to climate and materials research. The Science Chakra aims to promote AI in frontier science research and translate breakthroughs into inclusive, real-world impact through strengthening global scientific collaboration, establishing clear scientific norms and transparency standards for AI in research.

Resilience, Innovation & Efficiency

As AI infrastructure expands, its heavy environmental and energy footprint threatens climate resilience and inclusive growth across the world. The Resilience, Innovation & Efficiency Chakra promotes frugal, adaptable and sustainable AI, lightweight modular systems that work in low-resource contexts without compromising impact and performance.

Inclusion for Social Empowerment

AI technologies hold immense potential for advancing socio-economic outcomes – provided appropriate measures are taken to ensure their design, development, and deployment are inclusive. The Inclusion for Social Empowerment Chakra at the AI Impact Summit 2026 is to encourage design, development, and deployment of AI systems that actively account for and accommodate the diverse needs, identities, and experiences of all users.

Democratizing AI Resources

The growing demands of AI development require vast infrastructure—compute and hardware, data infrastructure—that are concentrated in a few regions today, reinforcing global inequalities in innovation capacity. The Democratizing AI Resources Chakra seeks to democratize these foundational infrastructure resources through improving affordability, access and demand for all nations to foster inclusive technological progress.

Economic Growth & Social Good

AI holds significant potential to catalyse economic growth and advance inclusive societal progress. The Economic Growth and Social Good Chakra at the AI Impact Summit 2026 seeks to promote AI-driven pathways that not only strengthen service delivery and access in critical sectors but also generate measurable contributions to productivity, innovation, and growth, thereby advancing inclusive and equitable development.

The Impact of AI

Achieving this vision requires global consensus on how AI is developed and applied in ways that serve the Planet, its People, and the Progress of all. This includes rethinking how data is managed, how AI models are designed and deployed, and how these technologies are integrated into our social and economic fabric. The India AI Summit aims to build consensus on all these issues so that AI’s Impact is realized equitably by all.

The AI Impact Summit represents more than a gathering of leaders; it embodies a commitment to amplify the positive impact of AI. Through the three foundational Sutras and seven focused Chakras, the global community will forge concrete pathways that ensure AI serves the Planet, empowers all People, and accelerates Progress for every nation.

Agenda

AI IMPACT SUMMIT 2026

Stay updated with the day-by-day agenda of plenaries, expos, roundtables, and leadership engagements.

The agenda is tentative and subject to revisions.

16 February 2026, Monday

High-impact keynote addresses, policy-focused panel discussions and expert roundtables will set the intellectual foundation of the Summit. The India AI Expo will be inaugurated, bringing together innovators, startups, industry leaders and public institutions under one roof. The day will frame national priorities, spark collaborations, and shape the strategic AI discourse for the days ahead.

View Details

17 February 2026, Tuesday

High-level panel discussions will continue, deepening sectoral dialogues across priority domains. The day will feature the launch of flagship Knowledge Compendiums — including the Casebooks on AI in Health, Energy, Education, Agriculture, Gender Empowerment and Disabilities — alongside a focused Seminar on Applied AI.

View Details

18 February 2026, Wednesday

The day bridges research and practice. The Research Symposium convenes leading academics, researchers and think tanks to showcase cutting-edge AI research, emerging methodologies and evidence-based policy insights. Dedicated Industry Sessions bring together global technology leaders, startups and sector champions to present scalable solutions, real-world deployments and future-ready innovations.

View Details

19 February 2026, Thursday

The Formal Opening Ceremony is led by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India. A high-level CEO Roundtable convenes global industry leaders, investors and policymakers to deliberate on strategic priorities, investment pathways and the future of responsible AI. The Leaders’ Plenary brings together national and international decision-makers to shape collective commitments, strengthen global partnerships and define India’s leadership in the AI decade ahead.

View Details

20 February 2026, Friday

High-level GPAI Council Meetings convene member countries to review progress, align priorities and strengthen multilateral cooperation on responsible and inclusive AI. The Leaders’ Declaration is adopted, affirming collective commitments and outlining a shared roadmap for global AI governance and collaboration.

View Details

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you using AI to transform healthcare in the Global South?

Here's your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the

India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026

The

IndiaAI Mission

, in collaboration with the

World Health Organization (WHO)

, invites submissions for a

Casebook on AI in Health

— a collection of real-world, scalable AI solutions improving health outcomes across the Global South.

The Casebook will be launched at the

AI Impact Summit 2026

, showcasing ground-breaking innovations, measurable impact, and key lessons from AI applications in global health.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you using AI to transform healthcare in the Global South?

Here's your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the

India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026.

The

IndiaAI Mission

, in collaboration with the

World Health Organization (WHO)

, invites submissions for a

Casebook on AI in Health

— a collection of real-world, scalable AI solutions improving health outcomes across the Global South.

The Casebook will be launched at the

AI Impact Summit 2026

, showcasing ground-breaking innovations, measurable impact, and key lessons from AI applications in global health.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Objectives

Key Details

Who can Apply?

Researchers, innovators, practitioners, and experts with successful, scalable, and impactful AI health use cases from the Global South.

What is in It for You:

Opportunity to author a chapter in the Casebook on AI Health Use Cases Across the Global South.

Feature at the India - AI Impact Summit 2026 before a global audience of policymakers, innovators, and health leaders.

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you using AI to improve crop planning, strengthen farm operations, expand market access, or improve financial resilience for farmers?

Here’s your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026.

The IndiaAI Mission, in collaboration with the Government of Maharashtra’s AI and Agritech Innovation Center and supported by the World Bank, invites use case submissions for a Casebook on the Real-World Impact of AI in Agriculture - a collection of deployed, scalable AI solutions delivering measurable value to farmers and agricultural systems.

The Compendium will be unveiled at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, spotlighting transformative AI innovations, demonstrated farmer impact, and lessons that can guide agri-innovation globally.

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you using AI to improve crop planning, strengthen farm operations, expand market access, or improve financial resilience for farmers?

Here’s your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026.

The IndiaAI Mission, in collaboration with the Government of Maharashtra’s AI and Agritech Innovation Center and supported by the World Bank, invites use case submissions for a Casebook on the Real-World Impact of AI in Agriculture - a collection of deployed, scalable AI solutions delivering measurable value to farmers and agricultural systems.

The Compendium will be unveiled at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, spotlighting transformative AI innovations, demonstrated farmer impact, and lessons that can guide agri-innovation globally.

Objectives

Key Details

Indicative Sub-Themes

Intelligent Crop Planning: Climate-aware and market-aligned planning at macro and micro levels.

Smart Farming and Precision Agriculture: Soil health insights, pest prediction, disease detection, irrigation optimization.

Farm-to-Fork Market Linkages: Price forecasting, assaying, quality grading, traceability, and digital marketplaces.

Financial Inclusion & Insurance: AI-driven credit assessments, parametric insurance, and livelihood security tools.

Who Can Apply?

Researchers, innovators, practitioners, and experts with successful, scalable, inclusive, ethical and impactful AI use cases in agriculture from around the world.

What Is in It for You

Opportunity to author a chapter in the Casebook on the Real-World Impact of Artificial Intelligence in Agriculture.

Feature at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026 before a global audience of policymakers, agritech leaders, and development partners.

Key Dates

Call for Case Studies Opens: 8 December 2025

Screening and Evaluation: December 2025 - January 2026

Compendium Launch: 16–20 February 2026

Last date for submissions: 11th January 2026

How to Apply:

Applicants may refer to the detailed Submission Guidelines for instructions on structure, format, and evaluation.

All queries or clarifications must be emailed to

fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in

and

ai4-agri[at]mah[dot]gov[dot]in

using the subject line: "Call for

Use Case: Agriculture

- Query - [Author Name]".

The

Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY),

invites submissions for a compendium documenting and disseminating real-world, scalable, and gender-responsive AI solutions developed or deployed in the Global South.

Submit your abstract today and be part of the global movement shaping the future of inclusive AI for gender equality!

About the Event

Are you using AI to transform healthcare in the Global South?

Here's your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the

India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026

The

IndiaAI Mission

, in collaboration with the

World Health Organization (WHO)

, invites submissions for a

Casebook on AI in Health

— a collection of real-world, scalable AI solutions improving health outcomes across the Global South.

The Casebook will be launched at the

AI Impact Summit 2026

, showcasing ground-breaking innovations, measurable impact, and key lessons from AI applications in global health.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

About the Event

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you deploying an AI solution that is transforming the lives of women and girls through measurable gender impact, ethical design, and replicability?

Share your work and influence global policy at the India AI Impact Summit 2026!

The

Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY),

Government of India in collaboration with

UN Women India,

invites submissions for a compendium documenting and disseminating real-world, scalable, and gender-responsive AI solutions developed or deployed in the Global South.

Selected case studies will be published in the compendium and showcased at the India AI Impact Summit.

Submit your abstract today and be part of the global movement shaping the future of inclusive AI for gender equality!

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you deploying an AI solution that is transforming the lives of women and girls through measurable gender impact, ethical design, and replicability?

Share your work and influence global policy at the India AI Impact Summit 2026!

The

Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY),

Government of India in collaboration with

UN Women India,

invites submissions for a compendium documenting and disseminating real-world, scalable, and gender-responsive AI solutions developed or deployed in the Global South.

Selected case studies will be published in the compendium and showcased at the India AI Impact Summit.

Submit your abstract today and be part of the global movement shaping the future of inclusive AI for gender equality!

Objectives

Key Details

Who can Apply?

Researchers, innovators, practitioners, organisations, and experts are developing scalable, gender-responsive AI solutions deployed in countries of the Global South.

What is in It for You:

Opportunity to author a chapter on the theme of AI and Gender Empowerment Casebook in a Compendium, jointly produced by MeitY and UN Women

Showcase your solution at the AI Impact Summit 2026 in India before a global audience of policymakers, innovators, and leaders

Inclusion in a high-visibility publication distributed  across UN, IndiaAI and global innovation and policy networks

Key Dates

Last date for Abstract Submission: 15th December 2025

Shortlisting of Contributors By: 25th December 2025

Drafting of Chapters: 25th January 2026

Compendium Launch: 16-20 February 2026 at the India - AI Impact Summit 2026

How to Apply:

Please refer to the

Submission Guidelines

for full requirements, template and word limits.

All queries or clarifications must be emailed to

fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in

and

info[at]unwomen[dot]org

using the subject line: "Gender & AI Compendium – Query - [Author Name]".

Are you using AI to transform learning outcomes, strengthen teaching, or improve access to quality education?

Here's your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026.

The IndiaAI Mission, in collaboration with Central Square Foundation and EkStep Foundation, invites use case submissions for a Casebook on the Real-World Impact of AI in Education—a collection of real-world, scalable AI solutions enhancing educational impact.

The Compendium will be unveiled at the India - AI Impact Summit 2026, showcasing ground-breaking AI innovations, measurable impact, and key lessons across the global education landscape.

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you using AI to transform learning outcomes, strengthen teaching, or improve access to quality education?

Here's your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026.

The IndiaAI Mission, in collaboration with Central Square Foundation and EkStep Foundation, invites use case submissions for a Casebook on the Real-World Impact of AI in Education—a collection of real-world, scalable AI solutions enhancing educational impact.

The Compendium will be unveiled at the India - AI Impact Summit 2026, showcasing ground-breaking AI innovations, measurable impact, and key lessons across the global education landscape.

Objectives

Key Details

Who can Apply?

Researchers, innovators, practitioners, and experts with successful, scalable, inclusive, ethical and impactful AI use cases in Education from around the world.

What is in It for You:

Opportunity to author a chapter in the Casebook On Real-World Impact of Artificial Intelligence in Education.

Feature at the AI Impact Summit 2026 in India before a global audience of policymakers, innovators, and Ed-Tech innovators.

Key Dates

Call for Case Studies Opens: 8 December 2025

Screening and Evaluation: December - January 2025

Casebook Launch: 16–20 February 2026

Last date for submissions: 5th January 2026

How to Apply:

Applicants may refer to Submission Guidelines for further details.

All queries or clarifications must be emailed to

fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in

using the subject line: "Call for

Use Case: Education

- Query - [Author Name]".

Are you using AI to transform healthcare in the Global South?

Here's your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the

India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026

The

IndiaAI Mission

, in collaboration with the

World Health Organization (WHO)

, invites submissions for a

Casebook on AI in Health

— a collection of real-world, scalable AI solutions improving health outcomes across the Global South.

The Casebook will be launched at the

AI Impact Summit 2026

, showcasing ground-breaking innovations, measurable impact, and key lessons from AI applications in global health.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you using AI to transform healthcare in the Global South?

Here's your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the

India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026.

The

IndiaAI Mission

, in collaboration with the

World Health Organization (WHO)

, invites submissions for a

Casebook on AI in Health

— a collection of real-world, scalable AI solutions improving health outcomes across the Global South.

The Casebook will be launched at the

AI Impact Summit 2026

, showcasing ground-breaking innovations, measurable impact, and key lessons from AI applications in global health.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Objectives

Key Details

Who can Apply?

Researchers, innovators, practitioners, and experts with successful, scalable, and impactful AI health use cases from the Global South.

What is in It for You:

Opportunity to author a chapter in the Casebook on AI Health Use Cases Across the Global South.

Feature at the India - AI Impact Summit 2026 before a global audience of policymakers, innovators, and health leaders.

Key Dates

Last date for Abstract Submission: 30th November, 2025, 11:59 PM IST

Drafting of Chapters: November – December 2025

Casebook Launch: 16–20 February 2026

How to Apply:

Applicants may refer to Submission Guidelines for further details.

All queries or clarifications must be emailed to

fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in

using the subject line: "Call for Abstracts - Query - [Author Name]".

Are you using AI to improve crop planning, strengthen farm operations, expand market access, or improve financial resilience for farmers?

Here’s your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026.

The IndiaAI Mission, in collaboration with the Government of Maharashtra’s AI and Agritech Innovation Center and supported by the World Bank, invites use case submissions for a Casebook on the Real-World Impact of AI in Agriculture - a collection of deployed, scalable AI solutions delivering measurable value to farmers and agricultural systems.

The Compendium will be unveiled at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, spotlighting transformative AI innovations, demonstrated farmer impact, and lessons that can guide agri-innovation globally.

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you using AI to improve crop planning, strengthen farm operations, expand market access, or improve financial resilience for farmers?

Here’s your opportunity to showcase your innovation to a global audience at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026.

The IndiaAI Mission, in collaboration with the Government of Maharashtra’s AI and Agritech Innovation Center and supported by the World Bank, invites use case submissions for a Casebook on the Real-World Impact of AI in Agriculture - a collection of deployed, scalable AI solutions delivering measurable value to farmers and agricultural systems.

The Compendium will be unveiled at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, spotlighting transformative AI innovations, demonstrated farmer impact, and lessons that can guide agri-innovation globally.

Objectives

Key Details

Indicative Sub-Themes

Intelligent Crop Planning: Climate-aware and market-aligned planning at macro and micro levels.

Smart Farming and Precision Agriculture: Soil health insights, pest prediction, disease detection, irrigation optimization.

Farm-to-Fork Market Linkages: Price forecasting, assaying, quality grading, traceability, and digital marketplaces.

Financial Inclusion & Insurance: AI-driven credit assessments, parametric insurance, and livelihood security tools.

Who Can Apply?

Researchers, innovators, practitioners, and experts with successful, scalable, inclusive, ethical and impactful AI use cases in agriculture from around the world.

What Is in It for You

Opportunity to author a chapter in the Casebook on the Real-World Impact of Artificial Intelligence in Agriculture.

Feature at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026 before a global audience of policymakers, agritech leaders, and development partners.

Key Dates

Call for Case Studies Opens: 8 December 2025

Screening and Evaluation: December 2025 - January 2026

Compendium Launch: 16–20 February 2026

Last date for submissions: 11th January 2026

How to Apply:

Applicants may refer to the detailed Submission Guidelines for instructions on structure, format, and evaluation.

All queries or clarifications must be emailed to

fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in

and

ai4-agri[at]mah[dot]gov[dot]in

using the subject line: "Call for

Use Case: Agriculture

- Query - [Author Name]".

Are you deploying an AI solution that is transforming the lives of women and girls through measurable gender impact, ethical design, and replicability?

Share your work and influence global policy at the India AI Impact Summit 2026!

The

Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY),

Government of India in collaboration with

UN Women India,

invites submissions for a compendium documenting and disseminating real-world, scalable, and gender-responsive AI solutions developed or deployed in the Global South.

Selected case studies will be published in the compendium and showcased at the India AI Impact Summit.

Submit your abstract today and be part of the global movement shaping the future of inclusive AI for gender equality!

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you deploying an AI solution that is transforming the lives of women and girls through measurable gender impact, ethical design, and replicability?

Share your work and influence global policy at the India AI Impact Summit 2026!

The

Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY),

Government of India in collaboration with

UN Women India,

invites submissions for a compendium documenting and disseminating real-world, scalable, and gender-responsive AI solutions developed or deployed in the Global South.

Selected case studies will be published in the compendium and showcased at the India AI Impact Summit.

Submit your abstract today and be part of the global movement shaping the future of inclusive AI for gender equality!

Objectives

Key Details

Who can Apply?

Researchers, innovators, practitioners, organisations, and experts are developing scalable, gender-responsive AI solutions deployed in countries of the Global South.

What is in It for You:

Opportunity to author a chapter on the theme of AI and Gender Empowerment Casebook in a Compendium, jointly produced by MeitY and UN Women

Showcase your solution at the AI Impact Summit 2026 in India before a global audience of policymakers, innovators, and leaders

Inclusion in a high-visibility publication distributed  across UN, IndiaAI and global innovation and policy networks

Key Dates

Last date for Abstract Submission: 15th December 2025

Shortlisting of Contributors By: 25th December 2025

Drafting of Chapters: 25th January 2026

Compendium Launch: 16-20 February 2026 at the India - AI Impact Summit 2026

How to Apply:

Please refer to the

Submission Guidelines

for full requirements, template and word limits.

All queries or clarifications must be emailed to

fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in

and

info[at]unwomen[dot]org

using the subject line: "Gender & AI Compendium – Query - [Author Name]".

Are you using Artificial Intelligence to enhance accessibility, independence, and inclusion for persons with disabilities?

Here is an opportunity to showcase your work to a global audience at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026.

The IndiaAI Mission, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India, in collaboration with the Artificial Limbs Manufacturing Corporation of India (ALIMCO), IIIT B and ChangeInkk Foundation, invites submissions for a Casebook on the Real-World Impact of AI in Improving Inclusion for Persons with Disabilities. The casebook will bring together deployed and scalable AI solutions that have demonstrated tangible improvements in accessibility, autonomy, participation, and quality of life for persons with disabilities.

The compendium will be unveiled at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, highlighting real-world innovations, measurable outcomes, and transferable lessons from across geographies.

About the Event

Download Submission Guidelines

Are you using Artificial Intelligence to enhance accessibility, independence, and inclusion for persons with disabilities?

Here is an opportunity to showcase your work to a global audience at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, to be held in February 2026.

The IndiaAI Mission, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India, in collaboration with the Artificial Limbs Manufacturing Corporation of India (ALIMCO), IIIT B and ChangeInkk Foundation, invites submissions for a Casebook on the Real-World Impact of AI in Improving Inclusion for Persons with Disabilities. The casebook will bring together deployed and scalable AI solutions that have demonstrated tangible improvements in accessibility, autonomy, participation, and quality of life for persons with disabilities.

The compendium will be unveiled at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, highlighting real-world innovations, measurable outcomes, and transferable lessons from across geographies.

Objectives

Key Details

Indicative Sub-Themes

Assistive Technology and Smart Mobility: AI-enabled prosthetics, navigation systems for visually impaired users, and intelligent mobility aids.

Communication and Sensory Augmentation: Speech-to-text, sign language interpretation, and AI-driven sensory enhancement tools.

Inclusive Employment and Education: AI-based skill development, adaptive learning systems, and bias-mitigation tools for neurodiverse and disabled persons.

Independent Living and Healthcare: Smart home systems, predictive health monitoring, and AI-enabled care assistants.

Who Can Apply?

Researchers, innovators, practitioners, start-ups, public sector entities, and experts with successful, scalable, inclusive, ethical, and impactful AI use cases for persons with disabilities, from across the world.

What Is in It for You

Opportunity to author a chapter in the Casebook on the Real-World Impact of AI in Improving Inclusion for Persons with Disabilities.

Feature at the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, before a global audience of policymakers, technology leaders, and development partners.

Key Dates

Call for Case Studies Opens: 22 December 2025

Screening and Evaluation: December 2025 - January 2026

Compendium Launch: 15–20 February 2026

Last date for submissions: 15th January 2026

How to Apply:

Applicants are requested to refer to the Submission Guidelines for details on format, structure, and evaluation criteria.

All queries or clarifications must be emailed to

fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in

using the subject line: "Call for

Use Case: PwD

- Query - [Author Name]".

AI for ALL: 
 Global Impact Challenge

Thank you for the exceptional response! Applications are now under evaluation.

About the Challenge

The AI for ALL: Global Impact Challenge strives to identify solutions that use AI to enable large-scale impact. The leading solutions get showcased at the India - AI Impact Summit to be held in New Delhi, India in February 2026. This initiative is being implemented in partnership with Startup India under the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), Ministry of Commerce and Industry and Digital India BHASHINI Division.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Download Submission Guidelines

Key Objectives

Identify High Quality Solutions

Spotlight high quality, AI-driven innovations addressing unmet global needs across sectors

Inspire Adoption and Scale

Amplify AI innovations through global visibility, recognition, and ecosystem support

Build Strategic Partnerships

Foster meaningful connections between global innovators, and enabling organizations to drive sustained impact

Indicative Themes

We welcome all innovative AI solutions that are widely deployable, demonstrate high potential value at large scale, and address critical needs across diverse sectors. 
Below themes are indicative.

Healthcare

AI Solutions for addressing healthcare worker shortages, access to health services in remote and rural areas, efficient resource utilization, and insurance-related inefficiencies

Manufacturing

AI solutions aimed at enhancing operational efficiency and solving industry challenges such as frequent equipment breakdowns, unplanned downtime, high variability in product quality, inefficient resource utilization, and vulnerability to supply-chain disruptions

Urban Infrastructure and mobility

AI solutions for traffic management, waste management, and last-mile connectivity

Wild Card/Open Innovation

An open track for novel AI solutions (cross sector or otherwise) with transformative potential for scale and impact.

Agriculture

AI Solutions for pressing agriculture challenges such as declining crop productivity due to climate unpredictability, post-harvest losses, resource management, and access to timely market insights

Climate and sustainability

AI Solutions for addressing sustainability and resilience challenges, including extreme weather events, emissions reduction, and sustainable resource management

Education

AI Solutions for equitable access to quality learning resources, addressing geographical and demographic learning gaps, lack of capacity and personnel to deliver personalized instruction, and digital divide

Financial Inclusion

AI Solutions such as enhancing credit access for migrants, gig workers, MSMEs, and informal communities, addressing financial fraud in digital payment systems, and low financial literacy among marginalized groups

Healthcare

AI Solutions for addressing healthcare worker shortages, access to health services in remote and rural areas, efficient resource utilization, and insurance-related inefficiencies

Manufacturing

AI solutions aimed at enhancing operational efficiency and solving industry challenges such as frequent equipment breakdowns, unplanned downtime, high variability in product quality, inefficient resource utilization, and vulnerability to supply-chain disruptions

Urban Infrastructure and mobility

AI solutions for traffic management, waste management, and last-mile connectivity

Wild Card/Open Innovation

An open track for novel AI solutions (cross sector or otherwise) with transformative potential for scale and impact.

Agriculture

AI Solutions for pressing agriculture challenges such as declining crop productivity due to climate unpredictability, post-harvest losses, resource management, and access to timely market insights

Climate and sustainability

AI Solutions for addressing sustainability and resilience challenges, including extreme weather events, emissions reduction, and sustainable resource management

Education

AI Solutions for equitable access to quality learning resources, addressing geographical and demographic learning gaps, lack of capacity and personnel to deliver personalized instruction, and digital divide

Financial Inclusion

AI Solutions such as enhancing credit access for migrants, gig workers, MSMEs, and informal communities, addressing financial fraud in digital payment systems, and low financial literacy among marginalized groups

02

03

Who can apply to this challenge?

• Researchers: From universities, autonomous bodies, or research institutions
• Companies and Start-ups: Registered businesses, recognized start-ups, and non-profit entities

Is the challenge open to people from any country?

Can I apply to the other challenges?

Yes, you can apply to all three challenges if you meet the required eligibility criteria

Can I submit an existing solution, or does it need to be new?

You can submit AI solutions that are pilot-ready (solutions that are ready for or have completed pilot) or already scaling (solutions with presence in the market).

What must be the stage of my solution?

How will my solutions be evaluated?

All the solutions will be evaluated on the basis of: Solution Definition, Technical Feasibility, Business Model, Team Competence, and Potential Impact by leading industry experts

Do I retain intellectual property?

Yes, intellectual property remains with the participants.

How will the applicants receive the award money?

Award money shall be credited to the bank account of the registered entity under which the AI solution is registered. If the participating team has not yet registered themselves as a Company or Startup they can still participate. However, they will be required to be registered as a Company or Startup before the Summit to be eligible for receiving the award money. All award money is subject to applicable taxes and deductions under Indian laws.

What support is available beyond award money?

Finalists will have access to:
• Global Exposure: Opportunity to present your solution to an audience of leaders and experts at the AI Impact Summit
• Networking and Mentorship: Opportunity to connect with and receive mentorship, funding and scaling opportunities support from leading investors and ecosystem experts.
• Valuable Resources: Access to potential compute and cloud credits to further develop, deploy and scale your solutions.

Are travel and accommodation covered for finalists who make it to the India AI Impact Summit?

Yes, the travel and accommodation for top 20 teams (up to 2 members per team) will be covered by the India AI Impact Summit team.

Two team members will be invited to represent the shortlisted AI solution during the Summit

AI by HER: 
 Global Impact Challenge

Thank you for the exceptional response! Applications are now under evaluation.

About the Challenge

AI by HER: The Impact Challenge for Women in AI is a global innovation challenge inviting women technologists to demonstrate AI solutions tackling large scale or novel real-world public challenges. This initiative is being implemented in partnership with NITI Aayog- Women Entrepreneurship Platform. 

Focused on inclusive innovation and global impact, this initiative promotes gender equity, Global South innovation, and aims to showcase scalable AI-for-good applications at the India-AI Impact Summit to be held in New Delhi, India, in February 2026.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Download Submission Guidelines

Key Objectives

Identify Women-Led Teams

Identify women-led teams globally working on innovative and impactful AI centric solutions addressing real-world challenges.

Build a Dedicated Support Pipeline

Establish a dedicated support pipeline for women-led AI innovations, including mentorship, visibility, and post-event scale-up opportunities. Conduct two virtual bootcamps: Responsible AI and Investor Readiness & Pitching Sessions.

Create a Platform

Create a platform for the top teams (up to 30 globally) to present at the India-AI Impact Summit.

Curate an Exclusive Investor Pitch Session

Curate an exclusive Investor Pitch Session for these (up to 30 globally) high-potential women-led AI solutions.

Indicative Themes

We welcome innovative AI solutions that are scalable, broadly deployable, and capable of delivering significant public value across diverse sectors. The thematic areas outlined below are indicative, and applicants are encouraged to propose any solution that demonstrates clear societal impact.

Education

AI that personalizes, democratizes, and scales learning, including adaptive algorithms, multimodal content, speech recognition in underrepresented languages, and intelligent tutors, closing gaps and supporting lifelong learning.

Health

AI that improves care through medical imaging, predictive analytics, digital biomarkers, federated learning, and AI enabled telemedicine, with a focus on accessibility, affordability, and scalable adoption across diverse systems.

Energy & Climate

AI across the energy spectrum, from conventional to renewables, for predictive maintenance, grid optimization, and demand forecasting, with climate uses like geospatial weather prediction, digital twins for resilient infrastructure, emissions tracking, and ecosystem conservation.

Wildcard / Open Innovation

An open track for novel, cross sector AI ideas that do not fit above themes, encouraging interdisciplinary work in governance, manufacturing, urban development, healthcare, and other emerging areas that show clear public value.

Cybersecurity, Safety & Digital Wellbeing

AI for trusted digital participation, covering anomaly detection, intrusion prevention, privacy preserving identity, and NLP tools to counter misinformation or harassment, plus behavioral modeling and sentiment analysis for mental wellbeing at scale.

Agriculture

AI for food security and sustainable farming, including precision agriculture, drone or satellite monitoring, yield prediction, automated pest and disease detection, blockchain based supply chains, and edge AI for resource use.

Education

AI that personalizes, democratizes, and scales learning, including adaptive algorithms, multimodal content, speech recognition in underrepresented languages, and intelligent tutors, closing gaps and supporting lifelong learning.

Health

AI that improves care through medical imaging, predictive analytics, digital biomarkers, federated learning, and AI enabled telemedicine, with a focus on accessibility, affordability, and scalable adoption across diverse systems.

Energy & Climate

AI across the energy spectrum, from conventional to renewables, for predictive maintenance, grid optimization, and demand forecasting, with climate uses like geospatial weather prediction, digital twins for resilient infrastructure, emissions tracking, and ecosystem conservation.

Wildcard / Open Innovation

An open track for novel, cross sector AI ideas that do not fit above themes, encouraging interdisciplinary work in governance, manufacturing, urban development, healthcare, and other emerging areas that show clear public value.

Cybersecurity, Safety & Digital Wellbeing

AI for trusted digital participation, covering anomaly detection, intrusion prevention, privacy preserving identity, and NLP tools to counter misinformation or harassment, plus behavioral modeling and sentiment analysis for mental wellbeing at scale.

Agriculture

AI for food security and sustainable farming, including precision agriculture, drone or satellite monitoring, yield prediction, automated pest and disease detection, blockchain based supply chains, and edge AI for resource use.

Education

AI that personalizes, democratizes, and scales learning, including adaptive algorithms, multimodal content, speech recognition in underrepresented languages, and intelligent tutors, closing gaps and supporting lifelong learning.

Health

AI that improves care through medical imaging, predictive analytics, digital biomarkers, federated learning, and AI enabled telemedicine, with a focus on accessibility, affordability, and scalable adoption across diverse systems.

Who Can Apply?

01

Applicant Criteria

Applicants must be women-led teams or entities building innovative and impactful AI centric solutions addressing real-world challenges

02

Women-led criteria

The company /startup/consortium is led by a woman or a woman is in a key decision-making role and leadership position (CEO, CTO, COO). Or the core applying team includes at least one woman as technical lead, product lead, or business lead.

03

Team Composition

Up to three members At least two team members who could represent the shortlisted AI solution  during the Summit, presentations, and evaluations must be women.

What Is In The Challenge For You

Awards up to INR 2.50 Cr

Awards of INR 25,00,000 to each of the top 10 winners and potential incentives such as cloud and compute credits

Summit Showcase

Top finalists (upto 30) receive travel and accommodation support to participate in the India-AI Impact Summit in New Delhi for global visibility, investor connections and networking opportunities. A separate Investor Pitch Session will be curated for such high-potential women-led AI solutions.

Mentorship and Bootcamps

Mentorship from industry experts on business strategy, pitch readiness etc.

Post Summit Opportunities

Recognition of the top solutions in the AI Innovation Compendium and potential mentorship from premier institutions to enable real-world deployment and scaling

Challenge Process

Evaluation

Solution Definition

Technical Feasibility

Business Model

Team Competence

Potential Impact

FAQs

Who can apply to this challenge?

• Women-led teams - The core applying team includes at least one woman as technical lead, product lead, or business lead. They may also be students, associated with Universities, Research Institutions, and Autonomous Bodies focused on research.
• Women-led entities- Working Women Professionals- representing Start-ups, Commercial Enterprises, Public Sector Organizations or Non-Profit Entities in a key decision making role and leadership position(CEO, CTO,COO).

Is the challenge open to people from any country?

Yes. Teams from across the globe are welcome to apply. We strongly encourage a diverse range of solutions from all regions.

Can I submit an existing solution, or does it need to be new?

You can submit AI solutions that are pilot-ready (solutions that are ready for or have completed pilot) or already scaling (solutions with presence in the market).

What must be the stage of my solution?

Entries must show a working AI prototype or a mature solution.

What kind of support will I receive throughout the challenge process?

You may be invited to be part of workshops for scaling AI solutions, refining GTM etc. and opportunities to participate in bootcamps for refining your pitching skills, empowering you to confidently present and showcase your innovative solutions.

How will my solutions be evaluated?

All the solutions will be evaluated in a two stage process:
• Round 1: Solutions will be scored and shortlisted based on five broad parameters: Solution Definition, Technical Feasibility, Business Model, Team Competence, and Potential Impact.
• Round 2: Shortlisted innovators will be invited for presentation to a jury panel who will assess them on the outlined parameters and the presentation.

Do I retain intellectual property?

Yes, intellectual property remains with the participants.

How will the applicants receive the award money?

• Award money shall be credited to the bank account of the registered entity under which the AI solution is registered. If the participating team has not yet registered themselves as a Company or Startup they can still participate. However, they will be required to be registered as a Company or Startup before the Summit to be eligible for receiving the award money.
• All award money is subject to applicable taxes and deductions under Indian laws.

What support is available beyond award money?

Finalists will have access to:
• Global Exposure: Opportunity to present your solution to an audience of leaders and experts at the AI Impact Summit.
• Networking and Mentorship: Opportunity to connect with and receive mentorship, funding and scaling opportunities support from leading investors and ecosystem experts.
• Valuable Resources: Access to potential compute and cloud credits to further develop, deploy and scale your solutions.

Are travel and accommodation covered for finalists who make it to the Impact Summit?

• Yes. The Summit will cover travel and accommodation for up to two members per finalist team (maximum of upto 30 finalist teams in total).
• If a third team member wishes to attend, their travel and accommodation expenses must be borne by the team member itself.

What is the recommended team composition?

Team Composition Guidelines
• Individual Applications: If applying as a single participant, the applicant must be a woman.
• Two-Member Teams: At least one member must be a woman, holding key roles as defined in the Who can Apply section.
• Three-Member Teams: At least two members must be women, and they should be able to represent the team during the Summit, including presentations, pitching sessions, and evaluation rounds.

Queries

All queries must be emailed to fellow1[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  &  fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  using the subject line:

“AI by HER: Global Impact Challenge – Query - [Applicant Name]”.

Important Notes

Applicants are advised to visit the website regularly for further updates. The team leaders of the shortlisted entries will be contacted via their registered email IDs with further instructions and communication. All shortlisted teams are required to adhere to the Rules and Regulations and Eligibility Criteria as outlined on the official call for application. They must also submit all necessary documents as requested to proceed to the next stage. Participation is subject to local and international laws and that applicants are fully responsible for compliance. All personal data collected from participants will be handled, stored, and processed in strict accordance with the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023, and other applicable laws and regulations enforced in India.
IndiaAI reserves the right to amend timelines, processes, or eligibility criteria in unforeseen circumstances, in the interest of fair competition and operational feasibility.

Disclaimer & Limitation of Liability

IndiaAI, Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), its officers, employees, partners, and collaborating organizations assume no responsibility or liability for any loss, damage, or inconvenience caused as a result of participation in these challenges. By submitting an application or participating in the India AI Impact Summit challenges, participants agree and acknowledge that participation is at their own risk. The organizers reserve the right to modify, postpone, or cancel any part of the challenge or event, including rules, criteria, timelines, or awards, at their sole discretion, without prior notice. All participants are solely responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable local and international laws. The organizers shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of participation or inability to participate. Submission of entries does not guarantee selection, awards, or any future engagement. Any decisions made by the organizing committee are final and binding in all matters related to the challenge and its outcomes. It is hereby clarified that there are no registration fees or participation charges for this Global Challenge. Any individual or entity claiming otherwise will attract penal action. Participants are advised not to make any payments to any person or organization for the Innovation Challenges. The organizers shall not be responsible for any loss arising from any such dealing with unauthorized persons.

AI for ALL: 
 Global Impact Challenge

Thank you for the exceptional response! Applications are now under evaluation.

About the Challenge

The AI for ALL: Global Impact Challenge strives to identify solutions that use AI to enable large-scale impact. The leading solutions get showcased at the India - AI Impact Summit to be held in New Delhi, India in February 2026. This initiative is being implemented in partnership with Startup India under the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), Ministry of Commerce and Industry and Digital India BHASHINI Division.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Download Submission Guidelines

Key Objectives

Identify High Quality Solutions

Spotlight high quality, AI-driven innovations addressing unmet global needs across sectors

Inspire Adoption and Scale

Amplify AI innovations through global visibility, recognition, and ecosystem support

Build Strategic Partnerships

Foster meaningful connections between global innovators, and enabling organizations to drive sustained impact

Indicative Themes

We welcome all innovative AI solutions that are widely deployable, demonstrate high potential value at large scale, and address critical needs across diverse sectors. 
Below themes are indicative.

Healthcare

AI Solutions for addressing healthcare worker shortages, access to health services in remote and rural areas, efficient resource utilization, and insurance-related inefficiencies

Manufacturing

AI solutions aimed at enhancing operational efficiency and solving industry challenges such as frequent equipment breakdowns, unplanned downtime, high variability in product quality, inefficient resource utilization, and vulnerability to supply-chain disruptions

Urban Infrastructure and mobility

AI solutions for traffic management, waste management, and last-mile connectivity

Wild Card/Open Innovation

An open track for novel AI solutions (cross sector or otherwise) with transformative potential for scale and impact.

Agriculture

AI Solutions for pressing agriculture challenges such as declining crop productivity due to climate unpredictability, post-harvest losses, resource management, and access to timely market insights

Climate and sustainability

AI Solutions for addressing sustainability and resilience challenges, including extreme weather events, emissions reduction, and sustainable resource management

Education

AI Solutions for equitable access to quality learning resources, addressing geographical and demographic learning gaps, lack of capacity and personnel to deliver personalized instruction, and digital divide

Financial Inclusion

AI Solutions such as enhancing credit access for migrants, gig workers, MSMEs, and informal communities, addressing financial fraud in digital payment systems, and low financial literacy among marginalized groups

Healthcare

AI Solutions for addressing healthcare worker shortages, access to health services in remote and rural areas, efficient resource utilization, and insurance-related inefficiencies

Manufacturing

AI solutions aimed at enhancing operational efficiency and solving industry challenges such as frequent equipment breakdowns, unplanned downtime, high variability in product quality, inefficient resource utilization, and vulnerability to supply-chain disruptions

Urban Infrastructure and mobility

AI solutions for traffic management, waste management, and last-mile connectivity

Wild Card/Open Innovation

An open track for novel AI solutions (cross sector or otherwise) with transformative potential for scale and impact.

Agriculture

AI Solutions for pressing agriculture challenges such as declining crop productivity due to climate unpredictability, post-harvest losses, resource management, and access to timely market insights

Climate and sustainability

AI Solutions for addressing sustainability and resilience challenges, including extreme weather events, emissions reduction, and sustainable resource management

Education

AI Solutions for equitable access to quality learning resources, addressing geographical and demographic learning gaps, lack of capacity and personnel to deliver personalized instruction, and digital divide

Financial Inclusion

AI Solutions such as enhancing credit access for migrants, gig workers, MSMEs, and informal communities, addressing financial fraud in digital payment systems, and low financial literacy among marginalized groups

Who Can Apply?

01

Students

Enrolled in universities or research programs

02

Working Professionals

Employed in start-ups, companies, public sector, public sector entities or non-profits

03

Researchers

From universities, autonomous bodies, or research institutions

04

Companies & Start-ups

Registered businesses, start-ups, or non-profit entities

What Is In The Challenge For You

Awards up to INR 2.50 Cr

Awards of INR 25,00,000 to each of the top 10 winners and potential incentives such as cloud and compute credits

Summit Showcase

Global visibility, investor connections and networking opportunities.

Mentorship and Bootcamps

Mentorship from industry experts on business strategy, pitch readiness etc.

Post Summit Opportunities

Recognition of the top solutions in the AI Innovation Compendium and potential mentorship from premier institutions to enable real-world deployment and scaling

Challenge Process

Evaluation

Solution Definition

Technical Feasibility

Business Model

Team Competence

Potential Impact

FAQs

Who can apply to this challenge?

• Students: Enrolled in universities or research programs
• Working Professionals: Employed in start-ups, companies, public sector, public sector entities or non-profits
• Researchers: From universities, autonomous bodies, or research institutions
• Companies and Start-ups: Registered businesses, recognized start-ups, and non-profit entities

Is the challenge open to people from any country?

Yes. Teams from across the globe are welcome to apply. We strongly encourage a diverse range of solutions from all regions.

Can I apply to the other challenges?

Yes, you can apply to all three challenges if you meet the required eligibility criteria

Can I submit an existing solution, or does it need to be new?

You can submit AI solutions that are pilot-ready (solutions that are ready for or have completed pilot) or already scaling (solutions with presence in the market).

What must be the stage of my solution?

The solution must be in pilot stage (solutions that are ready for or have completed pilot) or scaling (solutions with presence in the market).

How will my solutions be evaluated?

All the solutions will be evaluated on the basis of: Solution Definition, Technical Feasibility, Business Model, Team Competence, and Potential Impact by leading industry experts

Do I retain intellectual property?

Yes, intellectual property remains with the participants.

How will the applicants receive the award money?

Award money shall be credited to the bank account of the registered entity under which the AI solution is registered. If the participating team has not yet registered themselves as a Company or Startup they can still participate. However, they will be required to be registered as a Company or Startup before the Summit to be eligible for receiving the award money. All award money is subject to applicable taxes and deductions under Indian laws.

What support is available beyond award money?

Finalists will have access to:
• Global Exposure: Opportunity to present your solution to an audience of leaders and experts at the AI Impact Summit
• Networking and Mentorship: Opportunity to connect with and receive mentorship, funding and scaling opportunities support from leading investors and ecosystem experts.
• Valuable Resources: Access to potential compute and cloud credits to further develop, deploy and scale your solutions.

Are travel and accommodation covered for finalists who make it to the India AI Impact Summit?

Yes, the travel and accommodation for top 20 teams (up to 2 members per team) will be covered by the India AI Impact Summit team.

What is the recommended team composition?

Two team members will be invited to represent the shortlisted AI solution during the Summit

Queries

All queries must be emailed to fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  using the subject line:

"AI for ALL: Global Impact Challenge – Query - [Applicant Name]".

Important Notes

Applicants are advised to visit the website regularly for further updates. The team leaders of the shortlisted entries will be contacted via their registered email IDs with further instructions and communication. All shortlisted teams are required to adhere to the Rules and Regulations and Eligibility Criteria as outlined on the official call for application. They must also submit all necessary documents as requested to proceed to the next stage. Participation is subject to local and international laws and that applicants are fully responsible for compliance. All personal data collected from participants will be handled, stored, and processed in strict accordance with the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023, and other applicable laws and regulations enforced in India. IndiaAI reserves the right to amend timelines, processes, or eligibility criteria in unforeseen circumstances, in the interest of fair competition and operational feasibility.

Disclaimer & Limitation of Liability

IndiaAI, Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), its officers, employees, partners, and collaborating organizations assume no responsibility or liability for any loss, damage, or inconvenience caused as a result of participation in these challenges. By submitting an application or participating in the India AI Impact Summit challenges, participants agree and acknowledge that participation is at their own risk. The organizers reserve the right to modify, postpone, or cancel any part of the challenge or event, including rules, criteria, timelines, or awards, at their sole discretion, without prior notice. All participants are solely responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable local and international laws. The organizers shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of participation or inability to participate. Submission of entries does not guarantee selection, awards, or any future engagement. Any decisions made by the organizing committee are final and binding in all matters related to the challenge and its outcomes. It is hereby clarified that there are no registration fees or participation charges for this Global Challenge. Any individual or entity claiming otherwise will attract penal action. Participants are advised not to make any payments to any person or organization for the Innovation Challenges. The organizers shall not be responsible for any loss arising from any such dealing with unauthorized persons.
