AI by HER: 
 Global Impact Challenge

Thank you for the exceptional response! Applications are now under evaluation.

About the Challenge

AI by HER: The Impact Challenge for Women in AI is a global innovation challenge inviting women technologists to demonstrate AI solutions tackling large scale or novel real-world public challenges. This initiative is being implemented in partnership with NITI Aayog- Women Entrepreneurship Platform. 

Focused on inclusive innovation and global impact, this initiative promotes gender equity, Global South innovation, and aims to showcase scalable AI-for-good applications at the India-AI Impact Summit to be held in New Delhi, India, in February 2026.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Download Submission Guidelines

Key Objectives

Identify Women-Led Teams

Identify women-led teams globally working on innovative and impactful AI centric solutions addressing real-world challenges.

Build a Dedicated Support Pipeline

Establish a dedicated support pipeline for women-led AI innovations, including mentorship, visibility, and post-event scale-up opportunities. Conduct two virtual bootcamps: Responsible AI and Investor Readiness & Pitching Sessions.

Create a Platform

Create a platform for the top teams (up to 30 globally) to present at the India-AI Impact Summit.

Curate an Exclusive Investor Pitch Session

Curate an exclusive Investor Pitch Session for these (up to 30 globally) high-potential women-led AI solutions.

Indicative Themes

We welcome innovative AI solutions that are scalable, broadly deployable, and capable of delivering significant public value across diverse sectors. The thematic areas outlined below are indicative, and applicants are encouraged to propose any solution that demonstrates clear societal impact.

Education

AI that personalizes, democratizes, and scales learning, including adaptive algorithms, multimodal content, speech recognition in underrepresented languages, and intelligent tutors, closing gaps and supporting lifelong learning.

Health

AI that improves care through medical imaging, predictive analytics, digital biomarkers, federated learning, and AI enabled telemedicine, with a focus on accessibility, affordability, and scalable adoption across diverse systems.

Energy & Climate

AI across the energy spectrum, from conventional to renewables, for predictive maintenance, grid optimization, and demand forecasting, with climate uses like geospatial weather prediction, digital twins for resilient infrastructure, emissions tracking, and ecosystem conservation.

Wildcard / Open Innovation

An open track for novel, cross sector AI ideas that do not fit above themes, encouraging interdisciplinary work in governance, manufacturing, urban development, healthcare, and other emerging areas that show clear public value.

Cybersecurity, Safety & Digital Wellbeing

AI for trusted digital participation, covering anomaly detection, intrusion prevention, privacy preserving identity, and NLP tools to counter misinformation or harassment, plus behavioral modeling and sentiment analysis for mental wellbeing at scale.

Agriculture

AI for food security and sustainable farming, including precision agriculture, drone or satellite monitoring, yield prediction, automated pest and disease detection, blockchain based supply chains, and edge AI for resource use.

Education

AI that personalizes, democratizes, and scales learning, including adaptive algorithms, multimodal content, speech recognition in underrepresented languages, and intelligent tutors, closing gaps and supporting lifelong learning.

Health

AI that improves care through medical imaging, predictive analytics, digital biomarkers, federated learning, and AI enabled telemedicine, with a focus on accessibility, affordability, and scalable adoption across diverse systems.

Energy & Climate

AI across the energy spectrum, from conventional to renewables, for predictive maintenance, grid optimization, and demand forecasting, with climate uses like geospatial weather prediction, digital twins for resilient infrastructure, emissions tracking, and ecosystem conservation.

Wildcard / Open Innovation

An open track for novel, cross sector AI ideas that do not fit above themes, encouraging interdisciplinary work in governance, manufacturing, urban development, healthcare, and other emerging areas that show clear public value.

Cybersecurity, Safety & Digital Wellbeing

AI for trusted digital participation, covering anomaly detection, intrusion prevention, privacy preserving identity, and NLP tools to counter misinformation or harassment, plus behavioral modeling and sentiment analysis for mental wellbeing at scale.

Agriculture

AI for food security and sustainable farming, including precision agriculture, drone or satellite monitoring, yield prediction, automated pest and disease detection, blockchain based supply chains, and edge AI for resource use.

Education

AI that personalizes, democratizes, and scales learning, including adaptive algorithms, multimodal content, speech recognition in underrepresented languages, and intelligent tutors, closing gaps and supporting lifelong learning.

Health

AI that improves care through medical imaging, predictive analytics, digital biomarkers, federated learning, and AI enabled telemedicine, with a focus on accessibility, affordability, and scalable adoption across diverse systems.

Who Can Apply?

01

Applicant Criteria

Applicants must be women-led teams or entities building innovative and impactful AI centric solutions addressing real-world challenges

02

Women-led criteria

The company /startup/consortium is led by a woman or a woman is in a key decision-making role and leadership position (CEO, CTO, COO). Or the core applying team includes at least one woman as technical lead, product lead, or business lead.

03

Team Composition

Up to three members At least two team members who could represent the shortlisted AI solution  during the Summit, presentations, and evaluations must be women.

What Is In The Challenge For You

Awards up to INR 2.50 Cr

Awards of INR 25,00,000 to each of the top 10 winners and potential incentives such as cloud and compute credits

Summit Showcase

Top finalists (upto 30) receive travel and accommodation support to participate in the India-AI Impact Summit in New Delhi for global visibility, investor connections and networking opportunities. A separate Investor Pitch Session will be curated for such high-potential women-led AI solutions.

Mentorship and Bootcamps

Mentorship from industry experts on business strategy, pitch readiness etc.

Post Summit Opportunities

Recognition of the top solutions in the AI Innovation Compendium and potential mentorship from premier institutions to enable real-world deployment and scaling

Challenge Process

Evaluation

Solution Definition

Technical Feasibility

Business Model

Team Competence

Potential Impact

FAQs

Who can apply to this challenge?

• Women-led teams - The core applying team includes at least one woman as technical lead, product lead, or business lead. They may also be students, associated with Universities, Research Institutions, and Autonomous Bodies focused on research.
• Women-led entities- Working Women Professionals- representing Start-ups, Commercial Enterprises, Public Sector Organizations or Non-Profit Entities in a key decision making role and leadership position(CEO, CTO,COO).

Is the challenge open to people from any country?

Yes. Teams from across the globe are welcome to apply. We strongly encourage a diverse range of solutions from all regions.

Can I submit an existing solution, or does it need to be new?

You can submit AI solutions that are pilot-ready (solutions that are ready for or have completed pilot) or already scaling (solutions with presence in the market).

What must be the stage of my solution?

Entries must show a working AI prototype or a mature solution.

What kind of support will I receive throughout the challenge process?

You may be invited to be part of workshops for scaling AI solutions, refining GTM etc. and opportunities to participate in bootcamps for refining your pitching skills, empowering you to confidently present and showcase your innovative solutions.

How will my solutions be evaluated?

All the solutions will be evaluated in a two stage process:
• Round 1: Solutions will be scored and shortlisted based on five broad parameters: Solution Definition, Technical Feasibility, Business Model, Team Competence, and Potential Impact.
• Round 2: Shortlisted innovators will be invited for presentation to a jury panel who will assess them on the outlined parameters and the presentation.

Do I retain intellectual property?

Yes, intellectual property remains with the participants.

How will the applicants receive the award money?

• Award money shall be credited to the bank account of the registered entity under which the AI solution is registered. If the participating team has not yet registered themselves as a Company or Startup they can still participate. However, they will be required to be registered as a Company or Startup before the Summit to be eligible for receiving the award money.
• All award money is subject to applicable taxes and deductions under Indian laws.

What support is available beyond award money?

Finalists will have access to:
• Global Exposure: Opportunity to present your solution to an audience of leaders and experts at the AI Impact Summit.
• Networking and Mentorship: Opportunity to connect with and receive mentorship, funding and scaling opportunities support from leading investors and ecosystem experts.
• Valuable Resources: Access to potential compute and cloud credits to further develop, deploy and scale your solutions.

Are travel and accommodation covered for finalists who make it to the Impact Summit?

• Yes. The Summit will cover travel and accommodation for up to two members per finalist team (maximum of upto 30 finalist teams in total).
• If a third team member wishes to attend, their travel and accommodation expenses must be borne by the team member itself.

What is the recommended team composition?

Team Composition Guidelines
• Individual Applications: If applying as a single participant, the applicant must be a woman.
• Two-Member Teams: At least one member must be a woman, holding key roles as defined in the Who can Apply section.
• Three-Member Teams: At least two members must be women, and they should be able to represent the team during the Summit, including presentations, pitching sessions, and evaluation rounds.

Queries

All queries must be emailed to fellow1[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  &  fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  using the subject line:

“AI by HER: Global Impact Challenge – Query - [Applicant Name]”.

Important Notes

Applicants are advised to visit the website regularly for further updates. The team leaders of the shortlisted entries will be contacted via their registered email IDs with further instructions and communication. All shortlisted teams are required to adhere to the Rules and Regulations and Eligibility Criteria as outlined on the official call for application. They must also submit all necessary documents as requested to proceed to the next stage. Participation is subject to local and international laws and that applicants are fully responsible for compliance. All personal data collected from participants will be handled, stored, and processed in strict accordance with the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023, and other applicable laws and regulations enforced in India.
IndiaAI reserves the right to amend timelines, processes, or eligibility criteria in unforeseen circumstances, in the interest of fair competition and operational feasibility.

Disclaimer & Limitation of Liability

IndiaAI, Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), its officers, employees, partners, and collaborating organizations assume no responsibility or liability for any loss, damage, or inconvenience caused as a result of participation in these challenges. By submitting an application or participating in the India AI Impact Summit challenges, participants agree and acknowledge that participation is at their own risk. The organizers reserve the right to modify, postpone, or cancel any part of the challenge or event, including rules, criteria, timelines, or awards, at their sole discretion, without prior notice. All participants are solely responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable local and international laws. The organizers shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of participation or inability to participate. Submission of entries does not guarantee selection, awards, or any future engagement. Any decisions made by the organizing committee are final and binding in all matters related to the challenge and its outcomes. It is hereby clarified that there are no registration fees or participation charges for this Global Challenge. Any individual or entity claiming otherwise will attract penal action. Participants are advised not to make any payments to any person or organization for the Innovation Challenges. The organizers shall not be responsible for any loss arising from any such dealing with unauthorized persons.

YUVAi - Global Youth 
 Challenge

Thank you for the exceptional response! Applications are now under evaluation.

About the Challenge

The YUVAi – Global Youth Challenge is your chance to dream big with AI! Implementing in partnership with MyBharat and NIELIT, this innovation program invites young innovators in the age group 13-21, to bring their most innovative AI solutions to solve real-world problems.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Download Submission Guidelines

Download Consent Form

Key Objectives

Provide opportunities for youth

Engage with global AI experts through workshops and mentorships.

Organize 10 days virtual bootcamps

Equip shortlisted applicants with skills, tools, and knowledge to strengthen their AI solutions.

Platform for young innovators

Showcase their work to a global audience, exchange ideas with peers worldwide, and gain invaluable exposure.

Indicative Themes

We welcome all innovative AI solutions that are widely deployable, demonstrate high impact potential at large scale, and address critical needs across diverse sectors.

Empowering people and communities

AI solutions for elderly care, youth mental wellbeing and physical fitness, nutrition and holistic growth, equitable access to education, and empowering students with disabilities.

Transforming core sectors

AI solutions for sustainable agricultural production, green manufacturing, transportation and logistics, industrial transformation, and waste-to-wealth initiatives.

Future-ready infrastructure and smart ecosystems

AI solutions for safe and smart cities with sustainable infrastructure and mobility, clean and green environments, affordable clean energy, and improved last-mile public service delivery.

Wild Card/Open Innovation

An open track for novel cross-sector AI solutions beyond listed themes, with transformative potential for scale and impact.

Who Can Apply?

01

Youth Individual

Applicants in the age group 13-21 can apply as youth individuals.

02

Youth Teams

Applicants in the age group 13-21 can apply as youth teams with up to 2 members.

What Is In The Challenge For You

Awards & Recognition: Prizes worth Rs. 85 Lacs

First Prize: ₹15 Lacs each (Top 3 solutions)

Second prize: ₹10 Lacs each (Next 3 solutions)

Special Recognition Awards: 2 awards of ₹5 Lacs each

Certificates for all participants, and exclusive credits/giveaways for winners

Summit Showcase

Top 20 shortlisted applicants get to present their innovation at the AI Impact Summit 2026 during the International Demo Day

Top solutions with highest deployment potential get to present their solutions at Impact Summit investor showcase

Mentorship & Training

Join 10-days virtual bootcamps with expert mentors

Enhance your solution, sharpen your pitch, and boost your innovation potential

Post-Summit Opportunities

Permanent showcase: Top 20 solutions featured on the Summit website

AI Innovation Compendium: Winning solutions published in a global report

Scaling with impact: Selected winners may receive mentorship from premier Indian institutions for real-world deployment

Challenge Process

FAQs

Who can apply to this challenge?

The challenge is open to applicants in the age group 13 - 21 years. Applicants can apply as individuals, or in teams with up to 2 members. All team members should be <=21 years of age as on 20th February, 2026.

Is the challenge open to applicants from any country?

Yes. Applicants from all countries are welcome to apply. We strongly encourage a diverse range of solutions from all regions and sectors.

Can I submit an existing solution, or does it need to be new?

You may submit either of the following:
A new solution, which is conceived through this challenge
An existing solution or a prototype that is already in development or deployment

What must be the stage of my solution?

Applicants can submit proof of concepts / working prototypes / deployable AI solutions that can be demonstrated and have large scale impact.

What documents do I need to submit?

Each applicant must submit the following:

• Consent Form – PDF containing duly signed consent forms of all applicants as per prescribed template
• References/Citations – A PDF (maximum 2 pages) listing sources for any data or facts used in developing the solution
• Video Demo (2-3 minutes) – Including self-introduction, project/solution description, demonstration, technology used, and future scope. English subtitles must be added.

What support will I receive if I get selected after Round 1?

Shortlisted applicants will get the opportunity to join 10 days of virtual bootcamps and workshops to enhance their innovation potential and AI skills.

What support will I receive if I get selected after Round 2?

Winners will get an opportunity to win awards upto INR 85 Lakhs, along with giveaways, and present your solution on the global stage at the AI Impact Summit in India (February 2026).

How will my solution be evaluated?

All the solutions will be evaluated in a two stage process:
Phase 1: Solutions will be screened and shortlisted based on thematic alignment, innovative idea, scaling and impact potential.
Phase 2: Shortlisted innovators will be invited for presentation to a jury panel who will assess them on parameters as specified in.

Do I retain intellectual property?

Yes, intellectual property remains with the participants.

How will I receive the prize money?

For winners below 18 years of age, the prize money shall be credited to the bank account of designated primary guardian.
For winners aged 18 to 21 years, the prize money shall be credited to the bank account of the designated team leader.
Please note that all prize money is subject to taxes and deductions as applicable under the Indian laws.

What support is available beyond prize money?

Participants get an opportunity to present their solutions at the AI Impact Summit apart from exposure to the global AI ecosystem, investor showcases for winning solutions, mentorship and expert guidance, credits, and exciting giveaways.

Are travel and accommodation covered for finalists who make it to the Impact Summit?

Yes, travel and accommodation for finalists (up to 2 members per team, and 1 adult guardian per team, in case of minor applicants) will be covered by the AI Impact Summit team.

Queries

All queries must be emailed to fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  using the subject line:

"YUVAi: Global Youth Challenge – Query - [Applicant Name]".

Important Notes

Applicants are advised to visit the website regularly for further updates. The team leaders of the shortlisted entries will be contacted via their registered email IDs with further instructions and communication. All shortlisted teams are required to adhere to the Rules and Regulations and Eligibility Criteria as outlined on the official call for application. They must also submit all necessary documents as requested to proceed to the next stage. Participation is subject to local and international laws and that applicants are fully responsible for compliance. All personal data collected from participants will be handled, stored, and processed in strict accordance with the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023, and other applicable laws and regulations enforced in India. IndiaAI reserves the right to amend timelines, processes, or eligibility criteria in unforeseen circumstances, in the interest of fair competition and operational feasibility.

Disclaimer & Limitation of Liability

IndiaAI, Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), its officers, employees, partners, and collaborating organizations assume no responsibility or liability for any loss, damage, or inconvenience caused as a result of participation in these challenges. By submitting an application or participating in the India AI Impact Summit challenges, participants agree and acknowledge that participation is at their own risk. The organizers reserve the right to modify, postpone, or cancel any part of the challenge or event, including rules, criteria, timelines, or awards, at their sole discretion, without prior notice. All participants are solely responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable local and international laws. The organizers shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of participation or inability to participate. Submission of entries does not guarantee selection, awards, or any future engagement. Any decisions made by the organizing committee are final and binding in all matters related to the challenge and its outcomes. It is hereby clarified that there are no registration fees or participation charges for this Global Challenge. Any individual or entity claiming otherwise will attract penal action. Participants are advised not to make any payments to any person or organization for the Innovation Challenges. The organizers shall not be responsible for any loss arising from any such dealing with unauthorized persons.

About the Challenge

India AI Tinkerpreneur is a unique national level summer bootcamp that equips school students (in classes 6 to 12  and beyond) with skills in the usage of AI tools and technologies, and empowers them to build their own AI enabled products and solutions to create social-impact.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Key Objectives

Build AI and entrepreneurial capacities

through a series of 10 online sessions and 2 master classes

Provide mentoring support

by industry and academic experts

Encourage entrepreneurial thinking

from ideation to execution

Foster innovation and problem-solving skills

among young learners

Cultivate a national community of young creators

to become future leaders and innovators

Indicative Themes

While the program is broad, some indicative themes or problem statements that participants were recommended to  explore include:

Social-impact challenges

Social-impact challenges in domains such as education, healthcare, environment, agriculture, governance, access,  inclusion, etc. (since the program emphasizes “AI-powered social impact”)

Statistical data and Computer Vision:

Use of statistical data, computer vision, natural language processing, AI tools / models in solving practical  problems (as sessions include “Deep dive into Statistical data and Computer Vision”)

AI Modules

Hybrid / digital / physical products integrating AI modules

Prototypes

Prototypes that combine digital + hardware / sensor / physical computing (inferred from “digital, physical or  hybrid product” wording)

Themes aligned with local / community problems (encouraging contextually relevant solutions)

Who Can Apply?

School Student

All school students from

Class 6th to Class 12th

What Is In The Challenge For You

AI Skilling:

•

Acquire skills in a variety of AI tools & technologies

Product Building:

•

Build a digital, physical  or hybrid product using AI skills to address a social cause

Entrepreneurship & Pitching:

•

Learn the ropes of entrepreneurship and pitch your social-impact solution

Top 100 Projects

•

Top 100 Projects get selected for Atal Catalysts Program @ ISB

Top 50 Projects

•

Top 50 projects get selected for showcase at India - AI Impact Summit 2026

Other Benefits

Awards & Recognition

Mentorship & Training

Post-Summit Opportunities

FAQs

What is India AI Tinkerpreneur 2025?

Tinkerpreneur 2025 is a month-long virtual summer bootcamp that introduces students of classes 6 to 12 and beyond, to AI and Entrepreneurship. It’ws organized by Atal Innovation Mission (AIM), NITI Aayog in collaboration with Intel India.

What will be the journey of the students during and after India AI Tinkerpreneur 2025?

Stage 1: Students register at AI Student Community (AISC) 
 Stage 2: Attend a series of 10 sessions on AI and Entrepreneurship, conducted by experts from industry and academia. 
	 • Take a Quiz for each session1 
	 • Get a certificate on completion of 8 out of 10 sessions 
	 • Start developing their AI-enabled social impact projects 
 Stage 3: Submit your AI-enabled social impact project and/or business plans at the India AI Impact Festival 2025 
 Stage 4: Top 100 projects with business plans will join the Atal Catalyst Program wherein they get mentored by ISB.

Who can participate?

This initiative is open to students from Classes 6 to 12 and students from Higher Education institutions across the country, irrespective of their institution type, background, or prior knowledge

Is knowledge of AI or coding necessary to join?

No prior knowledge is needed. The bootcamp starts from the basics and includes hands-on activities and beginner-friendly content in AI, digital tools, and entrepreneurship.

Can I register individually or will my school register on my behalf?

You can register individually and encourage your friends/ classmates to also register for the India AI Tinkerpreneur 2025.

How do ATL and non-ATL students register?

The registration link is open to all students, regardless of the type of educational institution they are from. ATL affiliation is not mandatory.

What will I learn during the bootcamp?

You will learn to identify problems, apply AI technologies, build digital products, design business models, market solutions, and pitch your venture. The session plan includes: 
 
                – 4 sessions on AI 

                – 2 sessions of Product development 

                – 4 sessions on Entrepreneurship 

                – 2 Masterclasses by senior leaders from Industry and Academia

What are the program dates?

The India AI Tinkerpreneur sessions will run from 11 June to 15 July 2025.

Is there a participation certificate?

Yes. All completing students receive a certificate from AIM, NITI Aayog and Intel India Top teams will be recognized at the India AI Impact Festival 2025.

Where can I see the full program schedule?

The updated schedule is available on the official website: https://aistudent.community/india-ai-tinkerpreneur-2025

Who are the mentors conducting the sessions?

The sessions will be conducted by Intel certified AI coaches and experts from AIM. The Masterclasses will be organized by professional experts from Industry and academia.

When can I start working on my project?

Students can keep working on their AI-enabled project throughout the Bootcamp. The sessions will be helpful in identifying project ideas, developing the project, developing a business plan and tips for showcasing the project. If the students needs any help, they can also reach out to the mentors of change for guidance.

Why should I participate in Tinkerpreneur 2025?

Participating gives you a unique chance to build entrepreneurial and AI skills early, with national-level exposure and mentorship from industry leaders.

What kind of AI tools will I learn to use?

You can explore beginner-level tools in Computer Vision (CV), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Data Science to integrate into your project.

What kind of topics should my project be based on?

You are encouraged to identify real-life issues and build AI-enabled digital solutions that try to address such problems.

What is the India AI Impact Festival and how is it linked?

The India AI Impact Festival, a national level competition for school and college students will be launched in July 2025, organized collaboratively by Aim NITI Aayog, Intel India and other Government partners. The India AI Tinkerpreneur 2025 participants can submit their projects at the India AI Impact Festival where top AI-integrated projects will be showcased and celebrated.

What support will I get if I get stuck during the program? Can I get mentorship support during the program?

There is a list of AIM Mentors of Change available on the India AI Tinkerpreneur page, with state and email details. Students can reach out to any Mentor of Change through the emails2 mentioned in the list. Mentors will be available to guide you via email and interactive sessions throughout the bootcamp.

Will there be live sessions or only self-paced content?

All sessions will be conducted live by experts. Post the live session, the recording of the session and the content will be available to all registered paticipants, to learn at their own pace.

Is there a deadline to register?

Students can register anytime and attend the live sessions, before and on respective dates

What if I miss a session?

Recordings and learning materials will be available. You are encouraged to catch up and consult mentors if needed.

Do I need parental or school permission?

While not mandatory, informing your parent or teacher is encouraged for additional support.

How can I stay motivated throughout the program?

Set weekly goals, actively engage in workshops, and interact with your peers and mentors regularly. Celebrate small wins to stay energized.

What’s the commitment required from me?

Anyone who is curious to learn, eager to explore, and willing to innovative should participate in the AI Tinkerpreneur 2025.To participate, one only needs access to a laptop or computer, and good internet connectivity

Can I switch mentors midway?

Mentor changes are not encouraged once the bootcamp starts, except under special circumstances approved by the organizers.

Is there any Helpline where I can raise queries?

Please read the FAQ document for more details on India AI Tinkerpreneur 2025. If you still have queries, please email at aitinkerpreneur[at]gmail[dot]com Queries will be addressed by the organizing team from 9 am to 5 pm.

Queries

All queries must be emailed to aitinkerpreneur[at]gmail[dot]com

Important Note for Applicants

Applicants are advised to visit the website regularly for further updates. The team leaders of the shortlisted entries  will be contacted via their registered email IDs with further instructions and communication. All shortlisted teams  are required to adhere to the Rules and Regulations and Eligibility Criteria as outlined on the official call for  application. They must also submit all necessary documents as requested to proceed to the next stage. Participation  is subject to local and international laws and that applicants are fully responsible for compliance. All personal data  collected from participants will be handled, stored, and processed in strict accordance with the Digital Personal  Data Protection Act, 2023, and other applicable laws and regulations enforced in India.  IndiaAI reserves the right to amend timelines, processes, or eligibility criteria in unforeseen circumstances, in the  interest of fair competition and operational feasibility.

Disclaimer and Limitation of Liability

IndiaAI, Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), its officers, employees, partners, and collaborating organizations assume no responsibility or liability for any loss, damage, or inconvenience caused as a result of participation in these challenges. By submitting an application or participating in the India AI Impact Summit challenges, participants agree and acknowledge that participation is at their own risk. The organizers reserve the right to modify, postpone, or cancel any part of the challenge or event, including rules, criteria, timelines, or awards, at their sole discretion, without prior notice. All participants are solely responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable local and international laws. The organizers shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of participation or inability to participate. Submission of entries does not guarantee selection, awards, or any future engagement. Any decisions made by the organizing committee are final and binding in all matters related to the challenge and its outcomes.

Research Symposium On AI & Its Impact

As part of the India-AI Impact Summit to be held between 19–20 February 2026, New Delhi, the Government of India—under the IndiaAI Mission, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology—will host a one-day “Research Symposium on AI and its Impact” on 18 February 2026 at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi, with IIIT-Hyderabad as the knowledge partner.

The Symposium is conceived as an interdisciplinary forum that brings together leading researchers and practitioners from India, the Global South, and the wider international community to present frontier work on the impact of AI, exchange methods and evidence, and forge collaborations. The Symposium aligns with the Summit’s “Impact” theme, emphasizing inclusive, policy-relevant research across various domains.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

OBJECTIVES AND EXPECTED IMPACT

The Symposium aims to achieve three closely linked outcomes:

0

1

Showcase cutting-edge AI research in India and the

Global South

, complemented by select top tier

international researchers

.

0

2

Nurture domestic talent by providing high-visibility platform for Indian researchers.

0

3

Strengthen India's global thought leadership on responsible, inclusive, and impactful AI.

Symposium Structure

Plenary Sessions

Keynotes & dialogues with global leaders.

Engage in thought-provoking dialogues with eminent Indian and international researchers. These sessions feature in-depth discussions on the transformative potential of AI, exploring theoretical foundations, practical applications, and societal implications.

More Details Coming Soon!

International Research Showcase

Short, focused presentations by global research leaders highlighting groundbreaking AI innovations. This track provides a platform for sharing cutting-edge methodologies, novel algorithms, and breakthrough applications from premier institutions worldwide.

More Details Coming Soon!

Global South Research & Posters Showcase

A vibrant showcase of research posters by students and collaborative teams from the Global South. This track celebrates emerging talent, fostering mentorship opportunities and highlighting innovative solutions to regional and global challenges.

Explore for More Details

SYMPOSIUM THEMES & SUB-THEMES

The Symposium will align with the broader thematic framework of the India-AI Impact Summit’s overarching vision and will curate conversations around its key priorities, ensuring coherence across sessions and submissions while leaving room for diverse and innovative contributions.

By integrating these themes into its structure, the Research Symposium will foster rich interdisciplinary dialogue, promote holistic approaches to AI research, and effectively translate high-level commitments into actionable research outcomes.

ORGANIZATIONAL DETAILS

Symposium Chairs

Mr. Abhishek Singh

AS (MeitY), CEO (IndiaAI) and DG (NIC)

Prof. PJ Narayanan

IIIT Hyderabad

Core Program Committee

Ms. Kavita Bhatia

IndiaAI

Dr. Preeti Banzal

Office Of PSA

Dr. Shivkumar Kalayanaraman

ANRF

Prof. Balaraman Ravindaran

IIT Madras

IndiaAI

Prof. Mausam

IIT Delhi

Mr. Mohammed Y Safirulla

MeitY

Mr. Abhishek Aggarwal

MeitY

Prof. Sandipan Dandapat

IIT Hyderabad

Prof. Richa Singh

IIT Jodhpur

Dr. Sunayana Sitaram

Microsoft Research

Dr. Mohit Sewak

Google

AI for ALL: 
 Global Impact Challenge

Thank you for the exceptional response! Applications are now under evaluation.

About the Challenge

The AI for ALL: Global Impact Challenge strives to identify solutions that use AI to enable large-scale impact. The leading solutions get showcased at the India - AI Impact Summit to be held in New Delhi, India in February 2026. This initiative is being implemented in partnership with Startup India under the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), Ministry of Commerce and Industry and Digital India BHASHINI Division.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Download Submission Guidelines

Key Objectives

Identify High Quality Solutions

Spotlight high quality, AI-driven innovations addressing unmet global needs across sectors

Inspire Adoption and Scale

Amplify AI innovations through global visibility, recognition, and ecosystem support

Build Strategic Partnerships

Foster meaningful connections between global innovators, and enabling organizations to drive sustained impact

Indicative Themes

We welcome all innovative AI solutions that are widely deployable, demonstrate high potential value at large scale, and address critical needs across diverse sectors. 
Below themes are indicative.

Healthcare

AI Solutions for addressing healthcare worker shortages, access to health services in remote and rural areas, efficient resource utilization, and insurance-related inefficiencies

Manufacturing

AI solutions aimed at enhancing operational efficiency and solving industry challenges such as frequent equipment breakdowns, unplanned downtime, high variability in product quality, inefficient resource utilization, and vulnerability to supply-chain disruptions

Urban Infrastructure and mobility

AI solutions for traffic management, waste management, and last-mile connectivity

Wild Card/Open Innovation

An open track for novel AI solutions (cross sector or otherwise) with transformative potential for scale and impact.

Agriculture

AI Solutions for pressing agriculture challenges such as declining crop productivity due to climate unpredictability, post-harvest losses, resource management, and access to timely market insights

Climate and sustainability

AI Solutions for addressing sustainability and resilience challenges, including extreme weather events, emissions reduction, and sustainable resource management

Education

AI Solutions for equitable access to quality learning resources, addressing geographical and demographic learning gaps, lack of capacity and personnel to deliver personalized instruction, and digital divide

Financial Inclusion

AI Solutions such as enhancing credit access for migrants, gig workers, MSMEs, and informal communities, addressing financial fraud in digital payment systems, and low financial literacy among marginalized groups

Healthcare

AI Solutions for addressing healthcare worker shortages, access to health services in remote and rural areas, efficient resource utilization, and insurance-related inefficiencies

Manufacturing

AI solutions aimed at enhancing operational efficiency and solving industry challenges such as frequent equipment breakdowns, unplanned downtime, high variability in product quality, inefficient resource utilization, and vulnerability to supply-chain disruptions

Urban Infrastructure and mobility

AI solutions for traffic management, waste management, and last-mile connectivity

Wild Card/Open Innovation

An open track for novel AI solutions (cross sector or otherwise) with transformative potential for scale and impact.

Agriculture

AI Solutions for pressing agriculture challenges such as declining crop productivity due to climate unpredictability, post-harvest losses, resource management, and access to timely market insights

Climate and sustainability

AI Solutions for addressing sustainability and resilience challenges, including extreme weather events, emissions reduction, and sustainable resource management

Education

AI Solutions for equitable access to quality learning resources, addressing geographical and demographic learning gaps, lack of capacity and personnel to deliver personalized instruction, and digital divide

Financial Inclusion

AI Solutions such as enhancing credit access for migrants, gig workers, MSMEs, and informal communities, addressing financial fraud in digital payment systems, and low financial literacy among marginalized groups

Who Can Apply?

01

Students

Enrolled in universities or research programs

02

Working Professionals

Employed in start-ups, companies, public sector, public sector entities or non-profits

03

Researchers

From universities, autonomous bodies, or research institutions

04

Companies & Start-ups

Registered businesses, start-ups, or non-profit entities

What Is In The Challenge For You

Awards up to INR 2.50 Cr

Awards of INR 25,00,000 to each of the top 10 winners and potential incentives such as cloud and compute credits

Summit Showcase

Global visibility, investor connections and networking opportunities.

Mentorship and Bootcamps

Mentorship from industry experts on business strategy, pitch readiness etc.

Post Summit Opportunities

Recognition of the top solutions in the AI Innovation Compendium and potential mentorship from premier institutions to enable real-world deployment and scaling

Challenge Process

Evaluation

Solution Definition

Technical Feasibility

Business Model

Team Competence

Potential Impact

FAQs

Who can apply to this challenge?

• Students: Enrolled in universities or research programs
• Working Professionals: Employed in start-ups, companies, public sector, public sector entities or non-profits
• Researchers: From universities, autonomous bodies, or research institutions
• Companies and Start-ups: Registered businesses, recognized start-ups, and non-profit entities

Is the challenge open to people from any country?

Yes. Teams from across the globe are welcome to apply. We strongly encourage a diverse range of solutions from all regions.

Can I apply to the other challenges?

Yes, you can apply to all three challenges if you meet the required eligibility criteria

Can I submit an existing solution, or does it need to be new?

You can submit AI solutions that are pilot-ready (solutions that are ready for or have completed pilot) or already scaling (solutions with presence in the market).

What must be the stage of my solution?

The solution must be in pilot stage (solutions that are ready for or have completed pilot) or scaling (solutions with presence in the market).

How will my solutions be evaluated?

All the solutions will be evaluated on the basis of: Solution Definition, Technical Feasibility, Business Model, Team Competence, and Potential Impact by leading industry experts

Do I retain intellectual property?

Yes, intellectual property remains with the participants.

How will the applicants receive the award money?

Award money shall be credited to the bank account of the registered entity under which the AI solution is registered. If the participating team has not yet registered themselves as a Company or Startup they can still participate. However, they will be required to be registered as a Company or Startup before the Summit to be eligible for receiving the award money. All award money is subject to applicable taxes and deductions under Indian laws.

What support is available beyond award money?

Finalists will have access to:
• Global Exposure: Opportunity to present your solution to an audience of leaders and experts at the AI Impact Summit
• Networking and Mentorship: Opportunity to connect with and receive mentorship, funding and scaling opportunities support from leading investors and ecosystem experts.
• Valuable Resources: Access to potential compute and cloud credits to further develop, deploy and scale your solutions.

Are travel and accommodation covered for finalists who make it to the India AI Impact Summit?

Yes, the travel and accommodation for top 20 teams (up to 2 members per team) will be covered by the India AI Impact Summit team.

What is the recommended team composition?

Two team members will be invited to represent the shortlisted AI solution during the Summit

Queries

All queries must be emailed to fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  using the subject line:

"AI for ALL: Global Impact Challenge – Query - [Applicant Name]".

Important Notes

Applicants are advised to visit the website regularly for further updates. The team leaders of the shortlisted entries will be contacted via their registered email IDs with further instructions and communication. All shortlisted teams are required to adhere to the Rules and Regulations and Eligibility Criteria as outlined on the official call for application. They must also submit all necessary documents as requested to proceed to the next stage. Participation is subject to local and international laws and that applicants are fully responsible for compliance. All personal data collected from participants will be handled, stored, and processed in strict accordance with the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023, and other applicable laws and regulations enforced in India. IndiaAI reserves the right to amend timelines, processes, or eligibility criteria in unforeseen circumstances, in the interest of fair competition and operational feasibility.

Disclaimer & Limitation of Liability

IndiaAI, Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), its officers, employees, partners, and collaborating organizations assume no responsibility or liability for any loss, damage, or inconvenience caused as a result of participation in these challenges. By submitting an application or participating in the India AI Impact Summit challenges, participants agree and acknowledge that participation is at their own risk. The organizers reserve the right to modify, postpone, or cancel any part of the challenge or event, including rules, criteria, timelines, or awards, at their sole discretion, without prior notice. All participants are solely responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable local and international laws. The organizers shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of participation or inability to participate. Submission of entries does not guarantee selection, awards, or any future engagement. Any decisions made by the organizing committee are final and binding in all matters related to the challenge and its outcomes. It is hereby clarified that there are no registration fees or participation charges for this Global Challenge. Any individual or entity claiming otherwise will attract penal action. Participants are advised not to make any payments to any person or organization for the Innovation Challenges. The organizers shall not be responsible for any loss arising from any such dealing with unauthorized persons.

AI by HER: 
 Global Impact Challenge

Thank you for the exceptional response! Applications are now under evaluation.

About the Challenge

AI by HER: The Impact Challenge for Women in AI is a global innovation challenge inviting women technologists to demonstrate AI solutions tackling large scale or novel real-world public challenges. This initiative is being implemented in partnership with NITI Aayog- Women Entrepreneurship Platform. 

Focused on inclusive innovation and global impact, this initiative promotes gender equity, Global South innovation, and aims to showcase scalable AI-for-good applications at the India-AI Impact Summit to be held in New Delhi, India, in February 2026.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Download Submission Guidelines

Key Objectives

Identify Women-Led Teams

Identify women-led teams globally working on innovative and impactful AI centric solutions addressing real-world challenges.

Build a Dedicated Support Pipeline

Establish a dedicated support pipeline for women-led AI innovations, including mentorship, visibility, and post-event scale-up opportunities. Conduct two virtual bootcamps: Responsible AI and Investor Readiness & Pitching Sessions.

Create a Platform

Create a platform for the top teams (up to 30 globally) to present at the India-AI Impact Summit.

Curate an Exclusive Investor Pitch Session

Curate an exclusive Investor Pitch Session for these (up to 30 globally) high-potential women-led AI solutions.

Indicative Themes

We welcome innovative AI solutions that are scalable, broadly deployable, and capable of delivering significant public value across diverse sectors. The thematic areas outlined below are indicative, and applicants are encouraged to propose any solution that demonstrates clear societal impact.

Education

AI that personalizes, democratizes, and scales learning, including adaptive algorithms, multimodal content, speech recognition in underrepresented languages, and intelligent tutors, closing gaps and supporting lifelong learning.

Health

AI that improves care through medical imaging, predictive analytics, digital biomarkers, federated learning, and AI enabled telemedicine, with a focus on accessibility, affordability, and scalable adoption across diverse systems.

Energy & Climate

AI across the energy spectrum, from conventional to renewables, for predictive maintenance, grid optimization, and demand forecasting, with climate uses like geospatial weather prediction, digital twins for resilient infrastructure, emissions tracking, and ecosystem conservation.

Wildcard / Open Innovation

An open track for novel, cross sector AI ideas that do not fit above themes, encouraging interdisciplinary work in governance, manufacturing, urban development, healthcare, and other emerging areas that show clear public value.

Cybersecurity, Safety & Digital Wellbeing

AI for trusted digital participation, covering anomaly detection, intrusion prevention, privacy preserving identity, and NLP tools to counter misinformation or harassment, plus behavioral modeling and sentiment analysis for mental wellbeing at scale.

Agriculture

AI for food security and sustainable farming, including precision agriculture, drone or satellite monitoring, yield prediction, automated pest and disease detection, blockchain based supply chains, and edge AI for resource use.

Education

AI that personalizes, democratizes, and scales learning, including adaptive algorithms, multimodal content, speech recognition in underrepresented languages, and intelligent tutors, closing gaps and supporting lifelong learning.

Health

AI that improves care through medical imaging, predictive analytics, digital biomarkers, federated learning, and AI enabled telemedicine, with a focus on accessibility, affordability, and scalable adoption across diverse systems.

Energy & Climate

AI across the energy spectrum, from conventional to renewables, for predictive maintenance, grid optimization, and demand forecasting, with climate uses like geospatial weather prediction, digital twins for resilient infrastructure, emissions tracking, and ecosystem conservation.

Wildcard / Open Innovation

An open track for novel, cross sector AI ideas that do not fit above themes, encouraging interdisciplinary work in governance, manufacturing, urban development, healthcare, and other emerging areas that show clear public value.

Cybersecurity, Safety & Digital Wellbeing

AI for trusted digital participation, covering anomaly detection, intrusion prevention, privacy preserving identity, and NLP tools to counter misinformation or harassment, plus behavioral modeling and sentiment analysis for mental wellbeing at scale.

Agriculture

AI for food security and sustainable farming, including precision agriculture, drone or satellite monitoring, yield prediction, automated pest and disease detection, blockchain based supply chains, and edge AI for resource use.

Education

AI that personalizes, democratizes, and scales learning, including adaptive algorithms, multimodal content, speech recognition in underrepresented languages, and intelligent tutors, closing gaps and supporting lifelong learning.

Health

AI that improves care through medical imaging, predictive analytics, digital biomarkers, federated learning, and AI enabled telemedicine, with a focus on accessibility, affordability, and scalable adoption across diverse systems.

Who Can Apply?

01

Applicant Criteria

Applicants must be women-led teams or entities building innovative and impactful AI centric solutions addressing real-world challenges

02

Women-led criteria

The company /startup/consortium is led by a woman or a woman is in a key decision-making role and leadership position (CEO, CTO, COO). Or the core applying team includes at least one woman as technical lead, product lead, or business lead.

03

Team Composition

Up to three members At least two team members who could represent the shortlisted AI solution  during the Summit, presentations, and evaluations must be women.

What Is In The Challenge For You

Awards up to INR 2.50 Cr

Awards of INR 25,00,000 to each of the top 10 winners and potential incentives such as cloud and compute credits

Summit Showcase

Top finalists (upto 30) receive travel and accommodation support to participate in the India-AI Impact Summit in New Delhi for global visibility, investor connections and networking opportunities. A separate Investor Pitch Session will be curated for such high-potential women-led AI solutions.

Mentorship and Bootcamps

Mentorship from industry experts on business strategy, pitch readiness etc.

Post Summit Opportunities

Recognition of the top solutions in the AI Innovation Compendium and potential mentorship from premier institutions to enable real-world deployment and scaling

Challenge Process

Evaluation

Solution Definition

Technical Feasibility

Business Model

Team Competence

Potential Impact

FAQs

Who can apply to this challenge?

• Women-led teams - The core applying team includes at least one woman as technical lead, product lead, or business lead. They may also be students, associated with Universities, Research Institutions, and Autonomous Bodies focused on research.
• Women-led entities- Working Women Professionals- representing Start-ups, Commercial Enterprises, Public Sector Organizations or Non-Profit Entities in a key decision making role and leadership position(CEO, CTO,COO).

Is the challenge open to people from any country?

Yes. Teams from across the globe are welcome to apply. We strongly encourage a diverse range of solutions from all regions.

Can I submit an existing solution, or does it need to be new?

You can submit AI solutions that are pilot-ready (solutions that are ready for or have completed pilot) or already scaling (solutions with presence in the market).

What must be the stage of my solution?

Entries must show a working AI prototype or a mature solution.

What kind of support will I receive throughout the challenge process?

You may be invited to be part of workshops for scaling AI solutions, refining GTM etc. and opportunities to participate in bootcamps for refining your pitching skills, empowering you to confidently present and showcase your innovative solutions.

How will my solutions be evaluated?

All the solutions will be evaluated in a two stage process:
• Round 1: Solutions will be scored and shortlisted based on five broad parameters: Solution Definition, Technical Feasibility, Business Model, Team Competence, and Potential Impact.
• Round 2: Shortlisted innovators will be invited for presentation to a jury panel who will assess them on the outlined parameters and the presentation.

Do I retain intellectual property?

Yes, intellectual property remains with the participants.

How will the applicants receive the award money?

• Award money shall be credited to the bank account of the registered entity under which the AI solution is registered. If the participating team has not yet registered themselves as a Company or Startup they can still participate. However, they will be required to be registered as a Company or Startup before the Summit to be eligible for receiving the award money.
• All award money is subject to applicable taxes and deductions under Indian laws.

What support is available beyond award money?

Finalists will have access to:
• Global Exposure: Opportunity to present your solution to an audience of leaders and experts at the AI Impact Summit.
• Networking and Mentorship: Opportunity to connect with and receive mentorship, funding and scaling opportunities support from leading investors and ecosystem experts.
• Valuable Resources: Access to potential compute and cloud credits to further develop, deploy and scale your solutions.

Are travel and accommodation covered for finalists who make it to the Impact Summit?

• Yes. The Summit will cover travel and accommodation for up to two members per finalist team (maximum of upto 30 finalist teams in total).
• If a third team member wishes to attend, their travel and accommodation expenses must be borne by the team member itself.

What is the recommended team composition?

Team Composition Guidelines
• Individual Applications: If applying as a single participant, the applicant must be a woman.
• Two-Member Teams: At least one member must be a woman, holding key roles as defined in the Who can Apply section.
• Three-Member Teams: At least two members must be women, and they should be able to represent the team during the Summit, including presentations, pitching sessions, and evaluation rounds.

Queries

All queries must be emailed to fellow1[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  &  fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  using the subject line:

“AI by HER: Global Impact Challenge – Query - [Applicant Name]”.

Important Notes

Applicants are advised to visit the website regularly for further updates. The team leaders of the shortlisted entries will be contacted via their registered email IDs with further instructions and communication. All shortlisted teams are required to adhere to the Rules and Regulations and Eligibility Criteria as outlined on the official call for application. They must also submit all necessary documents as requested to proceed to the next stage. Participation is subject to local and international laws and that applicants are fully responsible for compliance. All personal data collected from participants will be handled, stored, and processed in strict accordance with the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023, and other applicable laws and regulations enforced in India.
IndiaAI reserves the right to amend timelines, processes, or eligibility criteria in unforeseen circumstances, in the interest of fair competition and operational feasibility.

Disclaimer & Limitation of Liability

IndiaAI, Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), its officers, employees, partners, and collaborating organizations assume no responsibility or liability for any loss, damage, or inconvenience caused as a result of participation in these challenges. By submitting an application or participating in the India AI Impact Summit challenges, participants agree and acknowledge that participation is at their own risk. The organizers reserve the right to modify, postpone, or cancel any part of the challenge or event, including rules, criteria, timelines, or awards, at their sole discretion, without prior notice. All participants are solely responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable local and international laws. The organizers shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of participation or inability to participate. Submission of entries does not guarantee selection, awards, or any future engagement. Any decisions made by the organizing committee are final and binding in all matters related to the challenge and its outcomes. It is hereby clarified that there are no registration fees or participation charges for this Global Challenge. Any individual or entity claiming otherwise will attract penal action. Participants are advised not to make any payments to any person or organization for the Innovation Challenges. The organizers shall not be responsible for any loss arising from any such dealing with unauthorized persons.

YUVAi - Global Youth 
 Challenge

Thank you for the exceptional response! Applications are now under evaluation.

About the Challenge

The YUVAi – Global Youth Challenge is your chance to dream big with AI! Implementing in partnership with MyBharat and NIELIT, this innovation program invites young innovators in the age group 13-21, to bring their most innovative AI solutions to solve real-world problems.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Download Submission Guidelines

Download Consent Form

Key Objectives

Provide opportunities for youth

Engage with global AI experts through workshops and mentorships.

Organize 10 days virtual bootcamps

Equip shortlisted applicants with skills, tools, and knowledge to strengthen their AI solutions.

Platform for young innovators

Showcase their work to a global audience, exchange ideas with peers worldwide, and gain invaluable exposure.

Indicative Themes

We welcome all innovative AI solutions that are widely deployable, demonstrate high impact potential at large scale, and address critical needs across diverse sectors.

Empowering people and communities

AI solutions for elderly care, youth mental wellbeing and physical fitness, nutrition and holistic growth, equitable access to education, and empowering students with disabilities.

Transforming core sectors

AI solutions for sustainable agricultural production, green manufacturing, transportation and logistics, industrial transformation, and waste-to-wealth initiatives.

Future-ready infrastructure and smart ecosystems

AI solutions for safe and smart cities with sustainable infrastructure and mobility, clean and green environments, affordable clean energy, and improved last-mile public service delivery.

Wild Card/Open Innovation

An open track for novel cross-sector AI solutions beyond listed themes, with transformative potential for scale and impact.

Who Can Apply?

01

Youth Individual

Applicants in the age group 13-21 can apply as youth individuals.

02

Youth Teams

Applicants in the age group 13-21 can apply as youth teams with up to 2 members.

What Is In The Challenge For You

Awards & Recognition: Prizes worth Rs. 85 Lacs

First Prize: ₹15 Lacs each (Top 3 solutions)

Second prize: ₹10 Lacs each (Next 3 solutions)

Special Recognition Awards: 2 awards of ₹5 Lacs each

Certificates for all participants, and exclusive credits/giveaways for winners

Summit Showcase

Top 20 shortlisted applicants get to present their innovation at the AI Impact Summit 2026 during the International Demo Day

Top solutions with highest deployment potential get to present their solutions at Impact Summit investor showcase

Mentorship & Training

Join 10-days virtual bootcamps with expert mentors

Enhance your solution, sharpen your pitch, and boost your innovation potential

Post-Summit Opportunities

Permanent showcase: Top 20 solutions featured on the Summit website

AI Innovation Compendium: Winning solutions published in a global report

Scaling with impact: Selected winners may receive mentorship from premier Indian institutions for real-world deployment

Challenge Process

FAQs

Who can apply to this challenge?

The challenge is open to applicants in the age group 13 - 21 years. Applicants can apply as individuals, or in teams with up to 2 members. All team members should be <=21 years of age as on 20th February, 2026.

Is the challenge open to applicants from any country?

Yes. Applicants from all countries are welcome to apply. We strongly encourage a diverse range of solutions from all regions and sectors.

Can I submit an existing solution, or does it need to be new?

You may submit either of the following:
A new solution, which is conceived through this challenge
An existing solution or a prototype that is already in development or deployment

What must be the stage of my solution?

Applicants can submit proof of concepts / working prototypes / deployable AI solutions that can be demonstrated and have large scale impact.

What documents do I need to submit?

Each applicant must submit the following:

• Consent Form – PDF containing duly signed consent forms of all applicants as per prescribed template
• References/Citations – A PDF (maximum 2 pages) listing sources for any data or facts used in developing the solution
• Video Demo (2-3 minutes) – Including self-introduction, project/solution description, demonstration, technology used, and future scope. English subtitles must be added.

What support will I receive if I get selected after Round 1?

Shortlisted applicants will get the opportunity to join 10 days of virtual bootcamps and workshops to enhance their innovation potential and AI skills.

What support will I receive if I get selected after Round 2?

Winners will get an opportunity to win awards upto INR 85 Lakhs, along with giveaways, and present your solution on the global stage at the AI Impact Summit in India (February 2026).

How will my solution be evaluated?

All the solutions will be evaluated in a two stage process:
Phase 1: Solutions will be screened and shortlisted based on thematic alignment, innovative idea, scaling and impact potential.
Phase 2: Shortlisted innovators will be invited for presentation to a jury panel who will assess them on parameters as specified in.

Do I retain intellectual property?

Yes, intellectual property remains with the participants.

How will I receive the prize money?

For winners below 18 years of age, the prize money shall be credited to the bank account of designated primary guardian.
For winners aged 18 to 21 years, the prize money shall be credited to the bank account of the designated team leader.
Please note that all prize money is subject to taxes and deductions as applicable under the Indian laws.

What support is available beyond prize money?

Participants get an opportunity to present their solutions at the AI Impact Summit apart from exposure to the global AI ecosystem, investor showcases for winning solutions, mentorship and expert guidance, credits, and exciting giveaways.

Are travel and accommodation covered for finalists who make it to the Impact Summit?

Yes, travel and accommodation for finalists (up to 2 members per team, and 1 adult guardian per team, in case of minor applicants) will be covered by the AI Impact Summit team.

Queries

All queries must be emailed to fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  using the subject line:

"YUVAi: Global Youth Challenge – Query - [Applicant Name]".

Important Notes

Applicants are advised to visit the website regularly for further updates. The team leaders of the shortlisted entries will be contacted via their registered email IDs with further instructions and communication. All shortlisted teams are required to adhere to the Rules and Regulations and Eligibility Criteria as outlined on the official call for application. They must also submit all necessary documents as requested to proceed to the next stage. Participation is subject to local and international laws and that applicants are fully responsible for compliance. All personal data collected from participants will be handled, stored, and processed in strict accordance with the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023, and other applicable laws and regulations enforced in India. IndiaAI reserves the right to amend timelines, processes, or eligibility criteria in unforeseen circumstances, in the interest of fair competition and operational feasibility.

Disclaimer & Limitation of Liability

IndiaAI, Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), its officers, employees, partners, and collaborating organizations assume no responsibility or liability for any loss, damage, or inconvenience caused as a result of participation in these challenges. By submitting an application or participating in the India AI Impact Summit challenges, participants agree and acknowledge that participation is at their own risk. The organizers reserve the right to modify, postpone, or cancel any part of the challenge or event, including rules, criteria, timelines, or awards, at their sole discretion, without prior notice. All participants are solely responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable local and international laws. The organizers shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of participation or inability to participate. Submission of entries does not guarantee selection, awards, or any future engagement. Any decisions made by the organizing committee are final and binding in all matters related to the challenge and its outcomes. It is hereby clarified that there are no registration fees or participation charges for this Global Challenge. Any individual or entity claiming otherwise will attract penal action. Participants are advised not to make any payments to any person or organization for the Innovation Challenges. The organizers shall not be responsible for any loss arising from any such dealing with unauthorized persons.
