YUVAi - Global Youth 
 Challenge

Thank you for the exceptional response! Applications are now under evaluation.

About the Challenge

The YUVAi – Global Youth Challenge is your chance to dream big with AI! Implementing in partnership with MyBharat and NIELIT, this innovation program invites young innovators in the age group 13-21, to bring their most innovative AI solutions to solve real-world problems.

Application window has now closed. Shortlisted candidates will be reached out on their registered email address.

Download Submission Guidelines

Download Consent Form

Key Objectives

Provide opportunities for youth

Engage with global AI experts through workshops and mentorships.

Organize 10 days virtual bootcamps

Equip shortlisted applicants with skills, tools, and knowledge to strengthen their AI solutions.

Platform for young innovators

Showcase their work to a global audience, exchange ideas with peers worldwide, and gain invaluable exposure.

Indicative Themes

We welcome all innovative AI solutions that are widely deployable, demonstrate high impact potential at large scale, and address critical needs across diverse sectors.

Empowering people and communities

AI solutions for elderly care, youth mental wellbeing and physical fitness, nutrition and holistic growth, equitable access to education, and empowering students with disabilities.

Transforming core sectors

AI solutions for sustainable agricultural production, green manufacturing, transportation and logistics, industrial transformation, and waste-to-wealth initiatives.

Future-ready infrastructure and smart ecosystems

AI solutions for safe and smart cities with sustainable infrastructure and mobility, clean and green environments, affordable clean energy, and improved last-mile public service delivery.

Wild Card/Open Innovation

An open track for novel cross-sector AI solutions beyond listed themes, with transformative potential for scale and impact.

Who Can Apply?

01

Youth Individual

Applicants in the age group 13-21 can apply as youth individuals.

02

Youth Teams

Applicants in the age group 13-21 can apply as youth teams with up to 2 members.

What Is In The Challenge For You

Awards & Recognition: Prizes worth Rs. 85 Lacs

First Prize: ₹15 Lacs each (Top 3 solutions)

Second prize: ₹10 Lacs each (Next 3 solutions)

Special Recognition Awards: 2 awards of ₹5 Lacs each

Certificates for all participants, and exclusive credits/giveaways for winners

Summit Showcase

Top 20 shortlisted applicants get to present their innovation at the AI Impact Summit 2026 during the International Demo Day

Top solutions with highest deployment potential get to present their solutions at Impact Summit investor showcase

Mentorship & Training

Join 10-days virtual bootcamps with expert mentors

Enhance your solution, sharpen your pitch, and boost your innovation potential

Post-Summit Opportunities

Permanent showcase: Top 20 solutions featured on the Summit website

AI Innovation Compendium: Winning solutions published in a global report

Scaling with impact: Selected winners may receive mentorship from premier Indian institutions for real-world deployment

Challenge Process

FAQs

Who can apply to this challenge?

The challenge is open to applicants in the age group 13 - 21 years. Applicants can apply as individuals, or in teams with up to 2 members. All team members should be <=21 years of age as on 20th February, 2026.

Is the challenge open to applicants from any country?

Yes. Applicants from all countries are welcome to apply. We strongly encourage a diverse range of solutions from all regions and sectors.

Can I submit an existing solution, or does it need to be new?

You may submit either of the following:
A new solution, which is conceived through this challenge
An existing solution or a prototype that is already in development or deployment

What must be the stage of my solution?

Applicants can submit proof of concepts / working prototypes / deployable AI solutions that can be demonstrated and have large scale impact.

What documents do I need to submit?

Each applicant must submit the following:

• Consent Form – PDF containing duly signed consent forms of all applicants as per prescribed template
• References/Citations – A PDF (maximum 2 pages) listing sources for any data or facts used in developing the solution
• Video Demo (2-3 minutes) – Including self-introduction, project/solution description, demonstration, technology used, and future scope. English subtitles must be added.

What support will I receive if I get selected after Round 1?

Shortlisted applicants will get the opportunity to join 10 days of virtual bootcamps and workshops to enhance their innovation potential and AI skills.

What support will I receive if I get selected after Round 2?

Winners will get an opportunity to win awards upto INR 85 Lakhs, along with giveaways, and present your solution on the global stage at the AI Impact Summit in India (February 2026).

How will my solution be evaluated?

All the solutions will be evaluated in a two stage process:
Phase 1: Solutions will be screened and shortlisted based on thematic alignment, innovative idea, scaling and impact potential.
Phase 2: Shortlisted innovators will be invited for presentation to a jury panel who will assess them on parameters as specified in.

Do I retain intellectual property?

Yes, intellectual property remains with the participants.

How will I receive the prize money?

For winners below 18 years of age, the prize money shall be credited to the bank account of designated primary guardian.
For winners aged 18 to 21 years, the prize money shall be credited to the bank account of the designated team leader.
Please note that all prize money is subject to taxes and deductions as applicable under the Indian laws.

What support is available beyond prize money?

Participants get an opportunity to present their solutions at the AI Impact Summit apart from exposure to the global AI ecosystem, investor showcases for winning solutions, mentorship and expert guidance, credits, and exciting giveaways.

Are travel and accommodation covered for finalists who make it to the Impact Summit?

Yes, travel and accommodation for finalists (up to 2 members per team, and 1 adult guardian per team, in case of minor applicants) will be covered by the AI Impact Summit team.

Queries

All queries must be emailed to fellow3[dot]gpai-india[at]meity[dot]gov[dot]in  using the subject line:

"YUVAi: Global Youth Challenge – Query - [Applicant Name]".

Important Notes

Applicants are advised to visit the website regularly for further updates. The team leaders of the shortlisted entries will be contacted via their registered email IDs with further instructions and communication. All shortlisted teams are required to adhere to the Rules and Regulations and Eligibility Criteria as outlined on the official call for application. They must also submit all necessary documents as requested to proceed to the next stage. Participation is subject to local and international laws and that applicants are fully responsible for compliance. All personal data collected from participants will be handled, stored, and processed in strict accordance with the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023, and other applicable laws and regulations enforced in India. IndiaAI reserves the right to amend timelines, processes, or eligibility criteria in unforeseen circumstances, in the interest of fair competition and operational feasibility.

Disclaimer & Limitation of Liability

IndiaAI, Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), its officers, employees, partners, and collaborating organizations assume no responsibility or liability for any loss, damage, or inconvenience caused as a result of participation in these challenges. By submitting an application or participating in the India AI Impact Summit challenges, participants agree and acknowledge that participation is at their own risk. The organizers reserve the right to modify, postpone, or cancel any part of the challenge or event, including rules, criteria, timelines, or awards, at their sole discretion, without prior notice. All participants are solely responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable local and international laws. The organizers shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of participation or inability to participate. Submission of entries does not guarantee selection, awards, or any future engagement. Any decisions made by the organizing committee are final and binding in all matters related to the challenge and its outcomes. It is hereby clarified that there are no registration fees or participation charges for this Global Challenge. Any individual or entity claiming otherwise will attract penal action. Participants are advised not to make any payments to any person or organization for the Innovation Challenges. The organizers shall not be responsible for any loss arising from any such dealing with unauthorized persons.

India AI Impact Summit 2026

Register Now

Venue & Date : Bharat Mandapam, Pragati Maidan, New Delhi | February 2026

Home

About Us

Agenda

AI Impact Events

Working Groups

Regional Summit

Media

Contact Us

Open main menu

Home

About Us

Agenda

AI Impact Events

Working Groups

Regional Summit

Media

Contact Us

Register Now

About the Call

India will host the India - AI Impact Summit in 2026 to shape a future-oriented agenda for impactful Artificial Intelligence (AI) cooperation and mark a strategic shift from "Action" to "Impact". The summit aims to ensure that AI serves as a catalyst for inclusive human development, environmental sustainability, and equitable progress worldwide, bridging the Global AI Divide through concrete multilateral action and enabling AI to strengthen communities, protect our planet, and accelerate progress toward a just and sustainable future for all humanity.

This Call for Proposals invites organizations worldwide to host events which will be included in the official Summit program for the India - AI Impact Summit 2026. The events must be conducted in person at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi, from 16th February to 20th February 2026. Organizations are encouraged to design sessions that align with the Summit’s themes, foster diverse participation, and generate actionable insights or outcomes that strengthen the global dialogue on AI for People, Planet, and Progress.

The Summit will be structured around seven core themes or Chakras: Human Capital, Inclusion for Social Empowerment, Safe and Trusted AI, Resilience, Innovation, and Efficiency, Science, Democratizing AI Resources, and AI for Economic Growth and Social Good.

By hosting events at the Summit, organizations can play a meaningful role in shaping its deliberations and driving outcomes that advance impactful and globally relevant discourse on AI.

The application window is now closed. We have received over 700 proposals. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted on their registered email addresses.

Key Details

Who can Apply?

The following organizations are welcome to apply as part of this Call for Proposals:

Government agencies

Academic and Research Institutions

Multilateral and Intergovernmental Organizations

Private Sector Organizations

Non-profits, Think Tanks, and Civil Society Organizations

Industry or Professional Associations

Joint proposals between multiple stakeholders (especially across countries or sectors) are encouraged.

Event Themes:

Events must demonstrate clear alignment with the objectives and themes of the India - AI Impact Summit namely:

Human Capital

Inclusion for Social Empowerment

Safe and Trusted AI

Resilience, Innovation & Efficiency

Science

Democratizing AI Resources

AI for Economic Growth & Social Good

Each applicant may submit only one proposal for consideration in one theme. Please find more information on the themes of the AI Impact Summit at:

https://impact.indiaai.gov.in/about-summit

.

Event Formats:

Eligible event types include:

Panel discussions

Roundtables

Workshops

Fireside Chats/Moderated Dialogues

Leadership Talks & Industry Forums

Academic Presentations & Other Talks

Please note that fully virtual sessions will not be considered for inclusion in the official Summit program.

Key Dates

Launch of Call for Proposals: 15th October 2025

Last Date for Submission of Proposals: 30th November 2025

Submission of Proposals

Before applying, please review the detailed Call for Proposals to understand the objectives, eligibility, event formats, and applicable terms and conditions.

View Call for Proposal

For queries, write to:

impactsummit-events[at]indiaai[dot]gov[dot]in

With the subject line: "Call for Proposals | Events at the Impact Summit | Your Organization Name"

documents.title: India AI Impact Summit 2026
documents.raw_text:
India AI Impact Summit 2026

Register Now

Venue & Date : Bharat Mandapam, Pragati Maidan, New Delhi | February 2026

Home

About Us

Agenda

AI Impact Events

Working Groups

Regional Summit

Media

Home

About Us

AI Impact Events

Working Groups

Regional Summit

Media

Contact Us

Media and Resources

Press Releases

Reports and Resources

DECEMBER 29, 2025

India AI Impact Summit 2026 to focus on ‘Democratizing AI, Bridging the AI Divide’

IndiaAI Mission, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) briefed the media in New Delhi today on the vision, thematic structure, and progress of the India AI Impact Summit 2026. The press conference was chaired by Shri S. Krishnan, Secretary, MeitY and was attended by Shri Abhishek Singh, Additional Secretary, MeitY, CEO, IndiaAI and DG, NIC; Shri Akhil Kumar, MD and CEO, Digital India Corporation; Shri Amitesh Kumar Sinha, Additional Secretary, MeitY and CEO, India Semiconductor Mission; Shri Krishan Kumar Singh, Joint Secretary, MeitY; Shri Sudeep Shrivastava, Joint Secretary, MeitY; Shri Nand Kumarum, President and CEO, NeGD; Dr. Sanjay Bahl, DG, CERT-In; Shri Manoj Kumar Jain, Scientist G and Group Coordinator, MeitY; Shri K Mohammed Y. Safirulla, Director, IndiaAI, and Ms. Shikha Dahiya, Joint Director, IndiaAI among other officials.

Read More

DECEMBER 17, 2025

Shri Jitin Prasada, Union Minister of State delivers the national statement at the High-level Meeting of the United Nations General Assembly on the overall review of the implementation of the outcomes of the World Summit on the Information Society (WSIS+20) in New York

Union Minister of State, Ministry of Commerce and Industry and Ministry of Electronics and IT, Shri Jitin Prasada represented India and delivered the national statement at the High-Level Meeting of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) on the overall review of the implementation of the outcomes of the World Summit on the Information Society (WSIS+20) in New York, USA on 16 December, 2025.

Read More

DECEMBER 17, 2025

Shri Jitin Prasada, Union Minister of State addresses and event titled “From Action to Impact” - A Curtain Raiser to the AI Impact Summit

Shri Jitin Prasada, Union Minister of State for Commerce & Industry and Electronics & Information Technology of India addressed an event titled “From Action to Impact”- A Curtain Raiser to the AI Impact Summit (19 – 20 February 2026, New Delhi), jointly organised by India and France in the United Nations Headquarters, New York on 16 December, 2025.

Read More

DECEMBER 11, 2025

IndiaAI Mission and Government of Gujarat hosting the Regional Conclave on AI for Good Governance ahead of India–AI Impact Summit 2026

Strengthening India’s commitment to scaling responsible, inclusive, and innovation-led AI ecosystems across states, the IndiaAI Mission under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India, in collaboration with the Government of Gujarat and Indian Institute of Technology, Gandhinagar is convening a Regional Pre-Summit Event on 11 December 2025 at Mahatma Mandir, Gandhinagar.

Read More

DECEMBER 11, 2025

IndiaAI Mission, Central Square Foundation and EkStep Foundation Invite Global Submissions for Casebook on Real-World Impact of AI in Education

The IndiaAI Mission, under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India, in partnership with Central Square Foundation and EkStep Foundation, has opened a global Call for Use Cases for the Casebook on the Real-World Impact of Artificial Intelligence in Education. The casebook will spotlight proven, scalable AI applications that are transforming learning outcomes, strengthening teaching, and improving access to quality education across emerging and developing economies.

Read More

DECEMBER 11, 2025

IndiaAI Mission and Government of Gujarat Advance National Push for Scalable & Inclusive AI Ahead of India–AI Impact Summit 2026

Chief Minister of Gujarat Shri Bhupendrabhai Rajnikant Patel inaugurated the Pre-Summit Conference on AI for Good Governance: Empowering India Digital Future, jointly hosted by the IndiaAI Mission under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India in collaboration with the Government of Gujarat and Indian Institute of Technology, Gandhinagar, at Mahatma Mandir. The conference is a key pre-event leading up to the India–AI Impact Summit 2026, scheduled to be held from 15-20 February 2026 in New Delhi.

Read More

DECEMBER 09, 2025

IT Madras and IndiaAI Mission to Host Global Conclave on Safe & Trusted AI Ahead of India - AI Impact Summit 2026

Towards advancing India’s vision for safe, trusted, and inclusive AI, the Centre for Responsible AI (CeRAI) at IIT Madras in collaboration with the IndiaAI Mission under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India, is hosting a Pre-Summit Event convening on 11 December in Chennai, ahead of the India–AI Impact Summit 2026. The programme will open with a formal inauguration on the evening of 10 December, followed by a full-day Pre-Summit Event and a hybrid, closed-door Working Group meeting on 11 December.

Read More

DECEMBER 03, 2025

India-AI Impact Summit 2026 reflects India’s growing role in global AI discussions

In line with Hon’ble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi's vision, the Government is democratising the development and usage of technology. The focus is using Artificial Intelligence (AI) for solving real-world problems and ultimately improving lives across various sectors.

Read More

DECEMBER 01, 2025

IndiaAI and UN Women Issue Global Call for Abstracts on Gender-Transformative AI Solutions

The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India, and UN Women India have launched a global Call for Nominations for a Compendium focusing on the real-world impact of Artificial Intelligence in advancing gender equality. This initiative is part of broader engagements leading up to the India-AI Impact Summit 2026 and aims to showcase measurable and verifiable AI applications that are positively impacting women and girls, particularly in the Global South.

Read More

NOVEMBER 22, 2025

Day 3 of Regional Open Digital Health Summit 2025 highlights need for sustainable financing, regional Collaboration, and AI-enabled governance

The Regional Open Digital Health Summit (RODHS) 2025 wrapped up its third and final day of progressive discussions in New Delhi, bringing together leaders from government departments and experts from international organisations and the health technology sector to put in motion a framework for Digital Health and AI collaboration across the South-East Asia region.

Read More

NOVEMBER 20, 2025

India-AI Impact Summit 2026 Pre-Summit Conference Held in Thiruvananthapuram

The Software Technology Park of India (STPI) and the ISACA Thiruvananthapuram Chapter hosted a pre-summit conference for the upcoming India-AI Impact Summit 2026. The event, held in Thiruvananthapuram, focused on the theme of "Safe and Trusted AI for Fintech, Healthcare, and Citizen Safety." Dr. A. Jayathilak, IAS, Chief Secretary, Government of Kerala, inaugurated the conference and emphasized India's AI mission on defining ethical, inclusive, and secure AI, and Kerala's potential to lead in demonstrating trustworthy AI. He also highlighted the dual nature of AI, empowering while demanding responsibility, and urged collaboration across various sectors to shape the global moral compass of AI.

NOVEMBER 18, 2025

Shri Jitin Prasada Addresses AI Impact Festival, Sets Momentum for India AI Impact Summit 2026

Shri Jitin Prasada, Minister of State, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology and Ministry of Commerce and Industry, Government of India, today addressed the AI Impact Festival - an official pre-summit event in the run up to the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, hosted by Intel in partnership with the Ministry of Education, CBSE, NITI Aayog's Atal Innovation Mission (AIM), NIELIT, and INSPIRE-MANAK.

Read More

NOVEMBER 18, 2025

Government of India launches ‘YUVA AI for ALL’ - a free national course to help everyone understand Artificial Intelligence

The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), under the IndiaAI  Mission, has launched ‘YUVA AI for ALL’, a first-of-its-kind free course that introduces the world of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to all Indians, especially the youth.

Read More

NOVEMBER 15, 2025

Union Minister of State Shri Jitin Prasada Inaugurates the MeitY's Pavilion at the 44th India International Trade Fair (IITF 2025)

Shri Jitin Prasada, Hon'ble Minister of State for the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) and Government of India, inaugurated the MeitY Pavilion at the 44th India International Trade Fair (IITF) at Bharat Mandapam. The pavilion brings together three major thematic zones that is Digital India, IndiaAI, and MyGov, offering visitors an immersive view of India's vision for digital public infrastructure, artificial intelligence for social good, and participatory governance.

Read More

NOVEMBER 12, 2025

Hurry Up! Innovators, Researchers and Entrepreneurs Invited to Showcase AI-Driven Energy Solutions to a Global Audience; Submit Abstracts by 21 November 2025 for Upcoming Casebook

The IndiaAI Mission, under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India, in collaboration with the International Energy Agency (IEA), has announced a global Call for Abstracts for the upcoming Casebook on the Real-World Impact of Artificial Intelligence in Energy. The collaboration seeks to leverage the IEA's global expertise and analytical framework while supporting the vision of the IndiaAI Mission to foster responsible, inclusive, and impactful AI adoption in alignment with the Global South's sustainable energy goals.

Read More

NOVEMBER 05, 2025

MeitY Unveils India AI Governance Guidelines under IndiaAI Mission to Ensure Safe, Inclusive, and Responsible Adoption of Artificial Intelligence across Sectors

The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), under the IndiaAI Mission, today unveiled the India AI Governance Guidelines, a comprehensive framework to ensure safe, inclusive, and responsible AI adoption across sectors.

Read More

NOVEMBER 05, 2025

AI Is a Horizontal, Cross-Cutting Technology That Can Transform Lives and Accelerate India's Progress towards Viksit Bharat 2047: Shri S Krishnan, Secretary, Meity

The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India, convened a high-level Panel Discussion on Artificial Intelligence at the Emerging Science, Technology & Innovation Conclave (ESTIC 2025). Chaired by Shri S. Krishnan, Secretary, MeitY, the session brought together leading voices from government, academia, and industry to explore how India can harness AI responsibly to drive innovation, inclusion, and global competitiveness.

Read More

OCTOBER 23, 2025

India Must Harness AI as a Force for Social Good to Drive Inclusive and Transformative Growth: Shri S. Krishnan, Secretary, MeitY

The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) organised a Curtain Raiser event on October 23, 2025, to build momentum for its participation in the Emerging Science, Technology, and Innovation Conclave (ESTIC) 2025.

Read More

OCTOBER 18, 2025

IndiaAI and WHO Partner to Spotlight Real-World AI Health Breakthroughs; Call for Submission of Abstracts highlighting impactful and scalable applications of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in health systems by 31st October 2025 to prepare Casebook

The Casebook will serve as a comprehensive reference for policymakers, innovators, and researchers to replicate real-world, scalable, and responsible AI health solutions across the Global South, accelerating digital transformation in healthcare systems

Read More

OCTOBER 17, 2025

Shri Jitin Prasada, Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT and Commerce and Industry inaugurates the Uttarakhand AI Impact Summit 2025 in Dehradun on October 17, 2025

Uttarakhand Hosts Pre-Summit to India–AI Impact Summit 2026, focusing on Responsible and Inclusive AI Growth

Read More

OCTOBER 16, 2025

Union Minister of State Shri Jitin Prasada to Inaugurate Uttarakhand AI Impact Summit 2025 in Dehradun on 17th October

Event to Bring Together Policymakers, Industry Leaders, Startups and Academia to Advance Digital Uttarakhand Vision through Innovation, Governance and Entrepreneurship, aligned with Digital India Vision

Read More

OCTOBER 13, 2025

Government of India invites applications for three Global Impact Challenges under India-AI Impact Summit 2026 with Total Prize Pool of ₹5.85 Crore; Applications Open Till October 31, 2025

Challenges to provide innovators with mentorship, investor access & a Global Platform to Scale their Ideas by developing AI driven solutions with High Potential for Social & Economic Impact

Read More

OCTOBER 07, 2025

IndiaAI Scales Up Safe AI Efforts with Cutting-Edge Solutions for Deepfake Detection, Bias Mitigation and AI Penetration Testing

Five Game-Changing Proposals Selected to Advance Safe & Trusted AI Ecosystem in India. ‘Saakshya’, ‘AI Vishleshak’ and IIT Kharagpur’s Voice Detection System to Fortify India’s AI Forensics and Security

Read More

OCTOBER 07, 2025

Global South Researchers Urged to Submit Posters for ‘Research Symposium on AI and Its Impact’, to be Held Alongside India-AI Impact Summit 2026

Symposium to Bridge Research, Policy and Practice to Promote India’s Vision of ‘AI for All, AI for Good and AI for the World’

Read More

SEPTEMBER 18, 2025

Government of India Unveils the Logo and Key Flagship Initiatives for the India-AI Impact Summit 2026

Union Minister Shri Ashwini Vaishnaw Unveiled the Logo and Key Flagship Initiatives for the India-AI Impact Summit 2026

Read More

About the Call

As part of the preparations for the India - AI Impact Summit, to be held on

19 – 20 February 2026

in

New Delhi, India

, we are launching a

Call for Proposals

inviting organisations worldwide to host affiliated

Pre-Summit Events

.

These events will provide a decentralised platform for catalysing discourse aligned with the Summit’s priorities. By bringing together diverse stakeholders and leveraging collective intelligence on AI, they will ensure robust, inclusive, and comprehensive contributions to the Summit’s themes.

By hosting a Pre-Summit Event, organisations can actively shape the Summit’s deliberations and outcomes. Selected events will receive

official co-branding

and

visibility

as part of the Summit’s global programme.

Key Details

Who can Apply?

Joint proposals across countries or sectors are encouraged.

Governments, Academic and Research Institutions, Multilateral Organisations, Private Sector Organisations, Non-profits, Think Tanks, Civil Society Organisations, and Industry or Professional Associations.

Event Formats:

Events must be in-person or hybrid. Fully virtual events are not eligible.

This Call for Proposals welcomes a diverse range of events that can contribute meaningfully to the Impact Summit's objectives. Eligible event types include, but are not limited to:

Workshops

Panel discussions

Roundtables & Policy Dialogues

Conferences and Symposiums

Technology showcases or demonstrations

Innovation challenges or hackathons

Academic Seminars and Research Presentations

Industry Forums and Business Summits

Fireside chats or moderated dialogues

Event Period:

Eligible events must be held between 11th August 2025 to 10th February 2026.

Application Period:

Rolling submissions. Indian organisations may apply at least 14 days before the date of the event. International entities and Indian entities hosting events outside India are recommended to apply at least one month before the date of the event.

Submission of Proposals

Before applying, please review the detailed

Call for Proposals

to understand the objectives, eligibility, event formats, evaluation criteria, and terms of affiliation.

View Call for Proposal

Apply Now

About the Conference

One of seven regional AI conferences leading to the India–AI Impact Summit 2026. Focused on People, Planet, and Progress, it promotes AI innovations and governance across the sector.

State Overview

State Overview

Gujarat is a leading state in India’s industrial and technological growth. Known for its robust   infrastructure, progressive policies, Ease of Doing Business initiatives, and an innovation-driven   ecosystem, Gujarat is fostering AI adoption across governance, agriculture, healthcare, and industry.

Host City

Host City

Gandhinagar, the capital of Gujarat, is a well-planned city with a clean, green environment and strong administrative infrastructure. It hosts Mahatma Mandir, one of India’s largest convention centers, and is home to GIFT City – India’s first smart city and international financial hub. With advanced IT parks, robust digital infrastructure, and excellent connectivity, Gandhinagar offers an ideal setting for technology-driven events and global collaborations.

Chief Secretary

Shri. Manoj Kumar Das IAS

Hon’ble Chief Secretary to the Government of Gujarat

Shri Manoj Kumar Das, born on 20 December 1966 in Darbhanga, Bihar, is a 1990-batch IAS officer of the Gujarat cadre and currently serves as the Chief Secretary to the Government of Gujarat. An alumnus of IIT Kharagpur with a B.Tech (Hons) in Computer Science, he brings over three decades of experience in public administration, combining strong technical expertise with strategic governance.

He has held pivotal roles including Municipal Commissioner of Vadodara and Surat, Additional Chief Secretary in key departments such as Industries & Mines, Ports & Transport, and Revenue, and a central deputation in the Ministry of Home Affairs. Shri Das is known for driving technology-enabled governance, e-governance reforms, and major initiatives like Industrial Policy 2020, Vibrant Gujarat Summit, and maritime infrastructure projects. His contributions to urban administration, industrial development, and infrastructure have earned multiple national awards for excellence in public service.

Summit Themes

AI for Smart Agriculture & Rural Prosperity

Leveraging AI to enhance crop productivity, optimize resources, and empower rural communities.

AI for Healthcare & Public Wellbeing

Intelligent healthcare solutions for accessible, affordable, and efficient public health services.

AI for Governance & Public Service Delivery

Driving transparency and efficiency through AI-enabled governance and citizen services.

AI for Urban & Rural Transformation

Building smart cities and villages through integrated AI solutions for infrastructure and services.

AI for FinTech & Digital Inclusion

Promoting financial inclusion and digital empowerment through AI-driven fintech innovations.

Nearby Attractions

Sabarmati Ashram

Historic site associated with Mahatma Gandhi, offering a glimpse into India’s   freedom movement.

Adalaj Stepwell

An intricately designed stepwell reflecting Gujarat’s architectural brilliance.

Gandhi Kutir at Mahatma Mandir

India’s largest museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, featuring immersive exhibits and modern technology to showcase his life and ideals.

Akshardham Temple

A magnificent temple showcasing traditional architecture and cultural heritage

Indroda Nature Park

Known as India’s Jurassic Park, featuring botanical gardens and wildlife exhibits.

Sabarmati Ashram

Historic site associated with Mahatma Gandhi, offering a glimpse into India’s   freedom movement.

Adalaj Stepwell

An intricately designed stepwell reflecting Gujarat’s architectural brilliance.

Gandhi Kutir at Mahatma Mandir

India’s largest museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, featuring immersive exhibits and modern technology to showcase his life and ideals.

Akshardham Temple

A magnificent temple showcasing traditional architecture and cultural heritage

Indroda Nature Park

Known as India’s Jurassic Park, featuring botanical gardens and wildlife exhibits.

Sabarmati Ashram

Historic site associated with Mahatma Gandhi, offering a glimpse into India’s   freedom movement.

Adalaj Stepwell

An intricately designed stepwell reflecting Gujarat’s architectural brilliance.

Gandhi Kutir at Mahatma Mandir

India’s largest museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, featuring immersive exhibits and modern technology to showcase his life and ideals.

Akshardham Temple

A magnificent temple showcasing traditional architecture and cultural heritage

Indroda Nature Park

Known as India’s Jurassic Park, featuring botanical gardens and wildlife exhibits.

Event Highlights

AI COE

The Government of Gujarat is committed to advancing technology-driven governance through the AI Centre of Excellence (AI COE). It is fostering innovation and empowering start-ups. With the signing of MoUs with Google, access to advanced AI and cloud platforms will be expanded.

MOUs

The MoU with Bhashini will facilitate adoption of India’s language AI stack for public service delivery and innovation. This partnership will empower start-ups, developers, and government teams with multilingual AI tools and resources.

AI-Stack

The Gujarat AI Stack is a unified platform delivering next-generation AI services for citizens, developers, and government. From crop disease detection and scheme assistance to document conversion, grievance classification, and procurement intelligence, everything is available as ready-to-use tools and powerful APIs.

About the Regional AI Conferences

India is set to convene the Impact Summit in February 2026, aiming to position AI as a driver for sectoral transformation across government, industry, and society.

Recognizing that national ambitions must be rooted in regional priorities, the government of India is planning a series of eight Regional AI Conferences which are to be held in eight different locations across India from October 2025 to January 2026. These will be organized in

Meghalaya, Gujarat, Odisha, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Kerala, and Telangana.

Regional AI Conferences will be conducted in partnership with state governments, premier knowledge institutions (IITs/IIMs), and thematic central ministries. It will be a high-level, outcome-oriented regional summit leading up to the India–AI Impact Summit 2026. It will see participation from the domestic ecosystem including local population, industries, startups, civil society, researchers and academia.

Showcasing Regional AI Strengths & Innovations

Regional summits will focus on themes aligned with regional strengths and priorities. It will provide an opportunity for states to showcase different AI initiatives taken up by the state government in the AI space.

Each regional event will serve to mobilize local innovation, foster multi-stakeholder dialogue, and prepare actionable recommendations for the central summit.

Regional summits will provide a platform for catalysing discourse aligned with the India-AI Summit's priorities. Discussions and outcomes may feed directly into the India–AI Impact Summit 2026 Outcome Document.

Expected Outcomes

Transforming India's AI landscape through regional collaboration

Present AI use cases in public service delivery

Showcase innovative AI applications transforming government services

Developing AI policies tailored to regional needs

Create context-specific frameworks for responsible AI deployment

Strengthen policy frameworks

Build robust governance structures for AI implementation

Demonstrate readiness for AI-driven industries

Highlight regional capabilities for industrial AI adoption

Create employment opportunities

Generate new jobs and skill development pathways in AI

Opportunities for State–Centre collaboration

Foster partnerships between state and central governments

Amplify regional AI awareness

Increase understanding and adoption of AI technologies

Long-term partnerships

Build sustainable collaborations between academia, startups, and governments

Explore Summits by State

Discover AI innovation hubs across India

Select a State

Click on any highlighted region on the map to explore upcoming AI summits and events in that state.

India AI Impact Summit 2026

About the Conference

The Regional AI Impact Conference, themed "AI for CE: Smarter Governance, Better Lives," will unite senior government officials, industry leaders, global tech firms, academia, and startups to explore how AI can enhance governance, climate resilience, and societal well-being.

The event will feature a dedicated session by the IndiaAI Mission team, along with engaging panel discussions on topics such as AI towards Climate Resilience and AI towards Effective Governance for a safer and equitable society. The event will also feature a showcase arena, which will provide a platform to various stakeholders to highlight their innovations, ideation workshops, and networking opportunities. The event will also act as a launchpad for initiatives such as the launch of the Bhashini Hackathon (Garo & Khasi), the MeghDEE program, and MoUs for establishing a Data & AI Lab and collaboration with MATH T-Hub, etc., to name a few. A roundtable meeting between the Hon'ble Chief Minister and leading investors will further position Meghalaya as a rising digital hub. A vibrant exhibition of AI and emerging technology initiatives by Government organisations, Academia and Industry will also be a major part of the event. Pre-event awareness campaigns by institutions like IIM Shillong, NIT Meghalaya, and NIELIT Shillong will build momentum ahead of the conclave.

State Overview

State Overview

Meghalaya, the "Abode of Clouds," is a land of breathtaking natural beauty, vibrant culture, and warm hospitality. With approximately 1,170 km of national highways, it has strategic potential for wider markets in the South and Southeast Asia. Meghalaya's favourable climate supports IT&ITES, electronics-related development, and its Industrial Policy promotes ease of doing business. Promising sectors include mineral-based industries, horticulture and agro-processing, electronics and IT, export units, tourism, and emerging service industries.

With a stable political environment and consistent double-digit GSDP growth in recent years, this uniquely positions Meghalaya as a top destination to attract investment from knowledge-based industries, including IT-ITeS services and emerging technology initiatives.

Population: 3.8 million, Economy: $5.9 Billion, Literacy Rate: 74.4%, Education Hub of North-Eastern states with IIM, NIT, NIFT, NLU, NEIGRIHMS, NEIAH etc., new growth centers such as New Shillong City, Mawkhanu Knowledge City, About 55% of Meghalaya's population in the working age group and BBIN2 corridor connecting with Bangladesh, Nepal & Bhutan.

Host City

Host City

Shillong, known for its picturesque beauty, rolling hills and cool climate, is often called the "Scotland of the East". The city blends colonial-era architecture with indigenous Khasi and Garo traditions, making it a hub for music, art, and eco-tourism. Among its historical landmarks stands a notable heritage structure, embodying the region's colonial past. Shillong's favorable climate, colonial heritage, and its industrial policy support ease of doing business in Information Technology and emerging technologies. Shillong is positioning itself as a gateway for niche industries in Northeast India. It is emerging as an IT hub with a focus on emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence (AI).

Chief Secretary

Dr Shakil P. Ahammed

Chief Secretary, Govt. Meghalaya

Chief Secretary: Dr Shakil P. Ahammed, IAS, a 1995-batch IAS officer of the Assam Meghalaya cadre and took over the charge of the Chief Secretary of Meghalaya on 30.09.2025

Summit Themes

AI for CE (Artificial Intelligence for Citizens' Empowerment): Smarter Governance, Better Lives

Two Panel discussions will be held on the following sub-theme:

A

AI for CE towards Climate Resilience

B

AI for CE towards Effective Governance for Safer & Equitable Societies

The core focus will be on citizen empowerment through the strategic application of Artificial Intelligence (AI). As India positions itself as a leading voice in the global AI landscape, it is essential to comprehensively understand the impact of AI interventions on the everyday lives of citizens. This impact spans multiple dimensions, and the idea exchanges during the conference will focus on three critical areas: climate resilience, effective governance, and the advancement of safer & more equitable societies.

Nearby Attractions

Wards Lake

Umiam Lake

Sohra

Shillong Peak

Nongjrong Viewpoint

Laitlum Canyons

Golf Link

Elephant Falls

Don Bosco Museum

Cathedral of Mary Help of Christians

Golf Link

Don Bosco Museum

Cathedral of Mary Help of Christians

Wards Lake

Umiam Lake

Nongjrong Viewpoint

Laitlum Canyons

Elephant Falls

Don Bosco Museum

Cathedral of Mary Help of Christians

Event Highlights

IT & ITeS investment Destination

One of the objectives of the conference is to showcase Meghalaya as the attractive IT and ITeS investment destination. With favourable policies, attractive incentives, sublime climate, techie and English-speaking workforce and infrastructure like Shillong Technology Park, Meghalaya is expecting to bring some big names of tech sector to the state. As part of the summit, with help from Invest India, an investment roundtable has been organized which would be chaired by Hon'ble CM of Meghalaya.

NE States Participation

Being the only state in NE India, hosting regional conference for India AI Impact Summit, we have requested all the NE states to come and participate in this conference.

About the Conference

Rajasthan Regional AI Impact Conference aims to position Rajasthan as a leading hub for responsible and inclusive AI adoption, accelerating innovation across governance, agriculture, healthcare, and citizen services. By bringing together national policymakers, industry leaders, and academia, the summit is expected to drive strategic collaborations, attract investments, and strengthen regional capacity building aligned with the IndiaAI Mission.

The state will host the Regional AI Impact Conference along with IIT Jodhpur as the knowledge partner. IIT Jodhpur is a future-driven institute for nurturing excellence of thought; creating, preserving, and imparting knowledge; and using transformational technologies/interventions with a multidisciplinary approach for responding to societal challenges and aspirations.

IIT Jodhpur has a strong and growing focus on Artificial Intelligence (AI) research opportunities, leveraging an interdisciplinary approach for emerging tech fields.

State Overview

State Overview

Rajasthan, India’s largest state by area, is known for its vibrant   cultural heritage, diverse geography, and rapidly growing digital and innovation ecosystem. The state combines strong tourism, agriculture, and industrial sectors with emerging strengths in technology, startups, and governance reforms. With progressive initiatives in digital services, AI adoption, and youth entrepreneurship—anchored by platforms like iStart and events such as Rajasthan Digifest—the state is positioning itself as a   forward-looking hub for innovation, sustainability, and inclusive   development.

Host City

Host City

Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan, is a vibrant blend of rich heritage   and modern urban development. Known as the Pink City and part of the UNESCO World Heritage–listed Jaipur City, it is a major cultural, tourism, and business hub in North India. With strong infrastructure, world-class convention facilities, a growing startup ecosystem, and leading academic institutions, Jaipur has emerged as a preferred destination for national level technology events, innovation forums, and large-scale conferences.

Chief Secretary

SHRI V. SRINIVAS

Chief Secretary, Government of Rajasthan

Shri V. Srinivas is a highly accomplished civil servant with over 36 years of experience, currently serving as Chief Secretary, Rajasthan. Guided by a Nation First – Citizen First ethos, he is driving the State’s vision under Viksit Rajasthan @2047, emphasizing governance reforms, digital empowerment, and accelerated sectoral growth. A strong advocate of technology-led transformation and development & deployment of next gen   solutions for enhancing citizen experiences. His leadership reflects a commitment to maximum governance–minimum government and people-centric service delivery.

Summit Themes

AI for Public Service Delivery & Governance

Artificial intelligence can enhance transparency, efficiency, and responsiveness across government services. It highlights AI driven solutions for citizen service delivery, real-time decision-making, predictive governance, and data-backed policy formulation—enabling more inclusive, accountable, and citizen centric administration.

AI Startup Innovation & Entrepreneurship

Empowering startups to build scalable AI solutions by fostering innovation, market access, and collaboration across sectors. It highlights how emerging entrepreneurs can leverage advanced AI tools, mentorship, and supportive ecosystems to drive economic growth, create jobs, and accelerate India’s digital transformation.

AI an impetus for Viksit Rajasthan @2047

Transformative role of AI in shaping Rajasthan’s long-term development vision by 2047—driving smarter governance, economic growth, and inclusive public services. It underscores how AI-enabled innovation, digital infrastructure, and future-ready skills can accelerate the state’s journey toward a prosperous, sustainable, and globally competitive Viksit Rajasthan.

Nearby Attractions

Ranthambore National Park

One of India’s premier wildlife reserves,   located a few hours from Jaipur, known for its Bengal tigers, ancient Ranthambore Fort, and diverse flora and fauna—perfect for safari experiences.

City Palace

A sprawling royal residence complex showcasing museums, courtyards, and centuries-old artifacts of Jaipur’s Maharajas.

Amber Fort

A magnificent hilltop fort known for its grand architecture, mirror work, and panoramic views, blending Rajput and   Mughal design.

Jantar Mantar

UNESCO World Heritage astronomical observatory featuring the world’s largest stone sundial and advanced 18th-century instruments.

About the Regional AI Conferences

India is set to convene the Impact Summit in February 2026, aiming to position AI as a driver for sectoral transformation across government, industry, and society.

Recognizing that national ambitions must be rooted in regional priorities, the government of India is planning a series of eight Regional AI Conferences which are to be held in eight different locations across India from October 2025 to January 2026. These will be organized in

Meghalaya, Gujarat, Odisha, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Kerala, and Telangana.

Regional AI Conferences will be conducted in partnership with state governments, premier knowledge institutions (IITs/IIMs), and thematic central ministries. It will be a high-level, outcome-oriented regional summit leading up to the India–AI Impact Summit 2026. It will see participation from the domestic ecosystem including local population, industries, startups, civil society, researchers and academia.

Showcasing Regional AI Strengths & Innovations

Regional summits will focus on themes aligned with regional strengths and priorities. It will provide an opportunity for states to showcase different AI initiatives taken up by the state government in the AI space.

Each regional event will serve to mobilize local innovation, foster multi-stakeholder dialogue, and prepare actionable recommendations for the central summit.

Regional summits will provide a platform for catalysing discourse aligned with the India-AI Summit's priorities. Discussions and outcomes may feed directly into the India–AI Impact Summit 2026 Outcome Document.

Expected Outcomes

Transforming India's AI landscape through regional collaboration

Present AI use cases in public service delivery

Showcase innovative AI applications transforming government services

Developing AI policies tailored to regional needs

Create context-specific frameworks for responsible AI deployment

Strengthen policy frameworks

Build robust governance structures for AI implementation

Demonstrate readiness for AI-driven industries

Highlight regional capabilities for industrial AI adoption

Create employment opportunities

Generate new jobs and skill development pathways in AI

Opportunities for State–Centre collaboration

Foster partnerships between state and central governments

Amplify regional AI awareness

Increase understanding and adoption of AI technologies

Long-term partnerships

Build sustainable collaborations between academia, startups, and governments

Explore Summits by State

Discover AI innovation hubs across India

Select a State

Click on any highlighted region on the map to explore upcoming AI summits and events in that state.

About the Conference

The Regional AI Impact Conference – Madhya Pradesh will bring together government leaders, academia, innovators, and industry to showcase AI-driven initiatives and engage in thematic discussions on emerging policy priorities shaping the future of responsible AI adoption.

The event highlights Madhya Pradesh’s commitment to adopting responsible, scalable, and impactful AI solutions for governance and public service delivery.

State Overview

State Overview

Madhya Pradesh, the heart of India, is rapidly emerging as a hub for digital innovation, data-driven governance, and applied AI. With strong institutional infrastructure, a forward-looking policy environment, and growing collaboration between government, academia, and industry, the state is pioneering the adoption of emerging technologies across sectors such as healthcare, agriculture, public safety, and citizen services.

Host City

Host City

Bhopal, the capital city of Madhya Pradesh and popularly known as the “City of Lakes,” is admired for its rich cultural heritage and well-planned urban landscape. With its historic landmarks, vibrant arts scene, and strong administrative significance, the city represents a unique blend of tradition and modernity. Home to key national institutions and serene natural surroundings, Bhopal offers the ideal environment to host this landmark Regional AI Impact conference.

Chief Secretary

Shri Anurag Jain

IAS, Chief Secretary Madhya Pradesh

Shri Anurag Jain, an Officer of 1989 batch of Indian Administrative Service born on the Madhya Pradesh cadre; is alumnus of IIT Kharagpur with B.Tech (Hons.) in Electrical Engineering in 1986. He did MA in Public Administration from Maxwell School of Citizenship and Public Affairs, University of Syracuse, USA with a CGPA of 4.0.

            At present, he is the Chief Secretary to Govt of Madhya Pradesh, the topmost bureaucratic post in the state, he has also served as Secretary, Government of India in Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), Ministry of Road Transport & Highways (MoRTH) and Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. 

            He has worked in Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) and Chief Minister’s Office in Madhya Pradesh for a long duration, playing an important role at the apex level of decision making and policy formulation. He has the unique distinction of being awarded twice the   prestigious Prime Minister’s award for excellence in Public Administration, also a recipient of National e-Governance Award and Web-Ratan Award.

Summit Themes

Technology-Led Governance for All

Transforming Public Service Delivery with AI

: For the Government of Madhya Pradesh, technology-led governance is central to improving transparency, efficiency, and citizen-centric service delivery across departments. AI-enabled systems can significantly enhance decision-making, grievance redressal, and last-mile delivery of welfare schemes at scale.

AI for Economic Growth & Social Good

Catalyzing Emerging Sectors (Drone, AVGC, Semiconductors, IT & GCCs)

: Madhya Pradesh is positioning itself as a growth hub for emerging technology sectors by leveraging AI to attract investments, create skilled employment, and strengthen industry–academia collaboration. These sectors also enable inclusive development by driving innovation in agriculture, manufacturing, healthcare, and digital services.

Resilience, Innovation & Efficiency

Data Centers as the Backbone of MP’s AI Revolution

: Robust data center infrastructure is critical for the state’s digital resilience, secure data management, and scalable AI adoption across governance and industry use cases. By strengthening data center capacity, Madhya Pradesh aims to ensure high availability, data sovereignty, and operational efficiency for its growing digital ecosystem.

Nearby Attractions

Upper Lake (Bhojtal)

One of the largest man-made lakes in India, known for its scenic beauty, boating experiences, and sunset views at the heart of the city.

Van Vihar National Park

A unique open zoological park offering a natural habitat experience, located adjacent to the Upper Lake.

Taj-ul-Masajid

One of the largest mosques in Asia, admired for its grand architecture and historical significance.

Bhimbetka Rock Shelters

A UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring prehistoric cave paintings, located approximately 45 km from Bhopal.

Bharat Bhavan

A premier cultural center showcasing art, theatre, music, and literature, reflecting the city’s rich creative heritage.

Taj-ul-Masajid

One of the largest mosques in Asia, admired for its grand architecture and historical significance.

Parallel thematic panel discussions featuring experts from academia, industry, and government.

Showcase of AI innovations, prototypes, and live demonstrations from MP’s ongoing major digital initiatives.

About the Conference

Guided by the theme “From Innovation to Impact: Realizing the Potential of AI Across Sectors,” the summit will explore how artificial intelligence is reshaping governance, industry, healthcare, social development, education, and sustainability. Through a carefully curated programme of keynotes, panel discussions, use-case showcases, and collaborative sessions, the event will highlight practical applications, enabling policy frameworks, and partnership models that deliver measurable outcomes. It will also serve as a catalyst for dialogue and collaboration, showcasing scalable solutions that harness AI’s potential to drive economic growth, improve public services, advance social equity, and build a more inclusive and sustainable future.

As leading institutions in research, innovation, and academic excellence, the association of IIT Palakkad, IIIT Kottayam, and IIM Kozhikode as Knowledge Partners significantly strengthens the intellectual foundation of Kerala AI FutureCon, the Regional AI Impact Conference. Their expertise will play a pivotal role in shaping the thematic direction of the conference by contributing to session design, identifying domain experts and speakers, curating meaningful discussions, and guiding the overall knowledge framework. Their involvement ensures academic rigour, strategic insight, and a strong focus on the applied impact of Artificial Intelligence in governance, public service delivery, and the broader digital transformation landscape.

State Overview

State Overview

Kerala, located along the southwest coast of India, is known for its strong human development indicators, progressive governance, and rapidly advancing digital ecosystem. The state has achieved notable progress across education, healthcare, tourism, and technology-driven public service delivery, positioning itself as a national leader in adopting emerging technologies, including AI, for societal benefit. Kerala’s egovernance initiatives have earned widespread recognition, with projects like E-District delivering millions of online services and reducing administrative hurdles for citizens. Nearly 3,000 Akshaya Centres across rural areas continue to strengthen digital inclusion and literacy, while the statewide implementation of the K-SMART platform has transformed local governance by enabling seamless access to certificates, tax payments, permits, and grievance services. Together, these advancements reflect Kerala’s commitment to innovation, inclusive development, and sustainable technology-led growth.

Host City

Host City

Thiruvananthapuram, the capital city of Kerala, is a dynamic centre where governance, technology, culture, and heritage seamlessly converge. As the administrative heart of the state, it hosts major government institutions, prestigious academic centres, and national research establishments. It is also home to Technopark, India’s first and one of the largest IT parks, supporting a vibrant ecosystem of technology companies, innovators, and AI-driven startups that play a key role in Kerala’s digital transformation. Culturally and socially, Thiruvananthapuram is known for its classical arts, literature, festivals, and strong intellectual traditions. The city holds deep devotional significance, with landmarks such as the Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple, one of India’s most revered temples, attracting devotees from around the world. The region also offers a rich array of tourist attractions, including the Napier Museum with its Indo-Saracenic architecture, the tranquil Veli Tourist Village, the lush hill station of Ponmudi, and the heritage-rich Kuthira Malika Palace. Nearby Kovalam, with its iconic lighthouse and crescent beaches, adds to the city's natural charm and coastal beauty.

Chief Secretary

Dr. A Jayathilak

Chief Secretary, Government of Kerala

Dr. A Jayathilak is an Indian Administrative Service officer and is the Chief Secretary of Kerala. Over the course of his career, he has held several key positions in the Government of Kerala, including Secretary and Director, Agriculture Department; Secretary, Water Resources Department; Director, Rural Development; Director, Personnel and General Administration; District Collector, Kollam and Kozhikode; Managing Director, Kerala Tourism Development Corporation; Managing Director, Industries Department; and Sub Collector, Mananthavady. He has also served in the Government of Chhattisgarh as Managing Director, Tourism Board, and as Commissioner, Finance and Excise Department.

Summit Themes

The theme represents a strategic shift from experimentation to execution in the AI ecosystem, emphasizing the responsible use of Artificial Intelligence to enhance public services, strengthen innovation capacity, and accelerate digital transformation across sectors. The AI Impact Summit 2026 will position Kerala as India’s leading hub for responsible, inclusive, and innovation-driven AI, bringing together global AI leaders, innovators, researchers, industry experts, and policymakers under five core pillars to exchange knowledge and showcase realworld impact across governance, industry, and society, while collectively building a shared roadmap for sustainable and scalable AI deployment.

AI Knowledge Exchange

A thought-leadership arena featuring keynotes, panel discussions, and masterclasses by global AI experts, researchers, and policymakers. The sessions will cover frontier themes such as AI for Public Good, Responsible AI, Generative AI for Governance, AI and Climate Resilience, and AI in Health and Education. This platform will strengthen Kerala’s position as a knowledge hub for ethical and inclusive AI adoption.

AI Innovation Expo

An experiential exhibition showcasing cutting-edge AI products, solutions, and startups. The Expo will include pavilions on AI in Governance, AI for Sustainability, AI in Education and Health, Emerging AI Hardware & Robotics, and AI Startups. It will serve as a vibrant platform for technology demonstration, collaboration, and investment engagement

AI for Governance Forum

A dedicated track to demonstrate how AI is transforming governance in   Kerala. Departments and missions will present live applications and prototypes—  such as predictive analytics in land management, AI-based citizen feedback systems, disaster risk forecasting, and service automation. The State’s Responsible AI Framework and Kerala AI Mission will also be showcased, reinforcing Kerala’s leadership in citizen-centric digital governance.

AI Collaboration Hub

A convergence space for universities, startups, and industries to collaborate on AI research and innovation. The Hub will host signing of MoUs, joint research announcements, and AI fellowship programmes, connecting academia and industry around shared problem statements. It will nurture Kerala’s AI innovation ecosystem and promote translational research.

AI Industry Leadership Round-table (by Kerala IT)

A strategic dialogue led by Kerala IT with industry leaders, GCCs, and technology investors. The Roundtable will discuss AI infrastructure investments, data centre readiness, AI talent development, and policy frameworks. It will culminate in a Kerala AI Industry Charter 2026, outlining joint actions for investment, innovation, and employment in the State’s AI ecosystem.

Nearby Attractions

Padmanabhaswamy Temple

Located in Thiruvananthapuram, this historic temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu is renowned for its Dravidian architecture, spiritual significance, and rich heritage.

Napier Museum & Zoo

A heritage complex featuring Indo-Saracenic  architecture, showcasing Kerala’s art, culture, and natural history, located close to the city centre.

Poovar Backwaters

A serene coastal village where the Neyyar River meets the Arabian Sea, offering golden beaches, mangrove forests, and tranquil backwater cruises

Veli Tourist Village

A popular lakeside destination offering boating, landscaped gardens, and scenic backwaters—perfect for families and leisure visitors.

Azhimala Shiva Temple

A stunning clifftop temple overlooking the Arabian Sea, famous for its towering Shiva statue and peaceful coastal ambience, attracting devotees and visitors alike.

Lighthouse Beach

A world-famous beach known for its crescent-shaped coastline, lighthouse views, and water activities. Ideal for relaxation and seaside experiences.

Padmanabhaswamy Temple

Located in Thiruvananthapuram, this historic temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu is renowned for its Dravidian architecture, spiritual significance, and rich heritage.

About the Conference

One of seven regional AI conferences leading to the India–AI Impact Summit 2026. Focused on People, Planet, and Progress, it promotes AI innovations and governance across the sector.

State Overview

State Overview

Gujarat is a leading state in India’s industrial and technological growth. Known for its robust   infrastructure, progressive policies, Ease of Doing Business initiatives, and an innovation-driven   ecosystem, Gujarat is fostering AI adoption across governance, agriculture, healthcare, and industry.

Host City

Host City

Gandhinagar, the capital of Gujarat, is a well-planned city with a clean, green environment and strong administrative infrastructure. It hosts Mahatma Mandir, one of India’s largest convention centers, and is home to GIFT City – India’s first smart city and international financial hub. With advanced IT parks, robust digital infrastructure, and excellent connectivity, Gandhinagar offers an ideal setting for technology-driven events and global collaborations.

Chief Secretary

Shri. Manoj Kumar Das IAS

Hon’ble Chief Secretary to the Government of Gujarat

Shri Manoj Kumar Das, born on 20 December 1966 in Darbhanga, Bihar, is a 1990-batch IAS officer of the Gujarat cadre and currently serves as the Chief Secretary to the Government of Gujarat. An alumnus of IIT Kharagpur with a B.Tech (Hons) in Computer Science, he brings over three decades of experience in public administration, combining strong technical expertise with strategic governance.

He has held pivotal roles including Municipal Commissioner of Vadodara and Surat, Additional Chief Secretary in key departments such as Industries & Mines, Ports & Transport, and Revenue, and a central deputation in the Ministry of Home Affairs. Shri Das is known for driving technology-enabled governance, e-governance reforms, and major initiatives like Industrial Policy 2020, Vibrant Gujarat Summit, and maritime infrastructure projects. His contributions to urban administration, industrial development, and infrastructure have earned multiple national awards for excellence in public service.

Summit Themes

AI for Smart Agriculture & Rural Prosperity

Leveraging AI to enhance crop productivity, optimize resources, and empower rural communities.

AI for Healthcare & Public Wellbeing

Intelligent healthcare solutions for accessible, affordable, and efficient public health services.

AI for Governance & Public Service Delivery

Driving transparency and efficiency through AI-enabled governance and citizen services.

AI for Urban & Rural Transformation

Building smart cities and villages through integrated AI solutions for infrastructure and services.

AI for FinTech & Digital Inclusion

Promoting financial inclusion and digital empowerment through AI-driven fintech innovations.

Akshardham Temple

A magnificent temple showcasing traditional architecture and cultural heritage

Indroda Nature Park

Known as India’s Jurassic Park, featuring botanical gardens and wildlife exhibits.

Event Highlights

AI COE

The Government of Gujarat is committed to advancing technology-driven governance through the AI Centre of Excellence (AI COE). It is fostering innovation and empowering start-ups. With the signing of MoUs with Google, access to advanced AI and cloud platforms will be expanded.

MOUs

The MoU with Bhashini will facilitate adoption of India’s language AI stack for public service delivery and innovation. This partnership will empower start-ups, developers, and government teams with multilingual AI tools and resources.

AI-Stack

The Gujarat AI Stack is a unified platform delivering next-generation AI services for citizens, developers, and government. From crop disease detection and scheme assistance to document conversion, grievance classification, and procurement intelligence, everything is available as ready-to-use tools and powerful APIs.

About the Regional AI Conferences

India is set to convene the Impact Summit in February 2026, aiming to position AI as a driver for sectoral transformation across government, industry, and society.

Recognizing that national ambitions must be rooted in regional priorities, the government of India is planning a series of eight Regional AI Conferences which are to be held in eight different locations across India from October 2025 to January 2026. These will be organized in

Meghalaya, Gujarat, Odisha, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Kerala, and Telangana.

Regional AI Conferences will be conducted in partnership with state governments, premier knowledge institutions (IITs/IIMs), and thematic central ministries. It will be a high-level, outcome-oriented regional summit leading up to the India–AI Impact Summit 2026. It will see participation from the domestic ecosystem including local population, industries, startups, civil society, researchers and academia.

Showcasing Regional AI Strengths & Innovations

Regional summits will focus on themes aligned with regional strengths and priorities. It will provide an opportunity for states to showcase different AI initiatives taken up by the state government in the AI space.

Each regional event will serve to mobilize local innovation, foster multi-stakeholder dialogue, and prepare actionable recommendations for the central summit.

Regional summits will provide a platform for catalysing discourse aligned with the India-AI Summit's priorities. Discussions and outcomes may feed directly into the India–AI Impact Summit 2026 Outcome Document.

Expected Outcomes

Transforming India's AI landscape through regional collaboration

Present AI use cases in public service delivery

Showcase innovative AI applications transforming government services

Developing AI policies tailored to regional needs

Create context-specific frameworks for responsible AI deployment

Strengthen policy frameworks

Build robust governance structures for AI implementation

Demonstrate readiness for AI-driven industries

Highlight regional capabilities for industrial AI adoption

Create employment opportunities

Generate new jobs and skill development pathways in AI

Opportunities for State–Centre collaboration

Foster partnerships between state and central governments

Amplify regional AI awareness

Increase understanding and adoption of AI technologies

Long-term partnerships

Build sustainable collaborations between academia, startups, and governments

Discover AI innovation hubs across India

India AI Impact Summit 2026

About the Conference

Guided by the theme “From Innovation to Impact: Realizing the Potential of AI Across Sectors,” the summit will explore how artificial intelligence is reshaping governance, industry, healthcare, social development, education, and sustainability. Through a carefully curated programme of keynotes, panel discussions, use-case showcases, and collaborative sessions, the event will highlight practical applications, enabling policy frameworks, and partnership models that deliver measurable outcomes. It will also serve as a catalyst for dialogue and collaboration, showcasing scalable solutions that harness AI’s potential to drive economic growth, improve public services, advance social equity, and build a more inclusive and sustainable future.

As leading institutions in research, innovation, and academic excellence, the association of IIT Palakkad, IIIT Kottayam, and IIM Kozhikode as Knowledge Partners significantly strengthens the intellectual foundation of Kerala AI FutureCon, the Regional AI Impact Conference. Their expertise will play a pivotal role in shaping the thematic direction of the conference by contributing to session design, identifying domain experts and speakers, curating meaningful discussions, and guiding the overall knowledge framework. Their involvement ensures academic rigour, strategic insight, and a strong focus on the applied impact of Artificial Intelligence in governance, public service delivery, and the broader digital transformation landscape.

State Overview

State Overview

Kerala, located along the southwest coast of India, is known for its strong human development indicators, progressive governance, and rapidly advancing digital ecosystem. The state has achieved notable progress across education, healthcare, tourism, and technology-driven public service delivery, positioning itself as a national leader in adopting emerging technologies, including AI, for societal benefit. Kerala’s egovernance initiatives have earned widespread recognition, with projects like E-District delivering millions of online services and reducing administrative hurdles for citizens. Nearly 3,000 Akshaya Centres across rural areas continue to strengthen digital inclusion and literacy, while the statewide implementation of the K-SMART platform has transformed local governance by enabling seamless access to certificates, tax payments, permits, and grievance services. Together, these advancements reflect Kerala’s commitment to innovation, inclusive development, and sustainable technology-led growth.

Host City

Host City

Thiruvananthapuram, the capital city of Kerala, is a dynamic centre where governance, technology, culture, and heritage seamlessly converge. As the administrative heart of the state, it hosts major government institutions, prestigious academic centres, and national research establishments. It is also home to Technopark, India’s first and one of the largest IT parks, supporting a vibrant ecosystem of technology companies, innovators, and AI-driven startups that play a key role in Kerala’s digital transformation. Culturally and socially, Thiruvananthapuram is known for its classical arts, literature, festivals, and strong intellectual traditions. The city holds deep devotional significance, with landmarks such as the Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple, one of India’s most revered temples, attracting devotees from around the world. The region also offers a rich array of tourist attractions, including the Napier Museum with its Indo-Saracenic architecture, the tranquil Veli Tourist Village, the lush hill station of Ponmudi, and the heritage-rich Kuthira Malika Palace. Nearby Kovalam, with its iconic lighthouse and crescent beaches, adds to the city's natural charm and coastal beauty.

Chief Secretary

Dr. A Jayathilak

Chief Secretary, Government of Kerala

Dr. A Jayathilak is an Indian Administrative Service officer and is the Chief Secretary of Kerala. Over the course of his career, he has held several key positions in the Government of Kerala, including Secretary and Director, Agriculture Department; Secretary, Water Resources Department; Director, Rural Development; Director, Personnel and General Administration; District Collector, Kollam and Kozhikode; Managing Director, Kerala Tourism Development Corporation; Managing Director, Industries Department; and Sub Collector, Mananthavady. He has also served in the Government of Chhattisgarh as Managing Director, Tourism Board, and as Commissioner, Finance and Excise Department.

Summit Themes

The theme represents a strategic shift from experimentation to execution in the AI ecosystem, emphasizing the responsible use of Artificial Intelligence to enhance public services, strengthen innovation capacity, and accelerate digital transformation across sectors. The AI Impact Summit 2026 will position Kerala as India’s leading hub for responsible, inclusive, and innovation-driven AI, bringing together global AI leaders, innovators, researchers, industry experts, and policymakers under five core pillars to exchange knowledge and showcase realworld impact across governance, industry, and society, while collectively building a shared roadmap for sustainable and scalable AI deployment.

AI Knowledge Exchange

A thought-leadership arena featuring keynotes, panel discussions, and masterclasses by global AI experts, researchers, and policymakers. The sessions will cover frontier themes such as AI for Public Good, Responsible AI, Generative AI for Governance, AI and Climate Resilience, and AI in Health and Education. This platform will strengthen Kerala’s position as a knowledge hub for ethical and inclusive AI adoption.

AI Innovation Expo

An experiential exhibition showcasing cutting-edge AI products, solutions, and startups. The Expo will include pavilions on AI in Governance, AI for Sustainability, AI in Education and Health, Emerging AI Hardware & Robotics, and AI Startups. It will serve as a vibrant platform for technology demonstration, collaboration, and investment engagement

AI for Governance Forum

A dedicated track to demonstrate how AI is transforming governance in   Kerala. Departments and missions will present live applications and prototypes—  such as predictive analytics in land management, AI-based citizen feedback systems, disaster risk forecasting, and service automation. The State’s Responsible AI Framework and Kerala AI Mission will also be showcased, reinforcing Kerala’s leadership in citizen-centric digital governance.

AI Collaboration Hub

A convergence space for universities, startups, and industries to collaborate on AI research and innovation. The Hub will host signing of MoUs, joint research announcements, and AI fellowship programmes, connecting academia and industry around shared problem statements. It will nurture Kerala’s AI innovation ecosystem and promote translational research.

AI Industry Leadership Round-table (by Kerala IT)

A strategic dialogue led by Kerala IT with industry leaders, GCCs, and technology investors. The Roundtable will discuss AI infrastructure investments, data centre readiness, AI talent development, and policy frameworks. It will culminate in a Kerala AI Industry Charter 2026, outlining joint actions for investment, innovation, and employment in the State’s AI ecosystem.

Nearby Attractions

Padmanabhaswamy Temple

Located in Thiruvananthapuram, this historic temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu is renowned for its Dravidian architecture, spiritual significance, and rich heritage.

Napier Museum & Zoo

A heritage complex featuring Indo-Saracenic  architecture, showcasing Kerala’s art, culture, and natural history, located close to the city centre.

Poovar Backwaters

A serene coastal village where the Neyyar River meets the Arabian Sea, offering golden beaches, mangrove forests, and tranquil backwater cruises

Veli Tourist Village

A popular lakeside destination offering boating, landscaped gardens, and scenic backwaters—perfect for families and leisure visitors.

Azhimala Shiva Temple

A stunning clifftop temple overlooking the Arabian Sea, famous for its towering Shiva statue and peaceful coastal ambience, attracting devotees and visitors alike.

Lighthouse Beach

A world-famous beach known for its crescent-shaped coastline, lighthouse views, and water activities. Ideal for relaxation and seaside experiences.

Padmanabhaswamy Temple

Located in Thiruvananthapuram, this historic temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu is renowned for its Dravidian architecture, spiritual significance, and rich heritage.

India AI Impact Summit 2026

Register Now

Venue & Date : Bharat Mandapam, Pragati Maidan, New Delhi | February 2026

Regional Summit

Media

Contact Us
