About the Conference

The Regional AI Impact Conference, themed "AI for CE: Smarter Governance, Better Lives," will unite senior government officials, industry leaders, global tech firms, academia, and startups to explore how AI can enhance governance, climate resilience, and societal well-being.

The event will feature a dedicated session by the IndiaAI Mission team, along with engaging panel discussions on topics such as AI towards Climate Resilience and AI towards Effective Governance for a safer and equitable society. The event will also feature a showcase arena, which will provide a platform to various stakeholders to highlight their innovations, ideation workshops, and networking opportunities. The event will also act as a launchpad for initiatives such as the launch of the Bhashini Hackathon (Garo & Khasi), the MeghDEE program, and MoUs for establishing a Data & AI Lab and collaboration with MATH T-Hub, etc., to name a few. A roundtable meeting between the Hon'ble Chief Minister and leading investors will further position Meghalaya as a rising digital hub. A vibrant exhibition of AI and emerging technology initiatives by Government organisations, Academia and Industry will also be a major part of the event. Pre-event awareness campaigns by institutions like IIM Shillong, NIT Meghalaya, and NIELIT Shillong will build momentum ahead of the conclave.

State Overview

State Overview

Meghalaya, the "Abode of Clouds," is a land of breathtaking natural beauty, vibrant culture, and warm hospitality. With approximately 1,170 km of national highways, it has strategic potential for wider markets in the South and Southeast Asia. Meghalaya's favourable climate supports IT&ITES, electronics-related development, and its Industrial Policy promotes ease of doing business. Promising sectors include mineral-based industries, horticulture and agro-processing, electronics and IT, export units, tourism, and emerging service industries.

With a stable political environment and consistent double-digit GSDP growth in recent years, this uniquely positions Meghalaya as a top destination to attract investment from knowledge-based industries, including IT-ITeS services and emerging technology initiatives.

Population: 3.8 million, Economy: $5.9 Billion, Literacy Rate: 74.4%, Education Hub of North-Eastern states with IIM, NIT, NIFT, NLU, NEIGRIHMS, NEIAH etc., new growth centers such as New Shillong City, Mawkhanu Knowledge City, About 55% of Meghalaya's population in the working age group and BBIN2 corridor connecting with Bangladesh, Nepal & Bhutan.

Host City

Host City

Shillong, known for its picturesque beauty, rolling hills and cool climate, is often called the "Scotland of the East". The city blends colonial-era architecture with indigenous Khasi and Garo traditions, making it a hub for music, art, and eco-tourism. Among its historical landmarks stands a notable heritage structure, embodying the region's colonial past. Shillong's favorable climate, colonial heritage, and its industrial policy support ease of doing business in Information Technology and emerging technologies. Shillong is positioning itself as a gateway for niche industries in Northeast India. It is emerging as an IT hub with a focus on emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence (AI).

Chief Secretary

Dr Shakil P. Ahammed

Chief Secretary, Govt. Meghalaya

Chief Secretary: Dr Shakil P. Ahammed, IAS, a 1995-batch IAS officer of the Assam Meghalaya cadre and took over the charge of the Chief Secretary of Meghalaya on 30.09.2025

Summit Themes

AI for CE (Artificial Intelligence for Citizens' Empowerment): Smarter Governance, Better Lives

Two Panel discussions will be held on the following sub-theme:

A

AI for CE towards Climate Resilience

B

AI for CE towards Effective Governance for Safer & Equitable Societies

The core focus will be on citizen empowerment through the strategic application of Artificial Intelligence (AI). As India positions itself as a leading voice in the global AI landscape, it is essential to comprehensively understand the impact of AI interventions on the everyday lives of citizens. This impact spans multiple dimensions, and the idea exchanges during the conference will focus on three critical areas: climate resilience, effective governance, and the advancement of safer & more equitable societies.

Event Highlights

IT & ITeS investment Destination

One of the objectives of the conference is to showcase Meghalaya as the attractive IT and ITeS investment destination. With favourable policies, attractive incentives, sublime climate, techie and English-speaking workforce and infrastructure like Shillong Technology Park, Meghalaya is expecting to bring some big names of tech sector to the state. As part of the summit, with help from Invest India, an investment roundtable has been organized which would be chaired by Hon'ble CM of Meghalaya.

NE States Participation

Being the only state in NE India, hosting regional conference for India AI Impact Summit, we have requested all the NE states to come and participate in this conference.

About the Conference

One of seven regional AI conferences leading to the India–AI Impact Summit 2026. Focused on People, Planet, and Progress, it promotes AI innovations and governance across the sector.

State Overview

State Overview

Gujarat is a leading state in India’s industrial and technological growth. Known for its robust   infrastructure, progressive policies, Ease of Doing Business initiatives, and an innovation-driven   ecosystem, Gujarat is fostering AI adoption across governance, agriculture, healthcare, and industry.

Host City

Host City

Gandhinagar, the capital of Gujarat, is a well-planned city with a clean, green environment and strong administrative infrastructure. It hosts Mahatma Mandir, one of India’s largest convention centers, and is home to GIFT City – India’s first smart city and international financial hub. With advanced IT parks, robust digital infrastructure, and excellent connectivity, Gandhinagar offers an ideal setting for technology-driven events and global collaborations.

Chief Secretary

Shri. Manoj Kumar Das IAS

Hon’ble Chief Secretary to the Government of Gujarat

Shri Manoj Kumar Das, born on 20 December 1966 in Darbhanga, Bihar, is a 1990-batch IAS officer of the Gujarat cadre and currently serves as the Chief Secretary to the Government of Gujarat. An alumnus of IIT Kharagpur with a B.Tech (Hons) in Computer Science, he brings over three decades of experience in public administration, combining strong technical expertise with strategic governance.

He has held pivotal roles including Municipal Commissioner of Vadodara and Surat, Additional Chief Secretary in key departments such as Industries & Mines, Ports & Transport, and Revenue, and a central deputation in the Ministry of Home Affairs. Shri Das is known for driving technology-enabled governance, e-governance reforms, and major initiatives like Industrial Policy 2020, Vibrant Gujarat Summit, and maritime infrastructure projects. His contributions to urban administration, industrial development, and infrastructure have earned multiple national awards for excellence in public service.

Summit Themes

AI for Smart Agriculture & Rural Prosperity

Leveraging AI to enhance crop productivity, optimize resources, and empower rural communities.

AI for Healthcare & Public Wellbeing

Intelligent healthcare solutions for accessible, affordable, and efficient public health services.

AI for Governance & Public Service Delivery

Driving transparency and efficiency through AI-enabled governance and citizen services.

AI for Urban & Rural Transformation

Building smart cities and villages through integrated AI solutions for infrastructure and services.

AI for FinTech & Digital Inclusion

Promoting financial inclusion and digital empowerment through AI-driven fintech innovations.

Nearby Attractions

Sabarmati Ashram

Historic site associated with Mahatma Gandhi, offering a glimpse into India’s   freedom movement.

Adalaj Stepwell

An intricately designed stepwell reflecting Gujarat’s architectural brilliance.

Gandhi Kutir at Mahatma Mandir

India’s largest museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, featuring immersive exhibits and modern technology to showcase his life and ideals.

Akshardham Temple

A magnificent temple showcasing traditional architecture and cultural heritage

Indroda Nature Park

Known as India’s Jurassic Park, featuring botanical gardens and wildlife exhibits.

Historic site associated with Mahatma Gandhi, offering a glimpse into India’s   freedom movement.

Event Highlights

AI COE

The Government of Gujarat is committed to advancing technology-driven governance through the AI Centre of Excellence (AI COE). It is fostering innovation and empowering start-ups. With the signing of MoUs with Google, access to advanced AI and cloud platforms will be expanded.

MOUs

The MoU with Bhashini will facilitate adoption of India’s language AI stack for public service delivery and innovation. This partnership will empower start-ups, developers, and government teams with multilingual AI tools and resources.

AI-Stack

The Gujarat AI Stack is a unified platform delivering next-generation AI services for citizens, developers, and government. From crop disease detection and scheme assistance to document conversion, grievance classification, and procurement intelligence, everything is available as ready-to-use tools and powerful APIs.

About the Conference

Rajasthan Regional AI Impact Conference aims to position Rajasthan as a leading hub for responsible and inclusive AI adoption, accelerating innovation across governance, agriculture, healthcare, and citizen services. By bringing together national policymakers, industry leaders, and academia, the summit is expected to drive strategic collaborations, attract investments, and strengthen regional capacity building aligned with the IndiaAI Mission.

The state will host the Regional AI Impact Conference along with IIT Jodhpur as the knowledge partner. IIT Jodhpur is a future-driven institute for nurturing excellence of thought; creating, preserving, and imparting knowledge; and using transformational technologies/interventions with a multidisciplinary approach for responding to societal challenges and aspirations.

IIT Jodhpur has a strong and growing focus on Artificial Intelligence (AI) research opportunities, leveraging an interdisciplinary approach for emerging tech fields.

State Overview

State Overview

Rajasthan, India’s largest state by area, is known for its vibrant   cultural heritage, diverse geography, and rapidly growing digital and innovation ecosystem. The state combines strong tourism, agriculture, and industrial sectors with emerging strengths in technology, startups, and governance reforms. With progressive initiatives in digital services, AI adoption, and youth entrepreneurship—anchored by platforms like iStart and events such as Rajasthan Digifest—the state is positioning itself as a   forward-looking hub for innovation, sustainability, and inclusive   development.

Host City

Host City

Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan, is a vibrant blend of rich heritage   and modern urban development. Known as the Pink City and part of the UNESCO World Heritage–listed Jaipur City, it is a major cultural, tourism, and business hub in North India. With strong infrastructure, world-class convention facilities, a growing startup ecosystem, and leading academic institutions, Jaipur has emerged as a preferred destination for national level technology events, innovation forums, and large-scale conferences.

Chief Secretary

SHRI V. SRINIVAS

Chief Secretary, Government of Rajasthan

Shri V. Srinivas is a highly accomplished civil servant with over 36 years of experience, currently serving as Chief Secretary, Rajasthan. Guided by a Nation First – Citizen First ethos, he is driving the State’s vision under Viksit Rajasthan @2047, emphasizing governance reforms, digital empowerment, and accelerated sectoral growth. A strong advocate of technology-led transformation and development & deployment of next gen   solutions for enhancing citizen experiences. His leadership reflects a commitment to maximum governance–minimum government and people-centric service delivery.

Summit Themes

AI for Public Service Delivery & Governance

Artificial intelligence can enhance transparency, efficiency, and responsiveness across government services. It highlights AI driven solutions for citizen service delivery, real-time decision-making, predictive governance, and data-backed policy formulation—enabling more inclusive, accountable, and citizen centric administration.

AI Startup Innovation & Entrepreneurship

Empowering startups to build scalable AI solutions by fostering innovation, market access, and collaboration across sectors. It highlights how emerging entrepreneurs can leverage advanced AI tools, mentorship, and supportive ecosystems to drive economic growth, create jobs, and accelerate India’s digital transformation.

AI an impetus for Viksit Rajasthan @2047

Transformative role of AI in shaping Rajasthan’s long-term development vision by 2047—driving smarter governance, economic growth, and inclusive public services. It underscores how AI-enabled innovation, digital infrastructure, and future-ready skills can accelerate the state’s journey toward a prosperous, sustainable, and globally competitive Viksit Rajasthan.

Nearby Attractions

Ranthambore National Park

One of India’s premier wildlife reserves,   located a few hours from Jaipur, known for its Bengal tigers, ancient Ranthambore Fort, and diverse flora and fauna—perfect for safari experiences.

City Palace

A sprawling royal residence complex showcasing museums, courtyards, and centuries-old artifacts of Jaipur’s Maharajas.

Amber Fort

A magnificent hilltop fort known for its grand architecture, mirror work, and panoramic views, blending Rajput and   Mughal design.

Jantar Mantar

UNESCO World Heritage astronomical observatory featuring the world’s largest stone sundial and advanced 18th-century instruments.

About the Regional AI Conferences

India is set to convene the Impact Summit in February 2026, aiming to position AI as a driver for sectoral transformation across government, industry, and society.

Recognizing that national ambitions must be rooted in regional priorities, the government of India is planning a series of eight Regional AI Conferences which are to be held in eight different locations across India from October 2025 to January 2026. These will be organized in

Meghalaya, Gujarat, Odisha, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Kerala, and Telangana.

Regional AI Conferences will be conducted in partnership with state governments, premier knowledge institutions (IITs/IIMs), and thematic central ministries. It will be a high-level, outcome-oriented regional summit leading up to the India–AI Impact Summit 2026. It will see participation from the domestic ecosystem including local population, industries, startups, civil society, researchers and academia.

Showcasing Regional AI Strengths & Innovations

Regional summits will focus on themes aligned with regional strengths and priorities. It will provide an opportunity for states to showcase different AI initiatives taken up by the state government in the AI space.

Each regional event will serve to mobilize local innovation, foster multi-stakeholder dialogue, and prepare actionable recommendations for the central summit.

Regional summits will provide a platform for catalysing discourse aligned with the India-AI Summit's priorities. Discussions and outcomes may feed directly into the India–AI Impact Summit 2026 Outcome Document.

Expected Outcomes

Transforming India's AI landscape through regional collaboration

Present AI use cases in public service delivery

Showcase innovative AI applications transforming government services

Developing AI policies tailored to regional needs

Create context-specific frameworks for responsible AI deployment

Strengthen policy frameworks

Build robust governance structures for AI implementation

Demonstrate readiness for AI-driven industries

Highlight regional capabilities for industrial AI adoption

Create employment opportunities

Generate new jobs and skill development pathways in AI

Opportunities for State–Centre collaboration

Foster partnerships between state and central governments

Amplify regional AI awareness

Increase understanding and adoption of AI technologies

Long-term partnerships

Build sustainable collaborations between academia, startups, and governments

Explore Summits by State

Discover AI innovation hubs across India

Select a State

Click on any highlighted region on the map to explore upcoming AI summits and events in that state.

About the Conference

The Government of Uttar Pradesh has been leading the way in using AI and technology for Janta and Janseva, driving innovation in governance, healthcare, and public services through initiatives like the AI City in Lucknow, AI Pragya, and strengthening digital health systems to achieve inclusive growth.

Building on this momentum, the Uttar Pradesh AI & Health Transformation Summit 2026, jointly hosted by the Department of IT & Electronics and the Department of Health & Family Welfare, Government of Uttar Pradesh, in collaboration with Elets Technomedia as Knowledge Partner, will convene top policymakers, industry experts, healthcare innovators, and academic leaders to explore AI’s transformative potential in creating a smarter, inclusive, and citizen-centric Uttar Pradesh.

State Overview

State Overview

Uttar Pradesh, India's most populous state, is rapidly modernising its healthcare ecosystem by integrating digital health, data-driven governance, and AI-led innovations. Under the Ayushman Bharat and state health missions, UP has significantly expanded its public health infrastructure, strengthened district hospitals, and scaled digital health records across facilities.

By actively leveraging AI for predictive disease surveillance, maternal–child health tracking, telemedicine, and early diagnostics, Uttar Pradesh Government is reducing gaps in rural service delivery.

With growing investments in health-tech startups, medical device manufacturing, and digital public infrastructure aligned with the Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission (ABDM), UP has positioned itself as a major hub for AI-assisted healthcare delivery. Its strong focus on capacity-building, data platforms, and public–private partnerships is enabling smarter health interventions, better last-mile access, and improved patient outcomes across urban and rural populations.

Host City

Host City

1. Emerging Hub for Health Innovation & Digital Governance

Lucknow is at the centre of Uttar Pradesh's rapid transformation in healthcare, digital public services, and AI adoption. With major initiatives under ABDM, telemedicine expansion, and data-driven health programs, the city offers a real-time laboratory of innovation worth showcasing.

2. Rapidly Growing Healthcare & MedTech Ecosystem

Top medical institutions (KGMU, SGPGIMS, RMLIMS), upcoming bio-tech parks, and health-tech startups create a thriving environment for discussions around AI, diagnostics, digital health, and hospital transformation.

3. Strategic Location & Connectivity

Located in the heart of North India, Lucknow is exceptionally well-connected by air, rail, and road, making it easy for national and international delegates to attend.

4. Cultural Capital with High Tourism Value

Lucknow's heritage, cuisine, and hospitality elevate the summit experience, offering delegates a memorable and engaging environment beyond formal sessions.

Chief Secretary

Shri. S P Goyal

IAS, Chief Secretary of Uttar Pradesh

Shri S. P. Goyal, IAS (UP Cadre, 1989), is the Chief Secretary of Uttar Pradesh and a trusted senior administrator in the Uttar Pradesh government. A former civil services topper, he has held key roles including Additional Chief Secretary to the Hon’ble CM, Joint Secretary in the Government of India, and District Magistrate in multiple districts. Known for his low-profile yet effective working style, he is recognized for strong governance, coordination skills, and a focus on transparency and development-driven administration.

Summit Themes

Leverage AI for Governance & Growth

Position Uttar Pradesh as a leader in AI-driven governance and healthcare innovation.

Healthcare Transformation

Explore AI’s role in diagnostics, preventive care, and public health service delivery.

Foster Collaboration

Build partnerships among government, academia, startups, and industry for scalable adoption.

Shape Ethical AI Frameworks

Ensure responsible AI use, data privacy, and fairness across diverse populations.

Skill Development

Promote large-scale AI skilling via initiatives like AI Pragya and future-ready education.

Nearby Attractions

Bara Imambara

A grand 18th-century marvel built by Nawab Asaf-ud-Daula, known for its stunning arched hall and the famous Bhulbhulaiya labyrinth. A must-visit for history lovers and architecture enthusiasts.

Chota Imambara

Also known as the Imambara of Hussainabad, this 19th-century monument is admired for its ornate chandeliers, shimmering interiors, and elegant Islamic architecture. Built by Muhammad Ali Shah, it beautifully reflects Lucknow’s Nawabi grandeur and is especially stunning when illuminated in the evenings.

Rumi Darwaza

Lucknow’s iconic gateway, standing 60 feet tall, showcases Awadhi craftsmanship at its finest. Often called the “Gateway to Lucknow,” it’s a perfect photo spot for visitors.

Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Memorial Park

A sprawling, beautifully lit monument complex showcasing sandstone architecture, statues, and serene walkways. Ideal for an evening stroll and cultural exploration.

Gomti Riverfront Park

A scenic riverside promenade with landscaped gardens and musical fountains. A refreshing spot for relaxing walks after summit sessions.

Event Highlights

Keynote Addresses from top government leaders outlining the AI roadmap for UP

5+ High-Impact Panel Discussions.

AI & Tech Exhibition Zone showcasing innovation and solutions

Launch of AI-Focused Industry Souvenir

Networking Opportunities: B2G, B2B & G2G interactions for collaborations and MoUs

About the Conference

The Regional AI Impact Conference – Madhya Pradesh will bring together government leaders, academia, innovators, and industry to showcase AI-driven initiatives and engage in thematic discussions on emerging policy priorities shaping the future of responsible AI adoption.

The event highlights Madhya Pradesh’s commitment to adopting responsible, scalable, and impactful AI solutions for governance and public service delivery.

State Overview

State Overview

Madhya Pradesh, the heart of India, is rapidly emerging as a hub for digital innovation, data-driven governance, and applied AI. With strong institutional infrastructure, a forward-looking policy environment, and growing collaboration between government, academia, and industry, the state is pioneering the adoption of emerging technologies across sectors such as healthcare, agriculture, public safety, and citizen services.

Host City

Host City

Bhopal, the capital city of Madhya Pradesh and popularly known as the “City of Lakes,” is admired for its rich cultural heritage and well-planned urban landscape. With its historic landmarks, vibrant arts scene, and strong administrative significance, the city represents a unique blend of tradition and modernity. Home to key national institutions and serene natural surroundings, Bhopal offers the ideal environment to host this landmark Regional AI Impact conference.

Chief Secretary

Shri Anurag Jain

IAS, Chief Secretary Madhya Pradesh

Shri Anurag Jain, an Officer of 1989 batch of Indian Administrative Service born on the Madhya Pradesh cadre; is alumnus of IIT Kharagpur with B.Tech (Hons.) in Electrical Engineering in 1986. He did MA in Public Administration from Maxwell School of Citizenship and Public Affairs, University of Syracuse, USA with a CGPA of 4.0.

            At present, he is the Chief Secretary to Govt of Madhya Pradesh, the topmost bureaucratic post in the state, he has also served as Secretary, Government of India in Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), Ministry of Road Transport & Highways (MoRTH) and Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. 

            He has worked in Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) and Chief Minister’s Office in Madhya Pradesh for a long duration, playing an important role at the apex level of decision making and policy formulation. He has the unique distinction of being awarded twice the   prestigious Prime Minister’s award for excellence in Public Administration, also a recipient of National e-Governance Award and Web-Ratan Award.

Summit Themes

Technology-Led Governance for All

Transforming Public Service Delivery with AI

: For the Government of Madhya Pradesh, technology-led governance is central to improving transparency, efficiency, and citizen-centric service delivery across departments. AI-enabled systems can significantly enhance decision-making, grievance redressal, and last-mile delivery of welfare schemes at scale.

AI for Economic Growth & Social Good

Catalyzing Emerging Sectors (Drone, AVGC, Semiconductors, IT & GCCs)

: Madhya Pradesh is positioning itself as a growth hub for emerging technology sectors by leveraging AI to attract investments, create skilled employment, and strengthen industry–academia collaboration. These sectors also enable inclusive development by driving innovation in agriculture, manufacturing, healthcare, and digital services.

Resilience, Innovation & Efficiency

Data Centers as the Backbone of MP’s AI Revolution

: Robust data center infrastructure is critical for the state’s digital resilience, secure data management, and scalable AI adoption across governance and industry use cases. By strengthening data center capacity, Madhya Pradesh aims to ensure high availability, data sovereignty, and operational efficiency for its growing digital ecosystem.

Nearby Attractions

Upper Lake (Bhojtal)

One of the largest man-made lakes in India, known for its scenic beauty, boating experiences, and sunset views at the heart of the city.

Van Vihar National Park

A unique open zoological park offering a natural habitat experience, located adjacent to the Upper Lake.

Taj-ul-Masajid

One of the largest mosques in Asia, admired for its grand architecture and historical significance.

Bhimbetka Rock Shelters

A UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring prehistoric cave paintings, located approximately 45 km from Bhopal.

Bharat Bhavan

A premier cultural center showcasing art, theatre, music, and literature, reflecting the city’s rich creative heritage.

Event Highlights

Parallel thematic panel discussions featuring experts from academia, industry, and government.

Showcase of AI innovations, prototypes, and live demonstrations from MP’s ongoing major digital initiatives.

About the Conference

Guided by the theme “From Innovation to Impact: Realizing the Potential of AI Across Sectors,” the summit will explore how artificial intelligence is reshaping governance, industry, healthcare, social development, education, and sustainability. Through a carefully curated programme of keynotes, panel discussions, use-case showcases, and collaborative sessions, the event will highlight practical applications, enabling policy frameworks, and partnership models that deliver measurable outcomes. It will also serve as a catalyst for dialogue and collaboration, showcasing scalable solutions that harness AI’s potential to drive economic growth, improve public services, advance social equity, and build a more inclusive and sustainable future.

As leading institutions in research, innovation, and academic excellence, the association of IIT Palakkad, IIIT Kottayam, and IIM Kozhikode as Knowledge Partners significantly strengthens the intellectual foundation of Kerala AI FutureCon, the Regional AI Impact Conference. Their expertise will play a pivotal role in shaping the thematic direction of the conference by contributing to session design, identifying domain experts and speakers, curating meaningful discussions, and guiding the overall knowledge framework. Their involvement ensures academic rigour, strategic insight, and a strong focus on the applied impact of Artificial Intelligence in governance, public service delivery, and the broader digital transformation landscape.

State Overview

State Overview

Kerala, located along the southwest coast of India, is known for its strong human development indicators, progressive governance, and rapidly advancing digital ecosystem. The state has achieved notable progress across education, healthcare, tourism, and technology-driven public service delivery, positioning itself as a national leader in adopting emerging technologies, including AI, for societal benefit. Kerala’s egovernance initiatives have earned widespread recognition, with projects like E-District delivering millions of online services and reducing administrative hurdles for citizens. Nearly 3,000 Akshaya Centres across rural areas continue to strengthen digital inclusion and literacy, while the statewide implementation of the K-SMART platform has transformed local governance by enabling seamless access to certificates, tax payments, permits, and grievance services. Together, these advancements reflect Kerala’s commitment to innovation, inclusive development, and sustainable technology-led growth.

Host City

Host City

Thiruvananthapuram, the capital city of Kerala, is a dynamic centre where governance, technology, culture, and heritage seamlessly converge. As the administrative heart of the state, it hosts major government institutions, prestigious academic centres, and national research establishments. It is also home to Technopark, India’s first and one of the largest IT parks, supporting a vibrant ecosystem of technology companies, innovators, and AI-driven startups that play a key role in Kerala’s digital transformation. Culturally and socially, Thiruvananthapuram is known for its classical arts, literature, festivals, and strong intellectual traditions. The city holds deep devotional significance, with landmarks such as the Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple, one of India’s most revered temples, attracting devotees from around the world. The region also offers a rich array of tourist attractions, including the Napier Museum with its Indo-Saracenic architecture, the tranquil Veli Tourist Village, the lush hill station of Ponmudi, and the heritage-rich Kuthira Malika Palace. Nearby Kovalam, with its iconic lighthouse and crescent beaches, adds to the city's natural charm and coastal beauty.

Chief Secretary

Dr. A Jayathilak

Chief Secretary, Government of Kerala

Dr. A Jayathilak is an Indian Administrative Service officer and is the Chief Secretary of Kerala. Over the course of his career, he has held several key positions in the Government of Kerala, including Secretary and Director, Agriculture Department; Secretary, Water Resources Department; Director, Rural Development; Director, Personnel and General Administration; District Collector, Kollam and Kozhikode; Managing Director, Kerala Tourism Development Corporation; Managing Director, Industries Department; and Sub Collector, Mananthavady. He has also served in the Government of Chhattisgarh as Managing Director, Tourism Board, and as Commissioner, Finance and Excise Department.

Summit Themes

The theme represents a strategic shift from experimentation to execution in the AI ecosystem, emphasizing the responsible use of Artificial Intelligence to enhance public services, strengthen innovation capacity, and accelerate digital transformation across sectors. The AI Impact Summit 2026 will position Kerala as India’s leading hub for responsible, inclusive, and innovation-driven AI, bringing together global AI leaders, innovators, researchers, industry experts, and policymakers under five core pillars to exchange knowledge and showcase realworld impact across governance, industry, and society, while collectively building a shared roadmap for sustainable and scalable AI deployment.

AI Knowledge Exchange

A thought-leadership arena featuring keynotes, panel discussions, and masterclasses by global AI experts, researchers, and policymakers. The sessions will cover frontier themes such as AI for Public Good, Responsible AI, Generative AI for Governance, AI and Climate Resilience, and AI in Health and Education. This platform will strengthen Kerala’s position as a knowledge hub for ethical and inclusive AI adoption.

AI Innovation Expo

An experiential exhibition showcasing cutting-edge AI products, solutions, and startups. The Expo will include pavilions on AI in Governance, AI for Sustainability, AI in Education and Health, Emerging AI Hardware & Robotics, and AI Startups. It will serve as a vibrant platform for technology demonstration, collaboration, and investment engagement

AI for Governance Forum

A dedicated track to demonstrate how AI is transforming governance in   Kerala. Departments and missions will present live applications and prototypes—  such as predictive analytics in land management, AI-based citizen feedback systems, disaster risk forecasting, and service automation. The State’s Responsible AI Framework and Kerala AI Mission will also be showcased, reinforcing Kerala’s leadership in citizen-centric digital governance.

AI Collaboration Hub

A convergence space for universities, startups, and industries to collaborate on AI research and innovation. The Hub will host signing of MoUs, joint research announcements, and AI fellowship programmes, connecting academia and industry around shared problem statements. It will nurture Kerala’s AI innovation ecosystem and promote translational research.

AI Industry Leadership Round-table (by Kerala IT)

A strategic dialogue led by Kerala IT with industry leaders, GCCs, and technology investors. The Roundtable will discuss AI infrastructure investments, data centre readiness, AI talent development, and policy frameworks. It will culminate in a Kerala AI Industry Charter 2026, outlining joint actions for investment, innovation, and employment in the State’s AI ecosystem.

Nearby Attractions

Padmanabhaswamy Temple

Located in Thiruvananthapuram, this historic temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu is renowned for its Dravidian architecture, spiritual significance, and rich heritage.

Napier Museum & Zoo

A heritage complex featuring Indo-Saracenic  architecture, showcasing Kerala’s art, culture, and natural history, located close to the city centre.

Poovar Backwaters

A serene coastal village where the Neyyar River meets the Arabian Sea, offering golden beaches, mangrove forests, and tranquil backwater cruises

Veli Tourist Village

A popular lakeside destination offering boating, landscaped gardens, and scenic backwaters—perfect for families and leisure visitors.

Azhimala Shiva Temple

A stunning clifftop temple overlooking the Arabian Sea, famous for its towering Shiva statue and peaceful coastal ambience, attracting devotees and visitors alike.

Lighthouse Beach

A world-famous beach known for its crescent-shaped coastline, lighthouse views, and water activities. Ideal for relaxation and seaside experiences.

India AI Impact Summit 2026

Register Now

Venue & Date : Bharat Mandapam, Pragati Maidan, New Delhi | February 2026

About the Conference

The Odisha AI Summit 2025 is a flagship initiative of the Electronics & IT Department, Government of Odisha, showcasing the State’s leadership in responsible and scalable AI adoption. As an official precursor to the India AI Impact Summit 2026, it brings together policymakers, industry leaders, researchers, and practitioners to highlight real-world AI deployments across priority sectors.

As an official pre-event to the India AI Impact Summit 2026, the Odisha AI Summit is hosted in collaboration with the IndiaAI Mission, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India. In addition, Odisha will host one of the eight India AI Impact Summit Working Group Meetings on December 18, 2025, centered on the theme “Democratising AI Resources.” The Odisha AI summit will serve as a platform to formalise strategic AI partnerships, while showcasing live and deployed AI use cases across government departments. Bringing together national and international leaders from policy, industry, academia, and civil society, the event positions Odisha as a model state for responsible, inclusive, and outcome-driven adoption of artificial intelligence.

State Overview

State Overview

Odisha is a state defined by resilience, inclusive growth, and a strong legacy of effective governance. Rich in natural resources, cultural heritage, and human capital, the State has consistently balanced industrial development with social progress and welfare-led outcomes. Over the past decade, Odisha has emerged as a stable and forward-looking destination for investment, backed by strong infrastructure, competitive costs, and transparent governance. Aligned with the national vision of Atmanirbhar Bharat, Digital India, Viksit Bharat 2047, and Samruddh Odisha 2036, the State has taken decisive steps to institutionalise artificial intelligence through the launch of the Odisha AI Policy 2025, being the first state in India to do this. With IT, ITeS, electronics, and emerging technologies at the core of its economic strategy, Odisha is supported by a rapidly growing ecosystem of startups and enterprises, premier academic institutions, robust digital and physical infrastructure, and a strong talent pipeline.

Host City

Host City

Brief context on the host city Bhubaneswar, the capital city of Odisha, is a rapidly growing administrative and technology hub, known for its planned infrastructure, ease of connectivity, and strong public institutions. As the seat of the State Government and a centre for higher education and research, the city offers an ideal setting for policy dialogue, collaboration, and innovation. Bhubaneswar also seamlessly blends modern urban development with a rich cultural and historical heritage.

Chief Secretary

Shri Manoj Ahuja, IAS

Hon’ble Chief Secretary to the Government of Odisha

Shri Manoj Ahuja, IAS, is the Chief Secretary, Government of Odisha, with extensive experience in public finance, infrastructure, power, and industrial development. Prior to his role as Chief Secretary, he served in key positions, including Secretary, Agriculture & Farmers Welfare at the Government of India, Chairman of the Central Board of Secondary Education, and various leadership posts within Odisha, such as Commissioner of Commercial Taxes and Principal Secretary in multiple departments. In Odisha, he is driving coordinated governance reforms and technology-enabled public service delivery, including strengthening AI adoption and administrative modernization. He has played a critical role in strengthening Odisha’s institutional capacity, fiscal management, and digital governance initiatives.

Summit Themes

People

Strengthening human capital by using AI to improve government productivity and widen citizen access to AI tools, with a special focus on developing and sharing low-resource Odia language datasets to enable inclusive, locally relevant AI solutions for students, teachers, MSMEs, and frontline workers.

Planet

Leveraging AI for social good by supporting sustainable and data-driven outcomes in sectors such as agriculture, health, and governance, including improved resource use, resilience, and service delivery.

Progress

Advancing AI-led innovation through scalable deployments, strong institutional frameworks, and collaboration across government, industry, academia, and start-ups, positioning Odisha as a frontrunner in India’s evolving AI ecosystem.

Nearby Attractions

Sun Temple

Sun Temple, Konark A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of Odisha’s most iconic landmarks, the Sun Temple is renowned for its exquisite stone carvings and advanced astronomical design. The sculpted Konark Chakra has become a powerful cultural symbol of the State. Located approximately 65 km from Bhubaneswar.

Chilika Lake

Chilika Lake Asia’s largest brackish water lagoon, Chilika, spans over 1,100 sq. km and is globally recognised as a Ramsar Wetland Site. It is famous for dolphin sightings and as a major wintering ground for migratory birds from Siberia, Central Asia, and the Himalayas. Located about 70 km from Bhubaneswar.

Bhitarkanika National Park

Bhitarkanika National Park, Kendrapara One of India’s most significant wildlife destinations, Bhitarkanika is home to over 1,600 saltwater crocodiles and is the second-largest mangrove ecosystem in the country after the Sundarbans. It is a leading site for crocodile conservation and rich biodiversity. Located approximately 170 km from Bhubaneswar.

Sun Temple

Sun Temple, Konark A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of Odisha’s most iconic landmarks, the Sun Temple is renowned for its exquisite stone carvings and advanced astronomical design. The sculpted Konark Chakra has become a powerful cultural symbol of the State. Located approximately 65 km from Bhubaneswar.

Working Groups At The AI Impact Summit /

Inclusion for Social Empowerment

Inclusion for Social Empowerment Working Group

Advancing AI systems that are inclusive by design, empowering diverse communities and ensuring equitable representation.

Share Your Input

About The Working Group

AI technologies hold immense potential for uplifting all sections of society, including communities that have faced difficulties in being able to meaningfully participate in social and economic development. The Inclusion for Social Empowerment thematic working group aims to enable the development and adoption of inclusive AI for social empowerment of all, ensuring no one is left behind.

Vision & Objectives

Building an equitable global AI ecosystem

Vision

Objectives

The Inclusion for Social Empowerment Working Group will explore pathways that can be used to ensure AI can act as a catalyst for social empowerment. Its focus is to enable participation, expand opportunity, and unlock human potential across languages, abilities, geographies, and cultures. It will centre solutions, capacity building, and scalable models that deliver tangible benefits for all, especially  underserved communities.

Leadership

Mr Rajesh Aggarwal

India Co-Chair

Secretary, Department for Empowerment of Persons with   Disabilities (DEPwD), Ministry for Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of   India

Mr. Rajesh Aggarwal is currently serving as Secretary for the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DEPwD). Across multiple roles at a federal and state level, he has championed the use of technology to improve governance, playing a foundational role in the creation and improvement of the Digilocker, Jeevan Praman and other significant e-governance programmes. Mr. Aggarwal also has a distinguished track record in making public services and infrastructure accessible for persons with disabilities, including ensuring government websites and public spaces are inclusive for all.

Switzerland

Country Co-Chair

Nigeria

Country Co-Chair

Key Issues

Understanding the global AI divide and our approach to bridging it

The Challenge

Translating potential AI-driven benefits into tangible outcomes depends on the readiness of deployers and users to effectively manage and use the technology. This means providing relevant AI literacy, awareness and training to not just beneficiaries, but those who ensure they are available to the beneficiaries – such as last-mile field   workers, educators, administrators and even managers of developers.

The Solution

The fragmented nature of the development of AI tools and initiatives for social empowerment means that at present, effective solutions cannot be replicated or scaled up easily. This emphasises the need for mechanisms to actively share technical   learnings and guidance that can ensure that successful programmes in one region can be translated to others.

The Impact

To ensure that these AI technologies are able to truly deliver their transformative potential, it is important for them to actively account for and accommodate the diverse needs, identities, and experiences of all users, including those from the Global South and from traditionally underserved communities. Efforts to improve inclusivity-by design need to be continued to ensure the improvement of AI systems’ safety, relevance and usability

Meeting Schedule

16th December 2026

Hybrid Meeting (Hyderabad)

Upcoming

Hybrid

Related Pre-Summit Events

Join related events building momentum for the summit

November 14, 2025

CXO Roundtables at Nasscom Technology Confluence 2025

Pune, Mahrashtra

Organized by:

Nasscom

The CXO Roundtables at Nasscom Technology Confluence 2025, held from November 5 to 19 across Pune, Mumbai, Kochi, and Kolkata, gathered senior industry leaders to discuss AI’s role in workforce skilling, resilience, and social impact. Each city focused on themes aligned with the IndiaAI Impact Summit, fostering decentralized dialogue on AI adoption challenges, best practices, and inclusive growth strategies. The roundtables generated actionable insights and regional perspectives to directly inform the IndiaAI Summit, promoting responsible AI integration across India’s industrial hubs.

November 14, 2025

Digital Citizen Summit 2025

Telangana

Organized by:

Digital Empowerment Foundation

Held in partnership with the Department of IT, E&C, Government of Telangana. The summit brought together policymakers, technologists, civil society leaders, and community representatives to reimagine AI, data governance, and platform accountability for equitable, rights-based digital ecosystems. Featuring anthology launches, toolkit releases, and the Just AI Awards 2025, the event advanced dialogue on ethical AI, participatory governance, and community resilience—aligning closely with the IndiaAI Impact Summit’s pillars of Human Capital, Inclusion, and Safe & Trusted AI.

November 13, 2025

Women in the Loop: Shaping the AI Economy session

New Delhi, India

Organized by:

The/Nudge Institute

A high-level dialogue focused on ensuring women’s equitable participation in the AI economy, aligning with the IndiaAI Mission’s Human Capital pillar. Opening with the question, “As AI redefines the nature of work, how do we ensure women are not left behind, but lead this transformation?”, the session explored opportunities and risks for women’s employment, future-ready skilling, and gender-responsive AI design. Featuring cross-sectoral experts, it spotlighted innovative models such as community data labs and women-led digital cooperatives. The event also marked the launch of the Sanmati 2.0 Report on women and digital inclusion.

November 13, 2025

Breaking Barriers: Capacity, Data, and Inclusion in AI

South Africa

Organized by:

Observer Research Foundation

A special dinner conversation jointly hosted by the Observer Research Foundation (ORF) and the South African Institute of International Affairs (SAIIA) at the Think20 South Africa Summit. The session explored how AI can be developed and deployed to reflect the diversity of human experience across languages, cultures, and identities while ensuring equitable global access to AI capabilities. Bringing together policymakers, researchers, and industry leaders, the discussion examined frameworks for inclusive AI governance, capacity-building in the Global South, and collaborative investments enabling sustainable, responsible AI ecosystems.

November 13, 2025

Shaping an Inclusive AI Future: A Fireside with Jessica Jensen

New Delhi

Organized by:

AI Kiran

An exclusive pre-summit fireside chat featuring Jessica Jensen (LinkedIn) in conversation with Kirthiga Reddy. The session brought together senior leaders, CXOs, and policymakers to discuss how AI can drive inclusive growth, workforce transformation, and digital leadership. Building on the IndiaAI Summit 2026 theme of “People, Planet, and Progress”, the dialogue highlighted strategies for equitable access, large-scale skilling, and responsible AI governance, reinforcing collaboration toward a more diverse and inclusive AI ecosystem.

November 8, 2025

Mozilla Festival (MozFest) 2025 : Responsible AI Across Countries -Faculty Practices from Kenya, India, and the U.S

Barcelona, Spain

Organized by:

Mozilla Foundation

The Mozilla Festival (MozFest) 2025 session titled “Responsible AI Across Countries – Faculty Practices from Kenya, India, and the U.S.,” held on November 8, 2025, in Barcelona, focused on practical, low-compute methods for integrating Responsible AI into higher education curricula. Faculty from the three countries shared approaches including multilingual access, lightweight evaluation frameworks, and AI-ready pedagogy aligned with NEP 2020 and digital inclusion. The session supports the AI Impact Summit’s pillars on Human Capital, Inclusion, Safe & Trusted AI, Science, and Democratizing AI Resources, aiming to foster inclusive, equitable AI education worldwide.

November 8, 2025

Women’s Health Futures: Innovation, Equity, and Lifelong Wellbeing

Dr. Ambedkar International Centre

Organized by:

Observer Research Foundation

"The "Women’s Health Futures: Innovation, Equity, and Lifelong Wellbeing" roundtable held on November 8, 2025, in New Delhi, co-organized by the Observer Research Foundation and Manchanda’s Endoscopic Centre, focused on advancing AI and emerging technologies to improve women’s health outcomes across India. The discussion addressed gender disparities, trust, data safety, and policy innovations to promote equitable healthcare. The event aligned with AI Impact Summit pillars on Science and Social Good, culminating in a special report to guide inclusive health policies and cross-sector collaboration.

November 7, 2025

Bridging the AI Divide: India-AI Impact Summit 2026 Pre-Summit Roundtable

Seattle, Washington

Organized by:

Consulate General of India, Seattle

The Bridging the AI Divide roundtable, held on November 7, 2025, at the Consulate General of India in Seattle, convened US Congress members, technology leaders, and Indian stakeholders to discuss advancing inclusive and responsible AI innovation. Expert presentations highlighted India’s AI progress in areas like agri-tech, data infrastructure, and agentic AI, with a focus on strengthening bilateral partnerships for social empowerment and digital collaboration. The event marked the first in a series of sessions building momentum for the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, boosting India’s inclusion agenda and global visibility in AI leadership.

November 6, 2025

BSA AI Pre-Summit Forum on Enabling India’s Enterprise AI Adoption

New Delhi, India

Organized by:

Business Software Alliance (BSA) and Ikigai Law

The BSA AI Pre-Summit Forum on November 6, 2025, at The Claridges, New Delhi, highlighted enterprise AI’s transformative potential in India’s public sector and workforce development. The hybrid event convened policymakers, industry leaders, and think tanks to launch the Enterprise AI Adoption Agenda, promoting responsible AI governance, talent skilling, and inclusive digital innovation. With global participation and sector-specific discussions, the Forum reinforced India’s leadership in safe, trusted, and impactful AI adoption.

October 31, 2025

Emerging Tech-enabled Future for India

New Delhi, India

Organized by:

IBM

Organized by IBM India in New Delhi, this conference highlighted AI and emerging technologies driving India’s digital growth with a focus on inclusion, sustainability, and human capital development. The event featured collaborations like the IBM–AICTE AI Lab and showcased AI skilling impact, fostering partnerships among government, academia, and industry to realize Viksit Bharat 2047

October 31, 2025

Towards Regenerative AI: Frames for Inclusive, Indigenous & Intentional Innovation

Bengaluru, India

Organized by:

IT For Change

On October 31, 2025, IT for Change convened the “Towards Regenerative AI: Frames for Inclusive, Indigenous & Intentional Innovation” conference at the Infosys Science Foundation in Bengaluru. Global scholars, technologists, policymakers, and civil society leaders explored regenerative approaches to AI - centering inclusion, indigeneity, and intentionality to envision equitable, sustainable, and culturally rooted AI futures. The event advanced India’s leadership in just, resilient digital innovation, producing policy briefs, case studies, and cross-sector partnerships for the IndiaAI Impact Summit 2026.

October 22, 2025

Inclusive AI Roundtable Dinner at Consulate General of India, San Francisco

San Francisco

Organized by:

AI Kiran (Verix and Ink Women)

The Inclusive AI Roundtable Dinner, held at the Consulate General of India in San Francisco on October 22, 2025, convened over 30 women leaders from the Indian diaspora driving global AI innovation. Co-hosted by the Consulate and AI Kiran (a Verix and INK Women initiative), the invite-only pre-summit event featured a dialogue on inclusive leadership, workforce transformation, and ethical AI. The discussion advanced collaboration between industry, government, and academia, highlighting India's leadership in responsible AI and aligning with the IndiaAI Summit 2026 themes of Inclusion and Human Capital.

October 3, 2025

Seminar on 'AI Inclusion in India'

Delhi, India

Organized by:

Centre for Policy Research and Governance

The "AI for Inclusion in India" panel discussion organized by the Center of Policy Research and Governance brought together diverse stakeholders, including students, professionals, educators, and civil society to explore AI’s role in promoting access and equitable opportunities. Through two thematic panels, the event focused on diversity and accessibility within the Indian context, grounding discussions in real-world experiences.

September 26, 2025

India – AI Impact Summit: Bridging the AI Divide and Enabling the Democratisation of AI

New York, USA

Organized by:

Aapti Institute & Data2X

Aapti Institute, in partnership with Data2X, hosted a roundtable on Bridging the AI Divide and Enabling the Democratisation of AI. The discussion highlighted global south priorities, the importance of civil society collaboration, and placing people's agency at the centre of AI governance, shaping expectations for the India–AI Impact Summit 2026.

September 19, 2025

Antino AI Summit 2025

Delhi, India

Organized by:

Antino

The Antino AI Summit 2025, themed Synergizing AI with Digital Humanism, explored how AI can drive social good while remaining safe, inclusive, and human-centered. Through keynotes, panels, and startup showcases, participants discussed workforce transformation, democratizing AI access, and ethical practices, fostering collaboration and actionable insights for responsible AI adoption.

September 19, 2025

SAP NOW AI Tour

Delhi, India

Organized by:

SAP Indian Subcontinent

The SAP NOW AI Tour in New Delhi demonstrated how AI can strengthen human capital, promote inclusion, and support safe, trusted, and socially beneficial applications of technology.

October 8-10, 2025

Harnessing the Power of AI: Safe and Ethical Integration

Geneva

Organized by:

GLOBETHICS

The Global Ethics Forum 2025, held in Geneva, convened policymakers, academics, civil society, and industry leaders to explore ethical challenges in governance under the theme “Reinventing Responsible Governance.” The AI track focused on safe and trusted AI and inclusion, featuring plenaries and breakout sessions to generate actionable recommendations for the IndiaAI Impact Summit 2026. The Forum emphasized diverse representation, civil society’s role, and multisectoral dialogue to address AI safety risks and foster inclusive, ethically governed AI systems, producing outcome reports on AI safety and inclusion designed to inform the Summit.

Working Groups At The AI Impact Summit /

Human Capital

Human Capital Working Group

Advancing equitable skilling and inclusive workforce transitions for an AI-enabled future of work.

Share Your Input

About The Working Group

AI is changing the nature of work at an unprecedented pace, creating new opportunities while also disrupting traditional livelihoods. However, realising the full promise of AI requires proactive skilling, adaptive institutions, and forward-looking policies to ensure that its benefits are shared equitably across all regions and income groups. The Human Capital thematic working group will work towards developing an equitable AI reskilling ecosystem that supports inclusive workforce transitions.

Vision & Objectives

Building an equitable global AI ecosystem

Vision

Objectives

The discussions in the Human Capital working group will explore pathways to equip individuals, irrespective of geography, gender, or socio-economic background, with the skills required to participate meaningfully in the evolving AI economy.

Leadership

Prof. TG Sitharam

India Co-Chair

Chairman, All India Council of Technical   Education (AICTE), Govt of India

Prof. (Dr.) T G Sitharam took over as Chairman, All India   Council of Technical Education (AICTE), Govt of India on   December 21, 2022. He is a visionary academic leader   with 35+ years of shaping technical education, skilling,   research, and innovation. He is the architect of scalable,   tech-integrated models, and has spearheaded NEP 2020   reforms, industry partnerships, and national projects. He   has established Centers of Excellence in AI, drones,   cybersecurity, and emerging technologies, transforming   institutions and impacting millions through grassroots   and digital initiatives. With over four decades of pioneering contributions in civil and   geotechnical engineering, infrastructure development, and technical education policy,   Prof. T. G. Sitharam blends scientific depth with nation-building foresight. He is ranked   among the top 2% of scientists globally (Stanford) and is recognized as a rare leader who   bridges academia, government, and community innovation.

Philippines

Country Co-Chair

Rwanda

Country Co-Chair

Key Issues

Understanding the global AI divide and our approach to bridging it

The Challenge

Automation, intelligent systems, and data-driven processes are increasingly taking over   routine and repetitive tasks, reshaping traditional job structures and skill requirements.   While these developments can drive efficiency and innovation, they also risk displacing   segments of the workforce, particularly in labour-intensive and intermediary roles,   potentially widening existing socio-economic divides if not managed carefully.

The Solution

At the same time, many countries, especially in the Global South, face capacity and   resource gaps that constrain their ability to prepare workers for the AI-enabled   economy. This presents an opportunity for the international community to collaborate   on meaningful reskilling initiatives that build workforce readiness for the digital and AI driven future.

The Impact

Ensuring a just and inclusive transition requires prioritising reskilling and upskilling   initiatives that equip individuals affected by automation with the capabilities needed to   adapt to new and emerging roles.

Meeting Schedule

5th-6th January 2026

Hybrid Meeting (Guwahati)

Hybrid

Working Groups At The AI Impact Summit /

Resilience, Innovation, & Efficiency

Resilience, Innovation, & Efficiency Working Group

Driving sustainable, resource-efficient AI systems that strengthen climate resilience and sustainability.

Share Your Input

About The Working Group

The scale of resources consumed by modern AI solutions presents myriad challenges for the environment as well as exacerbates existing AI divide between nations. The Resilience, Innovation & Efficiency working group focuses on advancing resource-conscious and adaptable AI systems that operate effectively in low-resource environments without compromising accessibility or impact. It seeks to embed efficiency and resilience as central principles in AI innovation, ensuring that technological progress remains inclusive, sustainable, and responsive to the diverse needs of all nations.

Vision & Objectives

Building an equitable global AI ecosystem

Vision

Objectives

The Working Group on Resilience, Innovation & Efficiency envisions a future where AI   systems are designed to be efficient, sustainable, and resilient, capable of operating   effectively in varied contexts and with limited resources. It aims to ensure that   efficiency is not seen as a limitation but as a foundation for innovation and accessibility

Leadership

Mr Pankaj Agarwal

India Co-Chair

Secretary, Ministry of Power, Government of India

Shri Pankaj Agarwal, Secretary, Ministry of Power,   Government of India, has been a key architect of   India’s energy transition, driving reforms focused   on sustainability, efficiency, and innovation. With   extensive experience in public policy,   infrastructure, and digital transformation, he brings a unique perspective to the   Working Group—linking AI efficiency with energy resilience and national development,   and reinforcing India’s commitment to responsible, resource-conscious AI that delivers   sustainable impact.

France

Country Co-Chair

Key Issues

Understanding the global AI divide and our approach to bridging it

The Challenge

The increasing scale of AI development has led to growing environmental and accessibility concerns. Training large-scale AI models demands enormous energy and water resources, with global data centres projected to consume nearly 3% of the world’s electricity by 2030.

The Solution

AI’s energy intensity contributes to higher carbon emissions, while its water footprint adds stress in already water-scarce regions. These challenges make resource-heavy AI systems unviable for many parts of the Global South, deepening the global divide in AI innovation and adoption.

The Impact

Addressing this imbalance requires a shift towards efficiency as a design value and building AI systems that do more with less. By prioritizing lightweight architectures, optimized computation, and sustainable infrastructure, the Working Group aims to enable an inclusive AI ecosystem that is resilient, adaptable, and globally beneficial.

Meeting Schedule

16th-20th January 2026

Hybrid Meeting (Bengaluru) [Tentative]

Upcoming

Hybrid

Bengaluru, Karnataka

Organized by:

"The ""From Action to Impact: India–France AI Policy Roundtable"" held on November 7, 2025, at IISc Bengaluru, brought together policymakers, researchers, and industry leaders from India and France to advance bilateral AI cooperation. The roundtable focused on equitable access to AI infrastructure, reducing dependency on global monopolies, and fostering inclusive, secure, and sustainable innovation ecosystems. Co-chaired by Anne Bouverot, Special Envoy of France for AI, and Amit A. Shukla from India's MEA, the dialogue continued the Track 1.5 series, underpinning the India-AI Impact Summit 2026 and the India–France Year of Innovation 2026. It emphasized India’s robust AI ecosystem as a platform for co-development and strengthened global partnerships in responsible AI governance."

The GreenMind Sustainable AI Hackathon, held across Bengaluru and online from October 31 to November 15, 2025, was India’s pioneering large-scale challenge focused on sustainable, climate-conscious AI. Organized by the Green Computing Foundation with top industry and government partners, the event brought together over 500 teams from academia, startups, and corporates to develop AI innovations minimizing environmental impact. Bengaluru

The summit aimed to bridge government, industry, and research efforts to accelerate AI-driven climate innovation aligned with India’s developmental and net-zero goals. Preceded by an official pre-summit dialogue in Delhi, the event fostered actionable insights and collaborative momentum for scaling AI-powered climate solutions, directly supporting the “Planet” and “Progress” themes of the India–AI Impact Summit 2026.

October 15, 2025

Delhi, India

The INFINITY 2025 conference at Amity Business School, Amity University Noida, focused on "Humanizing AI," emphasizing ethical intelligence, responsible innovation, and resilient systems. The announcement featured key dignitaries including Union Ministers Ashwini Vaishnaw and Nirmala Sitharaman, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Nara Chandrababu Naidu, and Google CEO Thomas Kurian. Delhi, India

Organized by:

AI for Disaster Management | Drones

Dehradun

Organized by:

Organized by:

Working Groups At The AI Impact Summit /

Democratizing AI Resources

Democratizing AI Resources Working Group

Promoting equitable access to foundational AI resources for inclusive innovation and sustainable development worldwide

Share Your Input

About The Working Group

The growing demands of AI development require vast resources that are unevenly concentrated worldwide today, reinforcing global inequalities in innovation capacity. TheDemocratizing AI Resources Working Group aims to promote access and affordability tofoundational AI resources for all, which would facilitate contextualized development,deployment, and use of AI by all, in accordance with their national objectives and priorities.

Vision & Objectives

Building an equitable global AI ecosystem

Vision

Objectives

The Working Group on Democratizing AI Resources envisions a global AI ecosystem where access to foundational enablers of AI development is equitable and affordable for all. It seeks to ensure that every nation can meaningfully participate in and benefit from the AI revolution.

Leadership

Mr Saurabh Garg

India Co-Chair

Secretary, Ministry of Statistics & Programme Implementation (MoSPI), Government of India

Dr. Saurabh Garg is currently serving as Secretary, Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI), Government of India. He has played a leading role in shaping India’s digital governance landscape - most notably as CEO of the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI), where he advanced the Aadhaar programme and its integration with welfare delivery systems. Over his career, Dr Garg has worked extensively on infrastructure financing, digital transformation, and economic reforms, contributing to initiatives on Direct Benefit Transfers, FDI policy, and governance innovation at the national and state levels.

Egypt

Country Co-Chair

Kenya

Country Co-Chair

Key Issues

Understanding the global AI divide and our approach to bridging it

The Challenge

The uneven distribution of AI resources has created a widening global divide in AI capability and innovation. Limited access to affordable compute and data risks leaving many nations behind as passive users rather than active contributors to the AI economy.

The Solution

Democratization of AI resources can address this imbalance by promoting open infrastructure that supports inclusive AI innovation. It can also mitigate risks arising from over-concentration of AI capabilities and enhance AI systems' global representativeness, transparency, and resilience.

The Impact

By expanding equitable access to AI resources and fostering multilateral collaboration, this effort can diversify innovation, accelerate socio-economic development, and ensure that the benefits of AI are broadly shared - advancing the AI Impact Summit’s vision of inclusive, responsible, and sustainable AI for all.

Join related events building momentum for the summit

November 13, 2025

Breaking Barriers: Capacity, Data, and Inclusion in AI

South Africa

Organized by:

Observer Research Foundation

A special dinner conversation jointly hosted by the Observer Research Foundation (ORF) and the South African Institute of International Affairs (SAIIA) at the Think20 South Africa Summit. The session explored how AI can be developed and deployed to reflect the diversity of human experience across languages, cultures, and identities while ensuring equitable global access to AI capabilities. Bringing together policymakers, researchers, and industry leaders, the discussion examined frameworks for inclusive AI governance, capacity-building in the Global South, and collaborative investments enabling sustainable, responsible AI ecosystems.

November 13, 2025

AI Impact Summit 2026: India at the Strategic Crossroads

Oxfordshire

Organized by:

Blavatnik School of Government, University of Oxford

The roundtable aligned with the India AI Impact Summit 2026 themes of People, Planet, and Progress, highlighting India’s leadership in advancing responsible AI governance globally. It examined how AI policies promoted equitable human capital development, drove sustainability and ethical resource management, and strengthened global innovation, security, and cooperation. The session generated a policy brief capturing key insights, frameworks for global AI collaboration, and recommendations to guide future India–UK and international engagements. These outcomes informed deliberations at the India AI Impact Summit 2026 and contributed to shaping multilateral dialogues on AI ethics and governance.

November 11, 2025

U.S.-India AI & Technology Cooperation Dialogue

New Delhi, India

Organized by:

Special Competitive Studies Project & ORF

The U.S.–India AI & Technology Cooperation Dialogue, held from November 11 to 13, 2025 at The Oberoi New Delhi, was a high-level conference co-chaired by Mr. Mathew Oommen (India) and Hon. Kenneth Juster (U.S.). It aimed to deepen bilateral collaboration on AI and emerging tech by focusing on strengthening infrastructure, fostering applied AI solutions, building a robust talent pipeline, and aligning ethical AI policies. The dialogue reinforced shared commitments to Safe & Trusted AI, Human Capital, and Resilient Infrastructure, supported by major private investments and academic partnerships. This collaboration created a trusted AI corridor combining India’s talent and infrastructure with U.S. capabilities for responsible AI governance.

November 11, 2025

Developing a National Digital Data Marketplace for Building Resilient and Accessible AI Training Databases

New Delhi, India

Organized by:

Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas

The roundtable held on November 11, 2025, at Taj Mahal, New Delhi, focused on developing a National Digital Data Marketplace (NDDM) as a government-facilitated platform for secure, transparent buying and selling of datasets. The discussion involved government, industry, academia, and civil society stakeholders exploring themes like data democratization, sovereignty, ethical AI, and governance. Building on existing initiatives such as NDAP and Open Government Data Platform, the roundtable aimed to define the purpose, governance, and key use cases of the NDDM across sectors like health, agriculture, climate, and urban mobility, aligning policy and privacy principles with the DPDP Act. It was hosted by Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas.

November 10, 2025

Road to the AI Action Summit Roundtable

London, United Kingdom

Organized by:

OpenUK

The Road to the AI Action Summit Roundtable, held on November 10, 2025, in London, convened enterprise leaders, open-source contributors, policymakers, and academics to discuss the role of openness in AI for innovation, inclusion, and safe adoption. Hosted by OpenUK, the in-person event promoted cross-sector and UK–India collaboration on responsible AI governance, feeding local insights into the global AI Impact Summit agenda. Key outcomes included a joint AI Openness report and strengthened UK–India partnerships to advance open, inclusive, and impactful AI ecosystems.

November 8, 2025

Mozilla Festival (MozFest) 2025 : Responsible AI Across Countries -Faculty Practices from Kenya, India, and the U.S

Barcelona, Spain

Organized by:

Mozilla Foundation

The Mozilla Festival (MozFest) 2025 session titled “Responsible AI Across Countries – Faculty Practices from Kenya, India, and the U.S.,” held on November 8, 2025, in Barcelona, focused on practical, low-compute methods for integrating Responsible AI into higher education curricula. Faculty from the three countries shared approaches including multilingual access, lightweight evaluation frameworks, and AI-ready pedagogy aligned with NEP 2020 and digital inclusion. The session supports the AI Impact Summit’s pillars on Human Capital, Inclusion, Safe & Trusted AI, Science, and Democratizing AI Resources, aiming to foster inclusive, equitable AI education worldwide.

November 07, 2025

From Action to Impact: India-France AI Policy Roundtable

Bengaluru, Karnataka

Organized by:

Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru

"The ""From Action to Impact: India–France AI Policy Roundtable"" held on November 7, 2025, at IISc Bengaluru, brought together policymakers, researchers, and industry leaders from India and France to advance bilateral AI cooperation. The roundtable focused on equitable access to AI infrastructure, reducing dependency on global monopolies, and fostering inclusive, secure, and sustainable innovation ecosystems. Co-chaired by Anne Bouverot, Special Envoy of France for AI, and Amit A. Shukla from India's MEA, the dialogue continued the Track 1.5 series, underpinning the India-AI Impact Summit 2026 and the India–France Year of Innovation 2026. It emphasized India’s robust AI ecosystem as a platform for co-development and strengthened global partnerships in responsible AI governance."

November 7, 2025

Bridging the AI Divide: India-AI Impact Summit 2026 Pre-Summit Roundtable

Seattle, Washington

Organized by:

Consulate General of India, Seattle

The Bridging the AI Divide roundtable, held on November 7, 2025, at the Consulate General of India in Seattle, convened US Congress members, technology leaders, and Indian stakeholders to discuss advancing inclusive and responsible AI innovation. Expert presentations highlighted India’s AI progress in areas like agri-tech, data infrastructure, and agentic AI, with a focus on strengthening bilateral partnerships for social empowerment and digital collaboration. The event marked the first in a series of sessions building momentum for the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, boosting India’s inclusion agenda and global visibility in AI leadership.

November 5, 2025

Shaping the Future of AI and DPI: A Consultative Workshop

Western Cape, South Africa

Organized by:

Digital Impact Alliance (DIAL)

The “Shaping the Future of AI and DPI: A Consultative Workshop” held on November 5, 2025, at the Cape Town International Convention Centre convened stakeholders from government, philanthropy, industry, academia, and civil society. Co-designed with the Gates Foundation and supported by UN and ITU facilitators, the workshop focused on aligning AI innovation with Digital Public Infrastructure to drive equitable, sustainable global digital development. The workshop will produce a white paper, foster ongoing dialogue, and set a consensus roadmap to integrate AI and DPI strategies in international development.

October 31, 2025

Towards Regenerative AI: Frames for Inclusive, Indigenous & Intentional Innovation

Bengaluru, India

Organized by:

IT For Change

On October 31, 2025, IT for Change convened the “Towards Regenerative AI: Frames for Inclusive, Indigenous & Intentional Innovation” conference at the Infosys Science Foundation in Bengaluru. Global scholars, technologists, policymakers, and civil society leaders explored regenerative approaches to AI - centering inclusion, indigeneity, and intentionality to envision equitable, sustainable, and culturally rooted AI futures. The event advanced India’s leadership in just, resilient digital innovation, producing policy briefs, case studies, and cross-sector partnerships for the IndiaAI Impact Summit 2026.

October 24, 2025

AI Fusion @ Kakinada 2025

Kakinada, Andhra Pradesh

Organized by:

DeepTech Naipunya Foundation

AI Fusion @ Kakinada 2025 marked the first major AI summit in the Godavari region, uniting innovators, startups, industry leaders, and policymakers to explore artificial intelligence's transformative power beyond India's metro cities. Hosted by the DeepTech Naipunya Foundation, the conference spotlighted inclusive innovation, human capital development, and ethical AI adoption—positioning Kakinada as a rising hub for India's AI-driven regional transformation.

October 15, 2025

Bengaluru

Organized by:

Qualcomm India

The Qualcomm Innovation Forum 2025 held in Bengaluru featured keynotes, panels, and demos emphasizing on-device and edge AI technologies, workforce development, frugal innovation, and ethical AI governance. It engaged over 1,300 participants across academia, industry, government, and civil society, spotlighting real-world AI applications in healthcare, education, agriculture, and public safety. The event produced actionable policy briefs, developer toolkits, and strategic vision reports to advance responsible AI innovation and ecosystem collaboration in India.

Delhi, India

Google

The announcement featured key dignitaries including Union Ministers Ashwini Vaishnaw and Nirmala Sitharaman, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Nara Chandrababu Naidu, and Google CEO Thomas Kurian. This investment aims to accelerate AI-driven transformation in India by deploying advanced AI infrastructure, renewable energy, and expanded connectivity.

New York, USA

Delhi, India

Discussions focused on scalable digital infrastructure, enabling global collaboration for Indian startups, and policy measures to support inclusive and internationally connected AI innovation ahead of the India–AI Impact Summit 2026.

New York, USA

The Observer Research Foundation, in partnership with the United Nations in India and the Reliance Foundation, hosted a high-level panel on At the Heart of Development: Aid, Trade, and Technology. The discussion focused on how emerging technologies, including AI, can advance the Sustainable Development Goals and support global social good initiatives.
